story:
Who We Are:

Aloha,

Welcome to the Hawaii Urban Training (HUT) sandbox facility development funding campaign. Hawaii Urban Training is a community based functional fitness and wellness free community group running out of Hilo, Hawaii. HUT originally started in Korea as Busan Urban Training founded by both Dharma Shay and Scottie Hoang. HUT is currently just a group of dedicated fitness practitioners, but is working on both a for profit side of HUT to help support the current non-profit HUT model. HUT is currently working on becoming a non-profit 501c3. The initial purpose of the group was to get people moving and active, but over the past two years with the expansion of the HUT, we have seen good intentions become a movement of active change! HUT currently runs 14 sessions a week all free of charge. At HUT our only currency is your effort, sweat, and determination. At this point we have hosted over 300 session and are only adding more, completely free of charge. We do what we do because we love what we do. We love the our community. We love the #HUTOHANA!.

The Plan:
The HUTSTRONG facility is the next step in our evolution. For our longevity and the scale of service we offer, we plan to ensure HUT will be their for the long run.The facility will allow HUT to have a headquarters to  facilitate workshops, house gear, provide services, and develop fitness and wellness professionals within the community and beyond. So, what will the HUT facility offer? Exactly what our community needs and that is why we will continue to ask you and provide. The HUTSTRONG HQ sets a new standard, where we provide equal service to our community in service and philanthropy. We believe in the HUT movement and have already invested $5,500 on our own as instructors, and plan to give more, because we do believe in the power of community directed wellness. All contributions will help the HUT TEAM in purchasing the estimated $7,500-$10,000 worth of fitness gear, that will be utilized to run the facility and get people moving on the field. The facility will be geared to be a fully functional fitness facility. 
The facility is located in downtown Hilo near Benjamin Franklin in the old computer part warehouse. The facility is 2,500 sq ft with high roofs, and currently concrete floors. 
You can expect to see gear such as:
Battle Ropes, Climbing Ropes, Sleds, Boxes, Olympic Bars, Bumper Plates, Suspension Bands, Lifting Bands, Monkey Bars, Squat Racks, Big Tires,and more.
You can also expect to see these additional sessions:
Athletic Training, Female Self Defense Classes, Yoga/Stretching/Mobility Classes, Fencing, General Self Defence (no MMA), Senior Strength Development, Bariatric HUT, and more. 
You will see directly where your funds go and experience the benefit it has on the community. As we have in the past with the Mayhem on the Bay event (raised over $4,000 in a month and a half), we will keep all the receipts posted on the page so you are aware of what was purchased and how it will be used. We estimate the facility will require $7,500-$10,000 worth of gear, of which $5,500 have already been invested, and in addition the remodeling of the facility may take up to $5,000. In light of the cost we ask the community to donate what they wish to get out of HUT, invest in your communities health and take part in its improvements. When it comes down to it, your contribution will make the difference in what your community fitness group can provide you.
To start the campaign off strong Eldridge Shay donated $500 cash upon discussing the overall plans and walking the facility. Eldridge, we appreciate your donation sir and your strong work ethic with HUT and in life. 
With so little the HUT team has done so much and we plan to do so much more! If we don't meet our goal, the funds will still go towards the facility. This is what we do and believe in, so the facility will come to life. We will also need materials and on hand help to see the building gear and the facility. All donations count and help us in achieving our overall goal. What we are asking is for you to believe, and to take that next step with us in seeing the HUTSTRONG facility through. 
If you are interested in teaching at the HUT facility or investing in the facility as an investor, please shoot us a message on the Facebook page and we will get back to you ASAP. If you would like to see a HUT like group in your town, please let us know. 
https://www.facebook.com/HawaiiUrbanTraining
Mahalo for your time and contribution!

Mahalo for your time and contribution!

story:
Lily’s Story

Hi everyone! Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign! I’m a little rat terrier with a powerful and well-trained nose! I’m so happy that I was rescued by Bed Bug Detection Services since my past life was at a local shelter which wasn’t fun for me. I can only work 6 hours a day so I can’t wait till we rescue more dog just like me to join us! I went to school at the Florida Canine Academy and I am a certified bed bug detection dog! Now, I’m in my forever home, have a great time with my continuing training, and have a fabulous time sniffing out bed bugs to help people! Because who wants to be bitten by bed bugs, right? Being a part of BBDS is perfect for me, and I know other dogs would love to have the same opportunities that I had! Please help us rescue other dogs to join our team!

Why we rescue dogs…

“A dog is not a thing. A thing is replaceable. A dog is not. A thing is disposable. A dog is not. A thing doesn’t have a heart. A dog’s heart is bigger than any ’thing’ you can ever own.” -Elizabeth Parker. 

The Humane Society of the United States estimates that more than 6-8 million dogs are cared for in shelters every year in our country. Of those 6-8 million, approximately 3-4 million are euthanized. These numbers are overwhelming and heart breaking. Here at Bed Bug Detection Services, we are dedicated to rescue all of the dogs we use to detect bed bugs. We not only save them from the possibility of euthanasia, but we provide them with a loving, safe home and a fulfilling life that they all so greatly deserve.

The Funding…

We are asking for funding so we can rescue as many dogs as we can to join Lily in the fight against bed bugs. Our dogs only work a maximum of 6 hours a day so to keep up with the needs of our community, we need to rescue more dogs. The funds would be distributed for expenses such as:

  • Full-time handler (each new rescue dog requires his/her own handler)

  • A vehicle with ice cold air, a necessity in Florida

  • A comfortable place to sleep

  • Marketing 

  • Office space

The Impact…

“Saving one dog will not change the world, but surely for that one dog, the world will change forever.” -Karen Davison. 

Bed Bug Detection Services wants to do just that: change the world for as many dogs as we can. With your donation, we can rescue a dog and give them the fulfilled life they deserve.  There are so many breeds that get such joy out of working and making their owners happy that we not only will be saving a life, but we will be providing that dog with a very fulfilling existence while protecting our community, hospitals, nursing homes, assisted living facilities and more.

Who is Bed Bug Detection Services?

Bed Bug Detection Services uses canines to sniff out bed bugs and keep your home, business and facility safe! We are very passionate about making sure that our community feels and is safe from these little blood suckers! All of our dog handlers are certified through the Florida Canine Academy, as well as all of our dogs. We also follow the guidelines and protocols set in place by AHCA and keep health care facilities in compliance to avoid any unnecessary issues. 

Understanding bedbugs and our detection canines…

Bed bugs hide during most of the day. Their preferred hiding spot is in tiny crevices and cracks – dark places where you don’t see them. Then at night, they come out to feed primarily on humans but also on our pets! Often, you don’t realize you have bed bugs until the area has been overwhelmingly infested with them.

Our detection dogs are always on the hunt based on scent, so it doesn’t matter if the bed bugs are in hiding. The dog is trained to detect live bed bugs and viable eggs. The added benefit is that after an area is treated for bed bugs, the dogs can come back into an area and confirm it worked!

Dogs trained to locate bed bugs typically have a 97% accuracy rate. Compared with humans who average 30-40% accuracy, the detection dog is the way to go. The dog’s ability to locate as few as one bed bug in a hotel room gives you the valuable tool of early detection before bed bugs become a massive and invasive problem.

Other ways you can help…

We understand that not everyone can support us financially, so if you are able, please help us spread the word about Lily and Bed Bug Detection Services and our want to rescue another dog by sharing this with everyone you know.

story:
*** WE DID IT!!! AND WE ARE STILL GOING! ***

I am sincerely grateful to everyone who believed in me and this effort: we reached our target! BUT - the campaign is still going, and what's even better is that it is now a cooperative campaign!

Instituto Elos informed me that some young Warriors-to-be from Zimbabwe, South Africa and Guinea Bissau, are having trouble raising the funds needed for them to join the program. As we are all in this together, and as the success of Warriors Without Weapons depends on all of us being able to attend, everything extra I raise will go to them! I can't think of anything better than sharing this campaign with fellow Warriors who might not have the means and tools that I have at my disposal. We have until December 26th - thank you from the bottom of my heart!

***


Hello and welcome to my campaign page!

  • Who am I?

My name is Eirini, I am from Greece, and I am asking for your support to help me attend the Warriors Without Weapons training program and help transform people's lives, starting in Brazil!

To learn a little bit more about me, you can watch my Warriors Without Weapons application video & also visit my blog, Peace's Compass!


I am the first Greek to have ever been accepted into the program, which has been running since 1999.

  • Where: Santos, São Paulo, Brazil
  • When: January 6th to February 7th, 2014

  • What is Warriors Without Weapons?

In one short sentence, Warriors Without Weapons is about materializing collective dreams, and actively changing people's lives. 

Warriors Without Weapons is an intensive, 32-day, experiential international training program, providing participants with the tools needed to transform lives anywhere in the world. The program is run by Instituto Elos, and consists of a 7-step methodology that is applied to three different communities in Baixada Santista, Santos, São Paulo, Brazil.

These communities are faced with daily struggles and social injustices. The participants of the program, 60 'warriors' from over 15 different countries worldwide, work with the people in the communities and in one month, actively change their lives. They bring them together, encourage them to share their dreams of the community, and create plans of how to materialize these dreams. Resources are then found from within the community (through upcycling, recycling, reusing), and everyone together starts building those dreams: garbage is turned into playgrounds, and debris into community buildings.

You can watch the following short video outlining the program, as well as this full-length documentary on the work of the Warriors:


  • Costs:
Airfare: My Athens- São Paulo roundtrip ticket costs approximately €1,100 (price based on tickets available on Nov. 27, 2013)
Program Fee:  The total cost for each warrior is R$11,000 (Brazilian real) and Instituto Elos covers half of this amount through fundraising and partnerships. The other half is the responsibility of each participant. That means, they rely on me to pay R$5,500, which corresponds to €1,750 (currency exchange rate on Nov 23). This fee includes: the program’s running cost, accommodation, meals, and transportation in Santos.
Total: €2,850

  • Why do I want to go?

I believe in change, I believe in dreams, and I believe in action. And when actions and dreams are combined, miracles happen. I've seen the documentaries, read everything there is to read about this program, met the Elos Foundation Netherlands team, and I believe that these people are making miracles happen in communities that are in desperate need of change. And change can be real for them: all they need is 60 enthusiastic foreigners from every corner of the world telling them that they can do it.

I want to learn how to encourage people to take ownership of their lives, and create real, positive change. Bringing that methodology back to my country at a time when it needs it the most is an invaluable asset, both for the Greek communities and me personally. 

  • What do you get?

First of all, my uttermost gratitude - your generosity is helping fulfill not only the dreams of 3 Brazilian communities, but also that of a young Greek dreamer, out to make the world a better place! But other than my gratitude, I also created a lot of fun and interesting perks for you! THANK YOU from the bottom of my heart - I am truly grateful to share my journey with all of you.

  • I can't do it without your support!

Whether or not I will go, depends on you! This campaign runs on fixed funding, which means all of the contributions will be refunded if I don't reach my target by the day after Christmas!

  • There are other ways you can help:

If you believe in this cause as much as I do, please share my campaign page link with people who will be interested in supporting it! Think about the optimists, dreamers, and doers in your life, and let them know about this campaign!

THANK YOU! OBRIGADA!! ΕΥΧΑΡΙΣΤΩ!!!

story:
You spoke we listened...after completing one of Indiegogo's most successful campaigns the cards, letters and press kept coming.  Today we are not only proud to announce that we have reached a HUGE milestone with 100,000 likes on Facebook but simultaneously we are launching IGG-2!

Indiegogo-2 is a limited time opportunity, for those who participated in IGG-1 as well as those who may have missed it, to join the Pet-Tech Revolution and secure one of the most innovative and game changing pet interaction and relationship enhancing solutions ever created! Interested? Read on and prepare to be WOWWED!

 


 

 

  

 

Transparent to the user, PetziConnect operates upon a 128-/256-bit encrypted, proprietary transport layer that blanket secures our three PZ modules - Portal (mobile or web), Cloud, and PetziConnect device. By building out the Petzila architecture from the bottom up, we ensure secure access and peace of mind at all times. 

 

 

 

 

 

"Petzila Waves Bye Bye to the Babysitter" - Marware.

"Beam me up, Petzila" - Paws Tech Magazine.

"Video Conference with your Dog ..." - Cult of Mac.

"Petzila – организуем «видеочат» со своим четвероногим другом" / "Organize a Chat with your Four-legged Friend" - Tech Touch.

"videochatten met je hond voor een koekje" / "Video chat with your dog for a cookie" - iPhone club.

"Petzila Allows You to Stay in Touch With Your Pet All Day" - TrendHunter.

"Petzila takes the Edge off Separation Anxiety" - ChipChick.

"Be Close to Your Pet While Away with Petzila" - Techmash. 

 

 

info@petzila.com                      simon@petzila.com                    david@petzila.com

 

 

Founded in the heart of Silicon Valley, Petzila cofounders Simon Milner and Dave Clark both recognized the benefits of technology but realized how little technology there was related to something they both loved, their pets!

One night while out to dinner chatting and sharing pictures from their smartphones they inevitably came across pictures of their pets. Next thing they knew everyone wanted to see, even total strangers. Simon turned to Dave and said, "Ya know, why can’t we introduce our pets live and in real time with our smartphones?"

The wheels started turning ...

Both being veterans of companies large and small, new and old, public and private and both having brought products from concept to market that millions are currently enjoying today, it was a good question!

They were shocked when they searched for existing solutions and found none, with the exception of the larger home security offerings touting the ability to check on your pet, which they thought was great if you were watching the video stream while your pet walked by. But where was the interactive joy in that?

There had to be a way to get their pets on the net and create a truly interactive experience with a reward, a moment of joy? 

They thought...Heck if Pavlov could do it with a treat, why couldn’t we?

Many long conversations and lots of research later they both took the leap and committed full time to launching the pet-tech revolution and creating what is now Petzila.

As an aside, the first night that Dave took home the PetziConnect initial prototype, not only did his dogs respond exactly as expected to his girlfriends voice (their real master) but upon receiving the dispensed treat the dogs were immediately hooked. Zero learning curve. 

Unfortunately, upstairs Dave’s girlfriend took to the experience equally as enthusiastically. Dave literally had to go downstairs and unplug the device so that he and the dogs could get some sleep as her phone battery was showing no signs of running out. That night one of the dogs actually slept downstairs by the unit:-)

The result of over 18 months of research and developmetn is; PetziConnect - the first salvo in the pet-tech revolution and just the beginning of the vision that is Petzila.

Come join us! Ohhh, and dont forget to like us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/Petzila

"videochatten met je hond voor een koekje" / "Video chat with your dog for a cookie" - iPhone club.
"Petzila Allows You to Stay in Touch With Your Pet All Day" - TrendHunter. 
"Petzila takes the Edge off Separation Anxiety" - ChipChick.
"Be Close to Your Pet While Away with Petzila" - Techmash. 
 
 



info@petzila.com                      simon@petzila.com                    david@petzila.com

 
 



Founded in the heart of Silicon Valley, Petzila cofounders Simon Milner and Dave Clark both recognized the benefits of technology but realized how little technology there was related to something they both loved, their pets!
One night while out to dinner chatting and sharing pictures from their smartphones they inevitably came across pictures of their pets. Next thing they knew everyone wanted to see, even total strangers. Simon turned to Dave and said, "Ya know, why can’t we introduce our pets live and in real time with our smartphones?"
The wheels started turning ...
Both being veterans of companies large and small, new and old, public and private and both having brought products from concept to market that millions are currently enjoying today, it was a good question!
They were shocked when they searched for existing solutions and found none, with the exception of the larger home security offerings touting the ability to check on your pet, which they thought was great if you were watching the video stream while your pet walked by. But where was the interactive joy in that?
There had to be a way to get their pets on the net and create a truly interactive experience with a reward, a moment of joy? 
They thought...Heck if Pavlov could do it with a treat, why couldn’t we?
Many long conversations and lots of research later they both took the leap and committed full time to launching the pet-tech revolution and creating what is now Petzila.
As an aside, the first night that Dave took home the PetziConnect initial prototype, not only did his dogs respond exactly as expected to his girlfriends voice (their real master) but upon receiving the dispensed treat the dogs were immediately hooked. Zero learning curve. 
Unfortunately, upstairs Dave’s girlfriend took to the experience equally as enthusiastically. Dave literally had to go downstairs and unplug the device so that he and the dogs could get some sleep as her phone battery was showing no signs of running out. That night one of the dogs actually slept downstairs by the unit:-)
The result of over 18 months of research and developmetn is; PetziConnect - the first salvo in the pet-tech revolution and just the beginning of the vision that is Petzila. 
Come join us! Ohhh, and dont forget to like us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/Petzila

story:
A familiar story of abuse: 

Laura thought she knew him, they had been friends for years. When the romance hit she wasn't even surprised. Sure, sell her house, move away from her family - of course she loved him and they were happy. 
Shortly after giving birth to Jimmy the abuse began. First it was shouting outbursts, and throwing objects around the house. Then it escalated to throwing objects at her, and physically beating her. The police were called numerous times, but laws in the area along with some cliche good ole boy mentality meant take him out of the house to cool off and no jail time. Some of the deputies offered assistance but in the area they were in options were limited at best.
The night he tried to choke her to death was the first time the police actually threatened him with jail. From then on he was out of the house, unfortunately the law in the south is allowing him to keep his son in the state because his job is there and he pays support. Laura can not find steady work due to a bad economy and she and Jimmy are trapped.
He is now losing his job and the courts have said that once that tie is broken she can leave the state. She is hoping to return home but has a small window to pack up meager belongings, make the trip, and then once she gets home find work and a home for them. In the time she lived out of state her parents have passed but she has friends and family here and we need to get her home. 
Please, will you help us bring Laura and Jimmy home?

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $15,000 to cover costs:

  • Pay out of current lease
  • Repair vehicle to make long drive
  • Rent trailer for belongings
  • Travel (gas, tolls, motel stays)
  • Pay legal fees/court costs
  • Pay deposit and 1st month rent once home
  • Have at least a three month cushion for bills so Laura can find work as she will not be getting child support any longer
If the entire goal is not reached all funds collected will still go toward getting Laura home as cheaply as possible. Obviously if we don't raise the full amount there won't be a cushion, but we need to get as much as possible so we can bring a mother and her child home to family and friends. 
Of course we are all also donating, but the more people who can help, the more likely we are to succeed.  Even a donation of $5 can help Laura and Jimmy get home to us.
What is in it for you? Well, some say Karma (the good kind), some say a sense of doing a good thing, others say its doing a charitable deed. All we know is you will be in our thoughts and prayers for a lifetime. 

Imagine if this was your loved one, you would do everything you could. We have done all we can to support them for years now and we need help to get this last 1000 miles. 

We didn't expect the window of opportunity but its here and we need to make this happen!!

    If you are not able to donate you can still help by sharing this campaign with your own friends and family, but remember any amount helps. Spread the word and share Laura's story. 

    Let's get Laura and Jimmy home!!

story:
The Buffalo Soldier Campgrounds is located on a 10 acre tract of land located in the inner city at 3534 E. Berry Street in Fort Worth, Texas.  The development will address and focus on problems youth deal with on a daily basis in their communities and schools which are still suffering greatly from the problems created by bullying, low-self esteem, lack of appreciation for education and cultural diversity.  Activities will include horse back riding, archery, teepee camp-out experiences and educational presentations throughout the year. Programs such as this will not only educate the youth, but entire families and instill a strong measure of self-esteem by knowing that their ancestors played an important and positive role in history.  The Buffalo Soldier Camp program aims to provide tools to students through diversity education to help them overcome prejudice and discrimination. 

The Buffalo Soldier Campgrounds is an extension of Fort Worth's National Multicultural Western Heritage Museum (formerly Cowboys of Color Museum) which was founded to give recognition to the “forgotten cowboys” of multicultural ancestry who played a role in settling the early American western frontier.  The National Multicultural Western Heritage Museum acknowledges a diverse group of individuals who continue the legacy of western culture, tradition and play a part in keeping this important piece of American History alive. The Museum offers a true and complete historical perspective of the people and activities that built the unique culture of the Old West.  The work of artists who documented the people and events of the time through journals, photographs and other historical items are part of the collection.  The NMWHM created an indoor and outdoor learning center in partnership with educators to ensure the content developed met the state requirements for reading and writing proficiency skills as well as other educational requirements.  The program builds reading, writing, researching skills, healthy self-esteem and respect for their ancestors and other cultures. For more information, please visit www.cowboysofcolor.org . 

Check out our Indiegogo gallery to see all of our terrific donation perks!

story:
Consider funding a public good. The GCAS Public Lecture Series on The Philosophy of Gilles Deleuze

The Global Center for Advanced Studies (GCAS) is a non-profit school organized to create debt-free democratic education for the global commons.  No one on GCAS's Board of Directors is paid, we are all volunteering our time to make this education revolution for justice happen.  With your help we can do this together.  Donations are not tax deductible.

We are asking for small $5 contributions to help support our GCAS Free Public Lecture Series directed by one of the foremost scholars on Gilles Deleuze, Dorothea Olkowski.  We have already benefited from lectures by Daniel Smith, Lyat Friedman, and Olkowski.  This campaign will ensure that our series continues throughout the academic year 2015-2016.  

Why This is Important:

In today's neoliberal academy knowledge is reduced to the transmission of employment related facts framed within a consumer model that frighteningly turns both the professor and student into indebted servants for profit making by the 1%. But our model is different, by providing debt-free (with the goal of a totally free) education, knowledge and ideas are freed up from a profit-making agenda.  Your funds will help us make learning about Deleuze's philosophy an expression of freedom and openness to an infinite possibility.  

Benefit & Impact:

  • Access to our archives (You can view our previously recorded lectures) ($20 or more)
  • Access to our 2015-2016 Deleuze Lecture Series
  • Be Part of Changing Education so that all people can access no matter their economic status
  • Be Part of a Community of theorists and activists
  • Help others access live lectures from the best Deleuzian Theorists today
It is easy to access our lectures.  They are live, interactive and on-line.  They can be accessed with just a few clicks of a button.  

How the Funding Works:

The current leadership, and was always part of the founding idea of GCAS, does not financially benefit from the school.  Our philosophy is to create something new and to break from the neoliberal profit-making mentality so ubiquitous in education today.  So this is how your funds will be used:
  • $750 to our GCAS lecturers (honorarium) 
  • $200 to pay for the on-line platform (Big Blue Button, costs $2,500/year)
  • $50 Designer Fees
  • If we receive over $1,000 these funds will be used to help create a Deleuze Studies Institute at GCAS

Spread the Word

If you can't contribute, that's okay, you can still enjoy the free lectures, yet you can still help by getting spreading the word about GCAS and how together we are changing education to empower people not to make profits.

story:
THE PURPOSE OF COMMUNITY SUPPORTED EDUCATION: REGENERATIVE COMMUNITY DESIGN & CULTURE REPAIR

The purpose of this Regenerative Community Design is for the community to aggregate $10,835 to send Chico community-educator, Katrina Djberof, to study Transformative Eco-Social Leadership at a leadership school called Weaving Earth Center for Relational Education.

Regenerative Community Design is a Community Supported Education fundraiser to send me to be trained in a mentoring model that looks at power from a totally different standpoint and is based on relational education and ecopsychology. It is a design model that uses deep nature connection to bring people together in a positive way, which does culture repair . . . It's a design model that heals by bringing us consciously into greater connection to Earth, self and others.

Weaving Earth is an outdoor leadership school that provides hands-on “experiential learning” based on the 8 Shields Mentoring Model. I am seeking an alternative framework of authority and model to the current standardized management systems and its disciplinary structures developed for the corporate and institutional level. The "power-over" hierarchy and fear-based psychology which are backed by punishment for insubordination (HR language and law) do not work in collaborative projects or group dynamics. I want to study a model based on mentoring and empowerment that draws out people's genius and incorporate it into the community education and community building I do at the grassroots level, and nonprofit and for-profit sectors.

After finding Weaving Earth I knew it was exactly what I was looking for and started making headlines in a new cooperatively owned online journal, The Left Coast Independent, "Inner Tracking."

"Every now and then people who have made civic contributions on our behalf (volunteering, organizing, or otherwise saving the world) step up and challenge themselves. Katrina is one such person. She's raising funds to attend a year-long course on mentoring. Katrina will make our society better. She's moving into what is called social entrepreneurship. That's when people see needs in society and fill them. Corporations don't see any profit in small enterprises and government can't organize well enough to meet needs. We need more folks stepping in to help. More social entrepreneurs. Like Katrina." - Dr. Vernon Lee Andrews

PERKS:

Built-In Donor Perks: Bringing People Together In A Really Positive Way

Any person, organization or business who donates to my fundraiser will be invited to attend a monthly potluck and discussion group. Donors will have an opportunity to learn about the training and contribute to weaving nature connection in our regional community. This container will allow everyone to share their skills, experiences and contribute to the conversation, as well as integrating our discussions into one's life. 

*Donors, I have your email address (thanks for contributing!) and will be in touch as this is developed and set into motion. Watch for your invitation! Not in the area? We can explore some other options.

Built-In Donor Perks: One-on-One Follow-Up Consultation

I will provide donors a 45 minute consultation. It could be a follow-up conversation regarding the discussion group series, or to go greater into depth on an area of focus of your choice. Consultation can be applicable to one's life, a business or project, or an idea that is ready to come into physical form . . . and to the living landscape. It's up to you. 

*Donors, you have my email address in your thank you letter from me. Please allow me some time to dive into my training! You are invited to contact me to schedule an appointment. This offer stands for Regenerative Community Design donors only.

In the last 35 hours - Redwood Seeds is incentivizing your donations! 
Regional Northern California heirloom seed breeding company is offering a discount code of 15% to all supporters donating to this campaign in the last 35 hours! You can visit Redwood Seeds at a farmers market near you, online, or at the National Heirloom Seed Expo.
 

WHAT IS TRANSFORMATIVE ECO-SOCIAL LEADERSHIP?

"Buddhist philosopher and environmental leader Joanna Macy has described these two trends as “the great unraveling,” in which our environment, social structures, and species are collapsing under the weight of current stresses; and “the great turning,” in which new understandings are unfolding for how humankind can—and must—live in harmony with itself and the planet." 

"The impacts of the ecological unraveling are well defined: Rising global temperatures, melting of the polar ice, extreme weather, ocean acidification, rising sea level, freshwater shortages, and many other alarming trends. Similarly, the main immediate causes are known: rampant use of fossil fuels and deforestation, with other contributing factors mixed in. These forces are creating a complex matrix of social, political, cultural and ecological instabilities that place increasing stress on our selves, families, communities and societies" (Scott, W. & Edmondson 2014).

Transformative eco-social leadership and Weaving Earth are answering my prayers and speaking to my greatest needs . . . and the greatest needs of the world today. All monies aggregated in the community supported education fundraiser will be received whether the goal is reached or not. Thank you so much for helping me to make this dream a reality and for supporting me to step more wholly into my potential! 

"Help Katrina to help us!" David Guzzetti, former Chico Councilman.


WHY IS THIS SO IMPORTANT TO ME?

My deepest yearning is to learn a leadership style that looks at the group it’s facilitating like an organism and to obtain credentials to legitimize the work I do.

"We are not preparing people for the world we grew up in, nor are we preparing them for today's world. Instead, we must empower them with the creativity needed to solve problems that we cannot imagine." - Matt Kolan & Walter Poleman, University of Vermont.

When people ask what I do, I usually answer, "I'm a Synergy Specialist and Integrator." I’m like Spider weaving a web of connection, solving problems and working with dynamic groups of people.

In co-creating and co-managing operating and human systems, I feel a strong need for the language, skills and training to cultivate a fabric of culture that is flexible, fluid, bountiful and resilient as a forest floor.  This is rooted in an intention of connection and empowerment.  Weaving Earth calls this Cultural Biomimicy. 

Obstacles to Deconstruct & Re-Create: Power, Authority and Discipline in Group Dynamics . . . This is what I'm up to.

In my experience, working with diverse groups and teams, I can no longer use standardized management systems and its disciplinary measures developed for the corporate and institutional level, governed by an HR policy that uses legal terms like insubordination. 

Why? It tears apart relationships. It is an oppressive, power-over approach based on fear and punishment. I’ve seen it over and over again. I can't guide a team or a business that is disconnected. If people are always getting punished or are in fear of making a mistake and then getting written up or getting fired, that negatively affects behavior and thus breaks a team apart. 

My bosses aren’t even on board with it! They refuse to even use this language, which means I can’t use this language.

I’ve looked at various leadership styles, spoke with leaders I’m inspired by to seek a better understanding of this complex problem. There’s something way bigger going on here that isn’t working, and it’s hard to find a language for. There has to be another way! And there is.

The question I’ve been asking myself is: What do I put in its place and how?

After much research, I’ve found the training Weaving Earth offers through its 3-year Immersion Program as a powerful basket of tools, techniques and technologies. And it’s exactly what I’m looking for!

The world is yearning for something different to emerge that supports the whole. I want to meet this need in conjunction with others collaborating on this shared effort. 

To read more about my background, education, international and local experience visit my blog.


GRATITUDE FOR YOU!!

I feel so much gratitude for your commitment to making the world a better place through the work you do in the world. I am so grateful to know so many of you value community, connection, health, and this lusciously wonderful world we share. Thank you for supporting such potent work!


WEAVING EARTH CENTER FOR RELATIONAL EDUCATION

Weaving Earth offers an immersion program using relational education, eco-psychology and permaculture. All of their programs are highly experiential, held in a community context, facilitated by invested mentors and based in natural learning rhythms. This “Relational” model of education encourages healthy development, natural intelligence, an innate sense of belonging, individual genius and authentic connection to self, others and earth.

To learn more about Weaving Earth visit their website. I've outlined the areas of study, and Weaving Earth's lineage on my blog. Click here to read more.


FUNDRAISING GOAL:  $10,835

You're over half-way through and you’re doing awesome! 

In total, this fundraiser is aiming to aggregate at least $10,835 within a 39 day window. School starts September 3, 2014! Your donations to my Regenerative Community Design campaign are truly gifts!

Where does all the money go?

  • $8500: School (9 months of training)
  • $880: Meals on-site (5 meals per week for 9 months is $7/meal)
  • $1023: +/- 11% fees associated with this campaign  (7% fee for money going to a nonprofit, GRUB Education, and 3-5% fee to process credit cards)
  • $512: Gas: 4 trips/mo from Chico to Penngrove, CA (1352 miles/mo) for 9 months

I will turn around and invest everything I learn back into the community. You are really investing in yourself and our shared future! Could anything be sweeter?

I will receive all your generous donations, minus the aforementioned fees whether I surpass the goal or am shy of reaching it. Some fundraising platforms require the financial goal to be reached in order for the campaign to be a success. However, I’ve selected a platform that will be a success no matter how much money is raised!

It’s a win-win-win!!!

*I am not offering perks in this fundraiser as I've already paid it forward with the work I do in the community. Your donations are an investment into the community, as I will continue to partner with nonprofit and for-profit organizations and institutions to raise awareness through experiential education on agro-food systems, resource management and ecology. I'm offering a more holistic and integrated lens for cooperative and collaborative relationships to: self, the soil that feeds our food; our communities and families; the work place and to our ecosystems . . . on the basis of design and relational leadership, which is transformative.


THE FEELING BEHIND OUR GIFTS: THE GOOD WAY

It feels really good to ask the community to invest in me. This is community-supported education for a community-educator. I will bring it all back and integrate it into the work I'm currently doing for the community, as well as share and mentor it in all aspects of my life. It's my commitment and my soul's deepest longing.

Allow me to invite you to make a gift that feels good to you. Intentions are powerful. I want it to feel good. No gift is too big or too small, and my intentions are to help transform our world with your help.

"Last week we supported Katrina in her fundraising efforts to attend Weaving Earth for an education in Regenerative Community Design. We have worked with her for the last year to plan the 6 part Chico Seed Saving Series and were impressed on many levels. Adjectives that come to mind are flexible yet professional, directed and creative, hands-on and happy. This educational opportunity will enhance these qualities and then some. And the best part? Katrina wants to bring it all home to Chico! Follow this link to learn more. Let's send Katrina back to school!" - Kalan Redwood, regional seed breeder at Redwood Seeds


HOW WILL YOUR GIFTS IMPACT OUR WORLD?

My project is part of a movement that is gaining much momentum across the world, which demonstrates its worth and value cross-culturally. The impacts you make when investing in this work are potent! You are investing in healing our world, cultivating a culture of mentoring with role models where people are empowered to embody their greatest genius to do their soul's work. 

You are bringing a model to the North Valley that is ergonomically designed for how humans are designed psychologically and biologically -  how our brains work (how we learn); how we are an integral part of our ecosystem; and how it cultivates a culture of connection. Jon Young's anthropological research and life's work reveals - or reintroduces the fundamental structures necessary for an integrated and healthy culture which fosters holistic human development and empowerment. 

The impact of your donations to my campaign will train me in Transformative Eco-Social Leadership, to use and implement this design model of mentoring through nature connection, and apply it to the work I do at the grassroots level, and through the nonprofit and for-profit sectors for the health of our communities.


RISKS & CHALLENGES

Life is full of risks and challenges. We do our best to make calculated risks and to face challenges and work through them without destroying relationships.

From what I've observed in crowd funding, there seems to be a bell-curve take off where the campaign starts gaining some traction and the tendency is then a bit of a pause. Before the deadline, folks want to see these fundraisers be successful and they want to contribute so there's a big push towards the end with donations and spreading the word!

On the flip side, the community may not fill the kitty all the way. The goal may not be reached. It's a very real reality - and it's okay. It won't be the end of the world. I know I will have done my best, and the community will reveal the level of their support and value of community building.

This fundraiser ends September 3, 2014. That's also the first day of school. My intention is to put at least 50% down. If this goal is not reached, I will not start the Weaving Earth program this year. Instead, I will place the monies gifted to me for this training into a savings account until I am able to attend school.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

I fully understand and empathize with those of you who just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Word of mouth and story telling are powerful and important ways to help. Showing your support by passing along your belief in this campaign is just as important as the actual fundraising. 

YOU are my cheerleaders and my publicity team!! Thanks for helping to publicize this campaign and for believing in me and this work, and for contributing to our shared successes!!!

Show your support, offer testimonials and you can also help to get the word out by telling friends, family and neighbors, bosses and even strangers! 

I am blessing your life, and feeling so much gratitude to be here with you. Thank you for all YOU do!


With much delight, 

Katrina Djberof

THE PURPOSE OF COMMUNITY SUPPORTED EDUCATION: REGENERATIVE COMMUNITY DESIGN & CULTURE REPAIR

The purpose of this Regenerative Community Design is for the community to aggregate $10,835 to send Chico community-educator, Katrina Djberof, to study Transformative Eco-Social Leadership at a leadership school called Weaving Earth Center for Relational Education.Regenerative Community Design is a Community Supported Education fundraiser to send me to be trained in a mentoring model that looks at power from a totally different standpoint and is based on relational education and ecopsychology. It is a design model that uses deep nature connection to bring people together in a positive way, which does culture repair . . . It's a design model that heals by bringing us consciously into greater connection to Earth, self and others.Weaving Earth is an outdoor leadership school that
provides hands-on “experiential learning” based on the 8 Shields Mentoring Model. I am seeking an alternative framework of authority and model to the current standardized management systems and its disciplinary structures developed for the corporate and institutional level. The "power-over" hierarchy and fear-based psychology which are backed by punishment for insubordination (HR language and law) do not work in collaborative projects or group dynamics. I want to study a model based on mentoring and empowerment that draws out people's genius and incorporate it into the community education and community building I do at the grassroots level, and nonprofit and for-profit sectors.After finding Weaving Earth I knew it was exactly what I was looking for and started making headlines in a new cooperatively owned online journal, The Left Coast Independent, "Inner Tracking.""Every now and then people who have made civic contributions on our behalf (volunteering, organizing, or otherwise saving the world) step up and challenge themselves. Katrina is one such person. She's raising funds to attend a year-long course on mentoring. Katrina will make our society better. She's moving into what is called social entrepreneurship. That's when people see needs in society and fill them. Corporations don't see any profit in small enterprises and government can't organize well enough to meet needs. We need more folks stepping in to help. More social entrepreneurs. Like Katrina." - Dr. Vernon Lee AndrewsPERKS:Built-In Donor Perks: Bringing People Together In A Really Positive WayAny person, organization or business who donates to my fundraiser will be invited to attend a monthly potluck and discussion group. Donors will have an opportunity to learn about the training and contribute to weaving nature connection in our regional community. This container will allow everyone to share their skills, experiences and contribute to the conversation, as well as integrating our discussions into one's life. *Donors, I have your email address (thanks for contributing!) and will be in touch as this is developed and set into motion. Watch for your invitation! Not in the area? We can explore some other options.Built-In Donor Perks: One-on-One Follow-Up ConsultationI will provide donors a 45 minute consultation. It could be a follow-up conversation regarding the discussion group series, or to go greater into depth on an area of focus of your choice. Consultation can be applicable to one's life, a business or project, or an idea that is ready to come into physical form . . . and to the living landscape. It's up to you. *Donors, you have my email address in your thank you letter from me. Please allow me some time to dive into my training! You are invited to contact me to schedule an appointment. This offer stands for Regenerative Community Design donors only.In the last 35 hours - Redwood Seeds is incentivizing your donations! Regional Northern California heirloom seed breeding company is offering a discount code of 15% to all supporters donating to this campaign in the last 35 hours! You can visit Redwood Seeds at a farmers market near you, online, or at the National Heirloom Seed Expo. WHAT IS TRANSFORMATIVE ECO-SOCIAL LEADERSHIP?

"Buddhist philosopher and environmental leader Joanna Macy has described these two trends as “the great unraveling,” in which our environment, social structures, and species are collapsing under the weight of current stresses; and “the great turning,” in which new understandings are unfolding for how humankind can—and must—live in harmony with itself and the planet." 
"The impacts of the ecological unraveling are well defined: Rising global temperatures, melting of the polar ice, extreme weather, ocean acidification, rising sea level, freshwater shortages, and many other alarming trends. Similarly, the main immediate causes are known: rampant use of fossil fuels and deforestation, with other contributing factors mixed in. These forces are creating a complex matrix of social, political, cultural and ecological instabilities that place increasing stress on our selves, families, communities and societies" (Scott, W. & Edmondson 2014).
Transformative eco-social leadership and Weaving Earth are answering my prayers and speaking to my greatest needs . . . and the greatest needs of the world today. All monies aggregated in the community supported education fundraiser will be received whether the goal is reached or not. Thank you so much for helping me to make this dream a reality and for supporting me to step more wholly into my potential! 
"Help Katrina to help us!" David Guzzetti, former Chico Councilman.


WHY IS THIS SO IMPORTANT TO ME?




My deepest yearning is to learn a leadership style that looks at the group it’s facilitating like an organism and to obtain credentials to legitimize the work I do.
"We are not preparing people for the world we grew up
in, nor are we preparing them for today's world. Instead, we must empower them
with the creativity needed to solve problems that we cannot
imagine." - Matt Kolan & Walter Poleman, University of Vermont.
When people ask what I do, I usually
answer, "I'm a Synergy Specialist and Integrator." I’m like Spider
weaving a web of connection, solving problems and working with dynamic groups of
people.
In co-creating and co-managing
operating and human systems, I feel a strong need for the language, skills and
training to cultivate a fabric of culture that is flexible, fluid, bountiful
and resilient as a forest floor.  This is
rooted in an intention of connection and empowerment.  Weaving Earth calls
this Cultural Biomimicy. 
Obstacles to Deconstruct & Re-Create: Power, Authority and Discipline in Group Dynamics . . . This is what I'm up to.
In my experience, working with diverse
groups and teams, I can no longer use standardized management systems and its disciplinary measures developed for the corporate and institutional level, governed by an HR policy that uses legal terms like insubordination. 
Why? It tears apart relationships. It
is an oppressive, power-over approach based on fear and punishment. I’ve seen it over and over
again. I can't guide a team or a business that is disconnected. If people are
always getting punished or are in fear of making a mistake and then getting written
up or getting fired, that negatively affects behavior and thus breaks a
team apart. 
My bosses aren’t even on board with it! They refuse to even use this
language, which means I can’t use this language.
I’ve looked at various leadership styles,
spoke with leaders I’m inspired by to seek a better understanding of this complex
problem. There’s something way bigger going on here that isn’t working, and
it’s hard to find a language for. There has to be another way! And there is.
The question I’ve been asking myself
is: What do I put in its place and how?
After much research, I’ve found the
training Weaving Earth offers through its 3-year Immersion Program as a powerful
basket of tools, techniques and technologies. And it’s exactly what I’m looking
for!
The world is yearning for
something different to emerge that supports the whole. I want to meet this need
in conjunction with others collaborating on this shared effort. 
To read more about my background, education, international and local experience visit my blog.

GRATITUDE FOR YOU!!
I feel so much gratitude for your commitment to making the world a better place through the work you do in the world. I am so grateful to know so many of you value community, connection, health, and this lusciously wonderful world we share. Thank you for supporting such potent work!

WEAVING EARTH CENTER FOR RELATIONAL EDUCATION


Weaving Earth offers an immersion
program using relational education, eco-psychology and permaculture. All of
their programs are highly experiential, held in a community context,
facilitated by invested mentors and based in natural learning rhythms. This
“Relational” model of education encourages healthy development, natural
intelligence, an innate sense of belonging, individual genius and authentic
connection to self, others and earth.
To learn more about Weaving Earth visit their website. I've outlined the areas of study, and Weaving Earth's lineage on my blog. Click here to read more.



FUNDRAISING GOAL:  $10,835

You're over half-way through and
you’re doing awesome! 
In total, this fundraiser is aiming
to aggregate at least $10,835 within a 39 day window. School starts September
3, 2014! Your donations to my Regenerative
Community Design campaign are truly gifts!
Where does all the money go?

$8500: School (9 months of training)

$880: Meals on-site (5 meals per week for 9 months is $7/meal)
$1023: +/- 11% fees associated with this campaign  (7% fee for money going to a nonprofit, GRUB Education, and 3-5% fee to process credit cards)
$512: Gas: 4 trips/mo from Chico to Penngrove, CA (1352 miles/mo) for 9 months

I will turn around and invest everything I learn
back into the community. You are really investing in yourself and our shared
future! Could anything be sweeter?
I will receive all your generous donations, minus the aforementioned fees whether I surpass the goal or am shy of reaching it. Some fundraising platforms require the financial goal to be reached in order
for the campaign to be a success. However, I’ve selected a platform that will be
a success no matter how much money is raised! 
It’s a win-win-win!!!
*I am not offering perks in this fundraiser as I've already paid it forward with the work I do in the community. Your donations are an investment into the community, as I will continue to partner with nonprofit and for-profit organizations and institutions to raise awareness through experiential education on agro-food systems, resource management and ecology. I'm offering a more holistic and integrated lens for cooperative and collaborative relationships to: self, the soil that feeds our food; our communities and families; the work place and to our ecosystems . . . on the basis of design and relational leadership, which is transformative.

THE FEELING BEHIND OUR GIFTS: THE GOOD WAY
It feels really good to
ask the community to invest in me. This is community-supported education for a community-educator. I
will bring it all back and integrate it into the work I'm currently doing for
the community, as well as share and mentor it in all aspects of my life. It's my commitment and my soul's deepest longing.
Allow me to invite you to make a
gift that feels good to you. Intentions are powerful. I want it to feel
good. No gift is too big or too small, and my intentions are to help transform
our world with your help.
"Last week we supported Katrina in her fundraising efforts to attend Weaving Earth for an education in Regenerative Community Design. We have worked with her for the last year to plan the 6 part Chico Seed Saving Series and were impressed on many levels. Adjectives that come to mind are flexible yet professional, directed and creative, hands-on and happy. This educational opportunity will enhance these qualities and then some. And the best part? Katrina wants to bring it all home to Chico! Follow this link to learn more. Let's send Katrina back to school!" - Kalan Redwood, regional seed breeder at Redwood Seeds




HOW WILL YOUR GIFTS IMPACT OUR WORLD?

My project is part of a movement
that is gaining much momentum across the world, which demonstrates its worth
and value cross-culturally. The impacts you make when investing in this work
are potent! You are investing in healing our world, cultivating a culture of
mentoring with role models where people are empowered to embody their greatest
genius to do their soul's work. 
You are bringing a model to the
North Valley that is ergonomically designed for how humans are designed psychologically and biologically -  how our brains work (how we
learn); how we are an integral part of our ecosystem; and how it cultivates a
culture of connection. Jon Young's anthropological research and life's work
reveals - or reintroduces the fundamental structures necessary for an
integrated and healthy culture which fosters holistic human development and
empowerment. 
The impact of your donations to my
campaign will train me in Transformative Eco-Social Leadership, to use and
implement this design model of mentoring through nature connection, and apply
it to the work I do at the grassroots level, and through the nonprofit and
for-profit sectors for the health of our communities.




RISKS & CHALLENGES

Life is full of risks and
challenges. We do our best to make calculated risks and to face challenges and
work through them without destroying relationships.
From what I've observed in crowd funding, there seems to be a bell-curve take off where the campaign starts gaining some traction and the tendency is then a bit of a pause. Before the deadline, folks want to see these fundraisers be successful and they want to contribute so there's a big push towards the end with donations and spreading the word!
On the flip side, the community may not fill the kitty all the way. The goal may not be reached. It's a very real reality - and it's okay. It won't be the end of the world. I know I will have done my best, and the community will reveal the level of their support and value of community building.
This fundraiser ends September 3, 2014. That's also the first day of school. My intention is to put at least 50% down. If this goal is not reached, I will not start the Weaving Earth program this year. Instead, I will place the monies gifted to me for this training into a savings account until I am able to attend school.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

I fully understand and empathize
with those of you who just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean
you can't help! Word of mouth and story telling are powerful and important ways to help. Showing your support by passing along your belief in this campaign is just as important as the actual fundraising. 
YOU
are my cheerleaders and my publicity team!! Thanks for helping to publicize
this campaign and for believing in me and this work, and for contributing to our shared successes!!!
Show your support, offer testimonials and you can also help to get the word out by telling friends, family and neighbors, bosses and even strangers! 
I am blessing your life, and feeling so
much gratitude to be here with you. Thank you for all YOU do!

With much delight, 
Katrina Djberof

story:
Short Summary

HEY PARTY PEOPLE!! IT'S MY 30TH BIRTHDAY ON JUNE 27TH!! 

As you know, I always love to do something fun and different for my birthdays and here it is…

Instead of presents or dinners or drinks I would love for everyone to donate to an organization called RainCatcher for my birthday!

RainCatcher is a non profit committed to providing water filtration systems to impoverished villages and communities in Uganda, Kenya, India and Haiti and has plans to expand into South America in the near future. 

Clean water is the most basic human need and everyone in the world should have access to it. Every $50 raised is enough to buy a water filter capable of filtering 1 million gallons; that's 20,000 gallons per dollar. So no matter how little or how much you are able to donate you can impact someone's life for years to come.


Other Ways You Can Help

Since I'm not on the internet as much as the average 30 year old, maybe you can help the cause by spreading the word for me. Tell your friends to donate and give them a High 5 and a big smile for me.

So get on it and donate! Your donation is tax deductible as well.

Thanks for being awesome,

Michelle

story:
THE TEAM

Scott Roughgarden - Founder & Co-CEO 

Christiana Gifford - Founder & Co-CEO

Laurie Sutton - Founder & Chief Wine Officer

Bonnie - Bee Supporter & Impersonator, Honey Lover


OUR STORY 

Scott Roughgarden, Christiana Gifford, and Laurie C. Sutton all share a passion for quality wine and a growing concern for the decreasing population of the Honeybee. 

Honey Bubbles Wine is an elegant sparkling Moscato blend sourced from New Mexico. Our team has unanimously chosen to give a portion of proceeds to fight Colony Collapse Disorder of the Honeybee. 

We recognize that without the Honeybee there wouldn't be wine at all. Our goal is to bring awareness to Colony Collapse Disorder and to combat this travesty.


COLONY COLLAPSE DISORDER (CCD) / BEE RESPONSIBLE

Honeybees are vital to our ecosystem pollinating at least one-third of the American diet including berries, peaches, cherries, nuts, citrus fruits, avocados, cotton, and of course grapes for eating and making wine! The stability of our nation's food supply is facing a terrible threat with conditions such as Colony Collapse Disorder (CCD) resulting in the abrupt disappearance and death of our bee population.   After WWII, there were 5 million honeybee colonies; Today, only half of that number survives with colonies dwindling at an alarmingly increasing rate every year. 

We have partnered up with a non-profit bee conservation organization called Honey Love.  We plan to donate 50 cents per every bottle sold to Honey Love and other similar organizations that help spread awareness about CCD. These organizations aid  in teaching optimal practices for urban beekeeping allowing individuals to take the fight against CCD into their own hands!


    WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO:
    We are requesting some help funding the following aspects of getting our product launched and onto shelves near you.
    1. Purchasing the wine
    We have sourced an incredible sparkling Moscato from our partner vineyard in New Mexico. We will require the initial funds to purchase, bottle, and ship our first 500 cases of Honey Bubbles. 
    2. Storing the wine
    In order to ensure we are in compliance with all federal alcohol regulations and our refreshingly delicious sparkling wine stays in its righteous condition, we must have a climate-controlled warehouse unit to store our product. This will keep Honey Bubbles Sparkling Moscato in prime condition before being poured into your glass. Cheers!
    3. Licensing 
    We are excited to have completed our TTB licensing that enables Team Honey Bubbles to legally distribute alcohol within the state of California. Cheers! With your generous donations, we will be able to apply for our ABC federal license which will allow us to distribute our bubbles all throughout our United States. Cheers to you!

    IN CLOSING
    We know that the wine business is not for the faint of heart, but we are passionately excited for this adventure! 
    We believe that with our team's combined expertise and the quality of our product we can make a tremendous impact.
    Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about Honey Bubbles and our cause, and a special thanks to those that contribute! You can also help us and the Honeybees just by sharing our cause. Please tweet, buzz, share and Facebook! 
    Please look for a bottle of Honey Bubbles Wine at a wine shop and restaurant near you--soon!

    Bee Responsible. Bee Friendly. 

    Sipping Bubbles, Saving Bees.

Christiana Gifford - Founder & Co-CEO

The stability of our nation's food supply is facing a terrible threat with conditions such as Colony Collapse Disorder (CCD) resulting in the abrupt disappearance and death of our bee population.   After WWII, there were 5 million honeybee colonies; Today, only half of that number survives with colonies dwindling at an alarmingly increasing rate every year. 
We have partnered up with a non-profit bee conservation organization called Honey Love.  We plan to donate 50 cents per every bottle sold to Honey Love and other similar organizations that help spread awareness about CCD. These organizations aid  in teaching optimal practices for urban beekeeping allowing individuals to take the fight against CCD into their own hands!




WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO:
We are requesting some help funding the following aspects of getting our product launched and onto shelves near you.

1. Purchasing the wine

We have sourced an incredible sparkling Moscato from our partner vineyard in New Mexico. We will require the initial funds to purchase, bottle, and ship our first 500 cases of Honey Bubbles. 
2. Storing the wine

In order to ensure we are in compliance with all federal alcohol regulations and our refreshingly delicious sparkling wine stays in its righteous condition, we must have a climate-controlled warehouse unit to store our product. This will keep Honey Bubbles Sparkling Moscato in prime condition before being poured into your glass. Cheers!
3. Licensing 

We are excited to have completed our TTB licensing that enables Team Honey Bubbles to legally distribute alcohol within the state of California. Cheers! With your generous donations, we will be able to apply for our ABC federal license which will allow us to distribute our bubbles all throughout our United States. Cheers to you!




IN CLOSING
We know that the wine business is not for the faint of heart, but we are passionately excited for this adventure! 
We believe that with our team's combined expertise and the quality of our product we can make a tremendous impact.

Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about Honey Bubbles and our cause, and a special thanks to those that contribute! You can also help us and the Honeybees just by sharing our cause. Please tweet, buzz, share and Facebook! 
Please look for a bottle of Honey Bubbles Wine at a wine shop and restaurant near you--soon!

Bee Responsible. Bee Friendly. 
Sipping Bubbles, Saving Bees.

story:
Who is Drops of Love?

Drops of Love is a 501(c)3 Non-Profit Organization that raises funds to drill wells in developing countries. Drops of Love was founded in 2009 by 15 year old, Mariah Smiley. Drops of Love has expanded greatly, now being run by a large team that is passionate about ending the water crisis. Drops of Love has fully funded and drilled three wells in Nicaragua and El Salvador.

What You Can Give Us

The high-end wells that Drops of Love drills are meant to be self-sustaining and long-lasting. We do not build the cheap 2,000 dollar wells that many other organizations establish because they are known to quickly fall into disrepair. Because of this, each of our wells are 5,000 dollars. For just a few dollars you can provide clean water to school children for their entire lives.

The Impact

Every well provides clean water to thousands of people every day. Because of the high-quality nature of these wells, the people near the school will continue to have clean water for many generations to come. Not simply preventing deadly diseases, but also freeing 2-3 hours a day that would otherwise be spent hiking to the nearest water source.

Our Plans

We plan on continuing to drill wells all around the world in many developing countries: Haiti, South Sudan, Uganda, El Salvador, etc. All money received will go towards the building of water wells, no exceptions. If we raise  one-hundred thousand dollars, we will build 200 wells.
Sadly, sometimes we are unable to build in the planned location due to local violence or political instability. If that is the case, we will apply the funds to the most similar project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's fine! You can help us immensely by sharing this fundraiser or by simply connecting with us on our website (dropsoflove.org).

 And remember! Just one dollar can save a life.

This is Emma Nikita. She is 1 year and 10 mos. and the bubbliest baby you will ever meet. You can have a part in making her future bright.

We are a family of 5.. worked in the Philippines for 20 years. We are dreaming of immigrating to Canada. All legal requirements achieved, but we are constantly raising settlement funds for the big adjustment in a new country. We just want to provide a bright future for our 3 wonderful children.  

Please support.. There is Magic in Kindness...

story:
I am raising funds to assist with my program fee and airfare to volunteer in Rabat, Morocco with Cross Cultural Solutions. 

Funds Required:
-Program Fee: $3092 (includes stay and meals at home base, and travel to and from the orphanage)
-Airfare: $1600

Tax Deduction Donation:
http://www.crossculturalsolutions.org/public-fu...

From my previous trip to Ghana with CCS, fell in love with travel, volunteering, and found a new sense of self. In time back home since that trip, I have also found a deeper passion for volunteering with children and more specifically, children in foster care. I volunteer with the Thru Project in San Antonio where I am able to mentor foster youth. I cannot wait to merge the two with this trip.
The placement of volunteering in an orphanage for children with disabilities is bound to have its challenges however, I know these children will offer me an experience I cannot imagine!

Full Version of my volunteer trip to Hohoe, Ghana with Cross Cultural Solutions.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=id32dSK-dyQ
