story:
Our story

Holistic Parenting Magazine is founded on our passion for authentic family living. Our team believes that we can heal the earth by healing ourselves and our children through conscious conception, gentle birth, attachment parenting, free-range learning, natural immunity, and eco-consciousness. 

As founder of this home-based business, I had no idea what the birth and growing of this idea would look like, how much nurturing it would require, and how much of my heart, soul, and finances it would demand in order to grow! 

Holistic Parenting Magazine has outgrown it's birthplace–from zero presence on social media to over 7,000 dedicated fans and followers–and is eager to expand and connect with even more families. My team and I are excited to be broadening our horizons: we have created a new website and are working towards a Holistic Parenting Mobile App, which will bring together thousands of resources, parenting wisdom, expert advice, and family experiences to inspire and support you on your parenting journey. 

All this inevitably requires more money than my family alone can afford. We remain committed to continuing this vision, and are asking for your active financial support. 

      


What We Need 

We aim to raise $175,000 

I'll break it down for you:

Amazing, emotionally intelligent website and mobile App computer wiz: $30,000

Our subscribers simply LOVE the feel and smell of our sustainably sourced magazine paper–we do too, and want to continue printing! Cost: $30,000

Passionate and positive networking mama: $30,000

We believe our readers deserve original articles with fresh ideas, and would like to compensate our expert writers in return for sharing their wisdom with us! Cost: $12,000

We want to bring our families and experts together, not only online, but face to face as well! Event organization: $4,000

My kids expect me to get paid for the time I spend working on the magazine, instead of playing with them! $35,000

Talented and uber artistic graphic designer: $5,000

Truly organized individual crunching numbers, plus the legal lady in California: $3,000

So far, this unique publication has been funded out of my family's bank account. Our debt: $25,000

                            


What You Get                       

Greatest perk of all, by donating here you will help us continue to publish a great resource for holistically minded parents! We love having you be part of our community!

Every donation, no matter how small, will receive a whole lot of love! 

Our perks include bumper stickers, tote bags, T-shirts, hoodies, and free subscriptions to HPM!

For like-minded businesses, by donating you get free ad space in our upcoming issues: win-win!

If we don't reach our goal, we want to channel the raised funds toward a stronger online presence. We also want to compensate our current subscribers since we may be looking at ceasing production/ publishing, and start paying off our debt. We take care of our tribe!


  

 

Holistic Parenting Magazine's Impact

Our world needs more peacemakers, restorers, healers, storytellers, and lovers.

The community that has gathered since this magazine's birth consists of thousands of kindred spirits from around the world!

Our magazine aims to inspire, expand your vision, open pathways of possibility, rekindle your excitement about parenting, and encourage you on your parenting path.

We have been overwhelmed by the positive feedback we have received from parents and leaders of the natural parenting community across the world!


     


We are up for the challenge!

Everyone on our team is passionate about this movement, and committed to continue expanding Holistic Parenting Magazine!

We know it takes a village to raise a child... We are asking you to be that community. Lets raise this magazine to it's full potential!


                                             


Share the love!

We value and appreciate your positive energy here! Of course, everything green ($$) helps but we recognize that not everyone is able to offer financial support. 
Here are some other ways to help: 
SHARE our campaign with EVERYONE you know–parents, midwives, doulas, whole foodies, writers, birth photographers, friends, family, colleagues, alternative practitioners and educators. 
SHARE memes from our gallery.
SHARE our magazine with your friends.
SHARE the love! Send us hugs, kindness, good luck, blessings, and good wishes for success.
story_txt:
Our story
Holistic Parenting Magazine is founded on our passion for authentic family living. Our team believes that we can heal the earth by healing ourselves and our children through conscious conception, gentle birth, attachment parenting, free-range learning, natural immunity, and eco-consciousness. 


As founder of this home-based business, I had no idea what the birth and growing of this idea would look like, how much nurturing it would require, and how much of my heart, soul, and finances it would demand in order to grow! 


Holistic Parenting Magazine has outgrown it's birthplace–from zero presence on social media to over 7,000 dedicated fans and followers–and is eager to expand and connect with even more families. My team and I are excited to be broadening our horizons: we have created a new website and are working towards a Holistic Parenting Mobile App, which will bring together thousands of resources, parenting wisdom, expert advice, and family experiences to inspire and support you on your parenting journey. 

All this inevitably requires more money than my family alone can afford. We remain committed to continuing this vision, and are asking for your active financial support. 
          
What We Need  We aim to raise $175,000 
I'll break it down for you:
Amazing, emotionally intelligent website and mobile App computer wiz: $30,000
Our subscribers simply LOVE the feel and smell of our sustainably sourced magazine paper–we do too, and want to continue printing! Cost: $30,000
Passionate and positive networking mama: $30,000
We believe our readers deserve original articles with fresh ideas, and would like to compensate our expert writers in return for sharing their wisdom with us! Cost: $12,000
We want to bring our families and experts together, not only online, but face to face as well! Event organization: $4,000
My kids expect me to get paid for the time I spend working on the magazine, instead of playing with them! $35,000
Talented and uber artistic graphic designer: $5,000
Truly organized individual crunching numbers, plus the legal lady in California: $3,000
So far, this unique publication has been funded out of my family's bank account. Our debt: $25,000

                            


What You Get                       


Greatest perk of all, by donating here you will help us continue to publish a great resource for holistically minded parents! We love having you be part of our community!
Every donation, no matter how small, will receive a whole lot of love! 
Our perks include bumper stickers, tote bags, T-shirts, hoodies, and free subscriptions to HPM!
For like-minded businesses, by donating you get free ad space in our upcoming issues: win-win!
If we don't reach our goal, we want to channel the raised funds toward a stronger online presence. We also want to compensate our current subscribers since we may be looking at ceasing production/ publishing, and start paying off our debt. We take care of our tribe!

  

 
Holistic Parenting Magazine's Impact Our world needs more peacemakers, restorers, healers, storytellers, and lovers.

The community that has gathered since this magazine's birth consists of thousands of kindred spirits from around the world!
Our magazine aims to inspire, expand your vision, open pathways of possibility, rekindle your excitement about parenting, and encourage you on your parenting path.
We have been overwhelmed by the positive feedback we have received from parents and leaders of the natural parenting community across the world!


     
    
We are up for the challenge! Everyone on our team is passionate about this movement, and committed to continue expanding Holistic Parenting Magazine!
We know it takes a village to raise a child... We are asking you to be that community. Lets raise this magazine to it's full potential!


                                             
    Share the love!
We value and appreciate your positive energy here! Of course, everything green ($$) helps but we recognize that not everyone is able to offer financial support. 


Here are some other ways to help: 

SHARE our campaign with EVERYONE you know–parents, midwives, doulas, whole foodies, writers, birth photographers, friends, family, colleagues, alternative practitioners and educators. 
SHARE memes from our gallery.
SHARE our magazine with your friends.
SHARE the love! Send us hugs, kindness, good luck, blessings, and good wishes for success.

story:
A bit about us

Hi! We are Arianna and Giuliano (Aris & G) and just this February we moved back from Italy to G's hometown of Norwich. We had had enough of the lifestyle we had in Rome which is less idyllic than you would imagine so we decided to go on an adventure and head off to Norwich to see what we could make of ourselves.

I, G, have always worked face-to-face with people, in one way or another. My first ever real job was in the Auditorium, in Rome, where I was trained and worked as a Barista. In the mean time I did one-to-one English tuition and moved on to several different jobs in order to find out what I liked the most. As it turns out, making coffee was the one. If you're really that curious about what I've done since I started working, read my C.V. here

www.https://www.dropbox.com/sh/ary625s06ynk4xo/AAC1mSGPLhBxRYRzZ74ysL5Ka?dl=0

Aris and I met in Rome just over a year and a half ago and have not left each others side since. We are in complete harmony and share the same view on (nearly) everything. 

Having continued her studies (in Business & Economics) longer than myself, this is actually Aris's first job but she has taken to it like a fish to water. She grasped in a few months what, admittedly, took me considerably longer to learn and works with a drive and passion that I have rarely come across in my 11 years working in 17 different workplaces.

Moving to Norwich

So, as soon as we moved to Norwich, on the 13th of February, we started hunting for jobs, we spent two weeks handing in C.V.s left right and centre and, one afternoon, the need for caffeine kicked in and so we stopped by a coffee cart and tried to order a coffee. Alas, they were already closing down, even though it was only 2pm. We settled for a Coffee in "Jamie's Italian" and continued our job hunt.

The very next day the same happened, only this time I thought to ask if they would like someone to work the afternoons to which they responded with an even more tempting offer. 

Working at the van

By the 1st of March we were up and running in their place, rent agreed and to be paid until we can save up enough money to buy the coffee van outright. We changed the prices of all the drinks and food immediately and, also, the coffee brand as soon as we ran out of what was left by the owner to a locally roasted coffee from "Wilkinson's of Norwich" which is just round the corner from where we operate. Introducing a new selection of cakes also went down well with customers.

Working longer shifts, giving an Italian touch to our coffee and providing service with a smile, whatever the weather, quickly proved a success as we started to build a customer base that has now become a regular flow of locals, many of whom are now friends and meet regularly at G's Coffee Spot..

The Snag

You might be wondering why an apparently successful business is in need of extra funds and so were we, until we looked back on what we've gone through and achieved in just a few months. 

Having been out of the country for a long time, my credit score had reset, there was no way for either of us to pass referencing to rent a house as we were both self-employed. The only way for us to rent a place to live was to pay 6 months rent in advance, something we couldn't afford and we were starting to get the cold shoulder, staying with friends of a friend.

The only option, at that point, appeared to be emergency accommodation which appeared as an old, rusty, Luton style Ford Transit which I quickly and on a very tight budget made into semi-comfortable living quarters, bedroom, bathroom and all.

This added to all the complications of starting fresh; needing a means of transport, buying all the necessary add-ons for the Luton and the tools to do the job, new clothes as we came across warmer weather (long live charity shops), renting private space to park the coffee van and an apparently endless list of other expenses.

The Crunch

We have just finished paying what we owe to our suppliers  but not in time to save up enough to be able to buy the coffee van by the deadline of the 15th of October 2016.

If we are unable to cough up in time, the coffee van will be sold to someone else.

So this is where you come in...

What you are doing for us

By contributing however little or however much you do, you will be offering us an amazing opportunity that, without your help, we would lose out on. It wouldn't be the end of the world if we didn't succeed, we always manage to land on our feet, but it would be amazing if we could ensure this as the first step in our career as a couple.

We have many plans for the future which we will carry out as and when we are able and owning the coffee van outright would give us the kick start we need and, in the mean time, would guarantee a stable income for the both of us.

What we will do for you

We are not looking for donations or handouts, we want to give back as much as we receive and we will do so. Be it your money's worth of coffee or a weekend break to Naples on the hunt for the best coffee in the world, whatever you invest in us, you will get back. 

Breaking it down

We need a total of £12'500, the asking price to buy the business. Our own savings and what we will earn in the coming weeks should bring that number down to around £7'500 which is the amount we hope to raise through crowdfunding.

story:
We lost a building, but gained an empty lot!

Good can come out of even the most tragic circumstances.  When a steam boiler ruptured at Chicago's Kimball Avenue Church in 2011, the 110-year-old building had to be torn down, leaving the congregation with a large empty lot.  

How do you fill an empty lot?  Create an urban oasis that feeds the body and soul.

With an empty lot, the congregation saw a new opportunity to live its values of reconciliation, justice, and welcome more fully. The congregation envisioned a multi-use outdoor space that fills our human need for physical and spiritual sustenance--kind of like the ancient Garden of Eden . Through partnerships with Voice of the City (a Logan Square arts alliance with the mission to unite artists with one another and the community) and After School Matters, over 75 Chicago high school students have helped turn the congregation's vision into a design for a unified outdoor oasis that includes an organic community garden, outdoor gathering spaces, a rain garden, water features, fruit trees and a meditation/prayer labyrinth. 

This is where you come in.

When you make a donation, you help us purchase the materials needed to construct the centerpiece of the design that will feed the soul--an outdoor, 7-circuit meditation/prayer Labyrinth.  And because we want to make sure that it is both environmentally sustainable and ADA accessible,  we need specific materials like “tuff track” (a eco-friendly permeable gravel paver), stone aggregate that will permit wheelchair access, path delineators that do not create barriers, and more. To our knowledge, this labyrinth will be the only outdoor labyrinth fully accessible to people with disabilities in the Chicago metro area.  Wouldn't it be great to help make this labyrinth a reality?

How does a Labyrinth 'feed the soul'?  

When many people hear the word 'Labyrinth', they think of a puzzle maze with multiple choices and lots of blind alleys and dead ends designed to get people lost.  This is a Meditation and Prayer labyrinth—a unicursal path that leads into a center and back out--designed to get people 'found'.  As people journey toward the center of our Labyrinth, they will enjoy the renewing sights and sounds of birds, water and wind; leave their prayers and cares in a rock wall; and rest in the shade of a beautiful tree at the center of the labyrinth.  Once refreshed, they will be ready to leave the labyrinth and return to their homes, jobs and communities with what they found in the center.  

Labyrinths are an old thing that seems new.  They have been used in various spiritual traditions for centuries as a discipline that centers, encourages awakenings, healing and growth, or serves as a metaphor for our own pilgrimage. There's lots of resources about labyrinths at the National Labyrinth Society.  Yes, there really is such a thing.

More Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word!  Do you know others who are passionate about labyrinths?  Or people with disabilities that often do not have access to outdoor spaces?  Maybe you know people who love community gardens or who see the importance of creating restful places in urban communities.  Maybe others would want to support a project that develops the talents of high school youth.  Thanks for sharing our campaign.  (Indiegogo can help you share it with your online contacts.)  
  • Volunteer to help make the vision a reality.  Contact us through the church website and we'll let you know when we're having work days.  
  • Follow our progress!  We'll be posting pictures and time-lapse videos as the labyrinth takes shape.  

“Stand at the crossroads and look; ask for the ancient paths, ask where the good way is, and walk in it, and you will find rest for your souls.”  Jeremiah 6:16 (NIV)

story:
About this project

We are Santosha Chocolate! 

A SMALL, ETHICAL and PASSIONNATE group of people who LOVE making and supplying the most DELICIOUS, HEALTHY chocolate from the BEST cacao trees that nature provides! 

We believe in HEALTHY FOOD and a HEALTHY PLANET  this is what motivates us to continue providing QUALITY and AFFORDABLE chocolate working everyday with our global suppliers and farms to help find and deliver the BEST QUALITY  raw, ORGANIC  chocolate at the BEST PRICE  with FAIR TRADE  conditions! 




We need your HELP NOW in purchasing a second chocolate grinder to double our production in order to meet the GROWING DEMAND for our chocolate; our way of giving back and making the world a HAPPIER and HEALTHIER place!

We chose Santosha (Contentment in Sanskrit) because we operate under the philosophy that less is more. We believe you can find Santosha in the simplicity and beauty of life. And that translates to us, just a small amount of delicious chocolate a day provides a ton of health benefits without the cravings. 

We are Raw, Vegan, Organic, Allergen friendly, Paleo & Low glycemic (which means NO NASTY SUGAR CRASHES) and which contains medicinal herbs and super-foods. UPLIFTING and SUSTAINED ENERGY all day long! 

We started selling our craft chocolate bars locally in Asheville NC and in three years we've spread throughout the country and sell to over 200 stores in 42 states with US and international distributors waiting for our next move. 

We STONE-GRIND our cacao beans for two days, producing the maximum amount possible with our one chocolate grinder that runs 24/7 and produces about 7000 bar per month. But that is not enough to meet the demand of our product.






IT'S AN EXCITING TIME BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP!

By contributing to our project you'll HELP US meet the growing demand of the CONSCIOUS CONSUMER by doubling our production, allowing us to further our sales and expanding the EDUCATION of the HEALTH BENEFITS of raw, organic, chocolate into new, untapped markets PLUS help spread the Santosha mission. We are so GRATEFULwe get to do what we love everyday, we want to share it with as many as possible!



THANK YOU!


Risks and challenges

The risks are minimal. We have been in business for over 4 years and worked on the R and D for close to 10, finding the best farms in the world and sourcing the best quality cacao imaginable. We are learning new things about how to run Santosha more efficiently and how to produce chocolate that continues to taste better all the time. We work with several business advisors who are passionate about Santosha chocolate and who help with strategy and business development.

story:
Help us reach our stretch goal of $7500.  Thanks to all who helped us get here.

Extra funds help cover real needs in our scholarship program. 


Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2015

NEW: This year the MMC has been granted a matching gift of $10,000 from an anonymous donor.  We are reaching out to our community to help us reach half of that goal.  Our demands for tuition assistance are as strong as ever and the archive project continues on because of the strong support we received last year.  Help us keep the fire burning for another year.

If you are new to our fundraising, read on to learn what our objectives are.

Thirty years ago when Robert Bly launched this conference, he provided men a chance to open-up, to talk about issues usually ignored or buried in their souls. That chance to communicate in fellowship has been a cornerstone of the work of the conference ever since.

This year, in honor of the 31st anniversary of the conference, we want to Assist 31 Men to Attend who otherwise would not be able to do so. The funds we are raising will go towards scholarships, full and partial. If you're reading this, you may have attended a conference and know the treasure that can be found there. Please help us give this gift to other men. Thank you for your support.

Men who are; farmers, craftsmen, laborers, painters, potters, poets, writers, performers, musicians, adventurers, doctors, dentists, professionals and English majors. Like all of us, these men have fought for their lives to get where they are today, and this place is where the honest words of men, and the real experiences they have had in their lives, are shared.

Our Needs

Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2015
  • Each year there are a number of men who cannot afford the registration fees and in some cases even the cost of travel to attend.  Over these years, many men have been given support through the generous donations of others.  Be part of the support for men in need, this year.
The MMC Archive Project (more below)
  • The MMC Archive Project is a multi-year effort that entails digitally remastering the lectures, stories, readings, poems and discussions that were taken over the 30 year history of the MMC.  This effort is costly, time consuming and when finished will be a world treasure.

Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2015

  • Support men who can not afford the registration fees for our annual Men's Conference.  In some cases the funds will cover travel costs as well.  
  • Supporting us helps real men.  Men who are young, old, middle aged, seniors and elders are all represented at the conference.  By supporting men in this real way you are making a real-world difference.  We are also offering perks such as books, downloads, DVD's, and rare lectures or readings from world class poets like Robert Bly and all his friends from over the years.
  • We seriously need to reach our goal.
The MMC Archive Project
  • The MMC Archive Project is a multi-year effort that entails digitally remastering the lectures, stories, readings, poems and discussions that were taken over the 30 year history of the MMC.  
  • There are countless treasures among these recordings from Robert Bly, Martin Shaw, Daniel Deardorff, Robert Moore, William Stafford, Michael Meade, James Hillman, Lewis Hyde, Malidoma Some, Francis Weller, Doug Von Koss, Thomas R. Smith, Miguel Rivera and many more.. 
  • You can hear samples of these remastered files on the MMC website, powerful segments like the 25th retelling of the Iron John story

Youtube Playlist: IRON JOHN - PARTS 1-4


    • Also see various other segments on the MMC website -  http://www.minnesotamensconference.com/main/ 

    Rebuilding Community

    • By definition the MMC is a gathering of men and a way for men to practice and to interact with each other in community.  
    • The MMC has been conducting it's annual event for 30 years and looks  generations into the future as we establish new roots and honor the efforts of many men from its past.
    • The Minnesota Men's Conference, Robert Bly and thousands of men it has touched have been talked about on national television, radio programs and inside the halls of universities.  Supporting men by providing the means for them to attend Robert Bly's Minnesota Men's Conference supports the growth and evolution of good men needed in today's world.

    Risks & Challenges

    • Although the Minnesota Men's Conference has been around for a long time, we find ourselves having to evolve in a new culture with new challenges.  The MMC nearly disappeared just a few years ago due to the waining health of it's founder Robert Bly and related financial impacts.  
    • Through the deep commitment of the new board of directors and the enthusiasm of a world class operational team the MMC seeks to re-establish itself and offer it's own treasures to many thousand more men.  
    • We need your financial contribution and word-of-mouth exposure to do that.
    THANK YOU and BLESSINGS
    John Ernst
    Executive Director
story_txt:
Help us reach our stretch goal of $7500.  Thanks to all who helped us get here.
Extra funds help cover real needs in our scholarship program. 



Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2015
NEW: This year the MMC has been granted a matching gift of $10,000 from an anonymous donor.  We are reaching out to our community to help us reach half of that goal.  Our demands for tuition assistance are as strong as ever and the archive project continues on because of the strong support we received last year.  Help us keep the fire burning for another year.
If you are new to our fundraising, read on to learn what our objectives are.

Thirty years ago when Robert Bly launched this conference, he provided men a chance to open-up, to talk about issues usually ignored or buried in their souls. That chance to communicate in fellowship has been a cornerstone of the work of the conference ever since.

This year, in honor of the 31st anniversary of the conference, we want to Assist 31 Men to Attend who otherwise would not be able to do so. The funds we are raising will go towards scholarships, full and partial. If you're reading this, you may have attended a conference and know the treasure that can be found there. Please help us give this gift to other men. Thank you for your support.


Men who are; farmers, craftsmen, laborers, painters, potters, poets, writers, performers, musicians, adventurers, doctors, dentists, professionals and English majors. Like all of us, these men have fought for their lives to get where they are today, and this place is where the honest words of men, and the real experiences they have had in their lives, are shared.

Our Needs
Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2015


Each year there are a number of men who cannot afford the registration fees and in some cases even the cost of travel to attend.  Over these years, many men have been given support through the generous donations of others.  Be part of the support for men in need, this year.


The MMC Archive Project (more below)
The MMC Archive Project is a multi-year effort that entails digitally remastering the lectures, stories, readings, poems and discussions that were taken over the 30 year history of the MMC.  This effort is costly, time consuming and when finished will be a world treasure.


Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2015

 
Support men who can not afford the registration fees for our annual Men's Conference.  In some cases the funds will cover travel costs as well.   
Supporting us helps real men.  Men who are young, old, middle aged, seniors and elders are all represented at the conference.  By supporting men in this real way you are making a real-world difference.  We are also offering perks such as books, downloads, DVD's, and rare lectures or readings from world class poets like Robert Bly and all his friends from over the years.
 We seriously need to reach our goal.

The MMC Archive Project
The MMC Archive Project is a multi-year effort that entails digitally remastering the lectures, stories, readings, poems and discussions that were taken over the 30 year history of the MMC.  
There are countless treasures among these recordings from Robert Bly, Martin Shaw, Daniel Deardorff, Robert Moore, William Stafford, Michael Meade, James Hillman, Lewis Hyde, Malidoma Some, Francis Weller, Doug Von Koss, Thomas R. Smith, Miguel Rivera and many more.. 
You can hear samples of these remastered files on the MMC website, powerful segments like the 25th retelling of the Iron John story


Youtube Playlist: IRON JOHN - PARTS 1-4


Also see various other segments on the MMC website -  http://www.minnesotamensconference.com/main/ 
 
  Rebuilding Community 
By definition the MMC is a gathering of men and a way for men to practice and to interact with each other in community.   The MMC has been conducting it's annual event for 30 years and looks  generations into the future as we establish new roots and honor the efforts of many men from its past.
The Minnesota Men's Conference, Robert Bly and thousands of men it has touched have been talked about on national television, radio programs and inside the halls of universities.  Supporting men by providing the means for them to attend Robert Bly's Minnesota Men's Conference supports the growth and evolution of good men needed in today's world. 
  Risks & Challenges 
Although the Minnesota Men's Conference has been around for a long time, we find ourselves having to evolve in a new culture with new challenges.  The MMC nearly disappeared just a few years ago due to the waining health of it's founder Robert Bly and related financial impacts.  
Through the deep commitment of the new board of directors and the enthusiasm of a world class operational team the MMC seeks to re-establish itself and offer it's own treasures to many thousand more men.  
We need your financial contribution and word-of-mouth exposure to do that.

THANK YOU and BLESSINGSJohn ErnstExecutive Director

story:
Credits: Massey/Neugent/Lowell Obs./NSF


The possibility of discovering life outside our solar system is no longer science fiction but a matter of time. There may be 70 billion planets or more in our galaxy alone that could possibly harbor life. Help Lowell Observatory in humanity's quest to finally answer the question: Are We Alone?

Our Story

The mission of Lowell Observatory is to pursue the study of astronomy, especially the study of our solar system and its evolution. We conduct pure research in astronomical phenomena and maintain quality public education and outreach programs to share our discoveries with the general public. This mission began on Mars Hill in 1894.

Since then, Lowell astronomers have made some of the biggest discoveries in modern history:

  •  Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto in 1930 using a telescope still on our campus.
  •  In 1912, V.M. Slipher used Percival Lowell's 24" Clark Refractor to be the first to observe the expanding nature of our universe.
  • Dr. Will Grundy is a Co-Investigator on NASA’s New Horizons mission flying by Pluto on July 14th and into the Kuiper Belt. He leads the team responsible for discoveries about Pluto's surface composition. 

Lowell’s rich history provides a strong foundation for today’s astronomers to use one of the most advanced telescopes in the world: our new Discovery Channel Telescope (DCT).

This 4.3-meter telescope became fully commissioned on January 1st, 2015. The cost of operating the DCT is $13,400.00/night. With your support, our astronomers will use the DCT for wide-ranging research including discovering and characterizing habitable exoplanets. 

Get a Perk!

In gratitude for your support we are offering several exciting, astronomy-themed perks!

Featured Perk:

                                                      Mars Globe Replica

                  

We are giving away this Mars Globe Replica as a perk to the first 5 people who make $300 donations. The replica globe, based on Percival Lowell's observations of Mars during its 1905 opposition, was created by Keith Boulger. It sits on a wooden base with a solid brass meridian. Get yours while you can!


Deep Space Image of the Week

Every donation $25 or more will receive an email with an image taken with the DCTs Large Monolithic Imager. 

               DIFFERENT IMAGE EVERY WEEK!

                    

                                   Credit: Neugent/Massey/Lowell Obs./NSF 

This image of the Helix Nebula could be yours! Donate every week to collect them all. Check out the gallery on the menu at the top of the page to see all 7 images. 


Pluto Discovery Circular

When you donate $50 you'll receive an electronic image from Lowell Observatory's archives. You will have your very own image of the circular announcing the discovery of Pluto in 1930. 

This is just a snippet of the full image!


Limited Edition Pluto Trading Cards

For a $100 donation we'll mail you the full pack of nine cards. 

        


Tie or Scarf Printed with Lowell's Telescopes

When you donate $250 you can select a tie or scarf and we'll mail it to you! This unique accessory is printed with a blueprint from our Pluto telescope. 

                                      


"Ask an Astronomer" Webinar with Dr. Gerard van Belle

A donation of $275 gives you the opportunity to attend a webinar with Lowell's Dr. Gerard van Belle. 

                                       

Dr. Gerard van Belle measures the masses and temperatures of distant stars in an attempt to understand the many new planets being discovered around them. 


Tour the Discovery Channel Telescope

For a donation of $500 you can see the DCT in person! On this private tour, an astronomer will escort you to the DCT located 40 miles outside Flagstaff, Arizona. You will go behind the scenes at one of the most advanced telescopes in the world. 

*We ask that you book your tour two months in advance and allow 3 hours for transport to the site, lunch and the tour. 

"Pluto" Webinar with Dr. Will Grundy

When you donate $350 you are invited to join a webinar discussion with Dr. Will Grundy, a Co-Investigator for NASA's New Horizons mission flying by Pluto on July 14th. 

        

         


Dr. Will Grundy leads the New Horizons team responsible for discoveries about Pluto's surface composition. There will be a Q&A session after the webinar!

Receive an Original Percival Lowell Publication

Donate $300 and we will send you your very own original publication of Percival Lowell's Memoir on a Trans-Neptunian Planet.  

                                        


Become an Honorary Astronomer

Your donation of $1,000 gets you and one guest a two-night stay in the Clyde Tombaugh Apartment at Lowell Observatory. You'll receive a tour of our archives, the Pluto telescope and you'll have your own private viewing through the historic (recently restored) 24" Clark Refractor. To top off your stay, Director Jeffrey Hall will take you to dinner. PLUS take home an Honorary Lowell Observatory Astronomer Certificate!

*We ask that you book your stay two months in advance.

story:
Hello wonderful people,

We are an Edinburgh-based wellbeing centre specialising in deep relaxation and stress relief, sports and remedial therapies, and supporting women, their partners and families through pregnancy, birth and the postnatal period.

We're super excited to share with you our plans for the next few years. We've found a fabulous new Edinburgh city-centre venue for our therapy centre and we can't wait for you to see it... we are moving in on 26th June 2015. The new address is; 40-42 Montrose Terrace, Edinburgh EH7 5DL.

We have always been limited with what we can do in our existing clinic - we aren't able to hold any of our parent and baby services there and the access isn't great for people with chronic health issues or impairments. The new venue will enable us to create a mellow, welcoming space, suitable for all ages and for our full range of services – from sports massage to parent and baby classes, yoga to osteopathy, fertility support to meditation and qi gong, birth preparation and pregnancy massage to postnatal care – all in one gorgeous city centre clinic.  

Our goal has always been - and will continue to be - to offer accessible therapies, workshops and classes.

The venue is great but needs some love before we can welcome you there. It urgently needs new flooring, restored ceilings, painting, joinery work, shelving, rewired lighting. We also need new furniture, soft furnishings, blinds, window vinyls, shop signage, baby changing facilities... 

We are putting everything we have into this venture but we still need to raise £7000. To help us raise the funds upfront we've come up with some AMAZING PERKS for you all. If you feel like treating yourself to a therapy or workshop in advance, or sending some bliss to a friend we would be enormously grateful. 

We have also teamed up with local Edinburgh charity, CCLASP (Children with Cancer and Leukaemia Advice and Support for Parents), to offer massage to parents and carers of children with cancer and leukaemia. For just £30, through our Suspended Therapy perk, you can help us provide support to a family going through a very tough time.  

We would be SO grateful if you would support our venture. It's a big challenge for a small business to juggle raising funds, whilst staggering the renovations as we can afford to pay for them, and we have only a few more weeks to do it! If you can help us spread the word we will love you forever.

Thanks so much for your support. We hope to welcome you to our new venue soon.

From all of us at KnotStressed Therapies

Here's our hope:

£2000 will help cover the costs of the flooring. 

If we raise a further £1000 we can get the electrics rewired and install new lighting to allow us to create dimmable, mellow therapy and group rooms. 

A further £2000 will mean we can plaster and restore the ceilings, get the shop front and very high ceilings painted (we will paint the lower parts and the walls ourselves!) and put in window vinyl to ensure privacy in our yoga/massage studio.

A further £1000 will mean we can get shelving to complete the rooms and some beautiful window vinyls and shop-front signage to let you all know we are here ;-)

and then we get to pamper you all in style!

.

story:
All this "gravy talk" around Toronto the past few years has caused many of us to constantly crave the stuff!

The Gravy Train is a small restaurant concept designed to cater to the desire for dunking delectable food into delicious dips. Whoa, that was a mouthful - just like our wings!

The mouth is not only used to eat, it's also used to laugh. Both behaviours are pivotal to health. That said, we're adopting a satirical approach to restaurant marketing, yet we're very serious regarding our mission to serve food with wholesome, high-quality ingredients prepared using healthier methods.

Foodies, funky folks and families - all aboard! It's time to put healthier food in your mouths and have a laugh doing so. (Hopefully not at the same time. A wise man once said, "Say it, don't spray it. We want the news, not the weather!")

Our menu is designed around an array of gourmet gravy, delightful dips, savoury sauces and scrumptious spreads. Most of these items are homemade, with some created exclusivlely for us by popular local chefs. We also feature dips produced in small batches and bottled by companies who share our passion for high-quality ingredients.

Our mains, or "dippables," are healthy spins on classics. Our wings and chicken strips are baked, not deep-fried. This method is more calorie-conscious and it allows our flavourful marinades to shine. Our hand-cut fries are cooked in healthier oils and sprinkled lightly with micro-mineral-rich Himalayan salt. If you're avoiding high-fat foods, we also offer seasoned sweet potato fries that are baked. Dip 'em all in our homemade ketchup with abandon, knowing it's not loaded with high fructose corn syrup - ours is crafted with malt vinegar and and a touch of organic Canadian maple syrup.

The menu at The Gravy Train isn't stationary, either. We feature fun, seasonal and limited-time offerings. Think: Guinness gravy for St. Patty's day, turkey poutine during Thanksgiving season. And, yes, the rumours are true - we love showing off our signature bacon gravy. Mmmm, bacon. We've got a number of taste bud-tantalizing specials up our sleeves, so there are always plenty of new destinations for your dippables.

As for ingredients - organics are no stranger to our menu and we do our darndest to source locally.

But the essential ingredient is YOU!

The Gravy Train's interior will feature train motifs, of course! Rich, repurposed wood and rustic metal detaling with a cozy vibe. We're already scouring the 'net and our city for antique train parts and memorabilia that will become fun fixtures. We'll also display vintage photography celebrating Toronto's rich train history.

The Gravy Train is the brainchild of James Applegath and Craig Brissenden, long-time friends who met in high school.

James co-founded Nasa Dance Pub, a popular Queen Street West hot spot that operated for 5 years. He then shifted his business focus online and was awarded as an eBay entrepreneur of the year in 2007. Currently he works as a consultant marketing small businesses online.

For more than a decade, Craig was the general manager and head cook at The Bistro on Avenue - the famous location which spawned the St. Louis Bar & Grill franchise. He contributed to the success of several other locations and was instrumental in launching a new location a few years ago.

We're looking for $20,000 to give us the initial boost to bring this fun lil' place to fruition. Why so much? It's actually only a fraction of the total investment required to build a restaurant from scratch, buy equipment and cover rental costs while doing so.

We can't get started on our fun journey without your support so we devised perks that are jam-packed with incredible value. You're not just donating money - you're getting a healthy return on your contribution!

Your positive response to our campaign will help us shape the establishment and ensure we're on the right track. We see this business as a collective effort, so we'll be asking for your input every step of the way via the voting booth on our website. Weigh-in on everything from which neighbourhood this restaurant should be located in, to which menu items wet your whistle most.

Just like we'll encourage our customers to share amongst themselves, please share this campaign with your pals. Connect with us on our blog, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, and MySpace (just kidding!).

A forum for political discussion. Use your mouth to eat and laugh, not to argue! Right, left - it doesn't matter which hand holds your fork while you're eating our food.

story:
The community of Coron is building a home/community center. It’s like no other in the world. Built from the sweat, tears, love, and hard work of our locals, we’re creating a revolution in our town.

Where on Earth is Coron?

Coron is a tropical island in the Province of Palawan. We are often called the last unspoiled frontier in the Philippines. Like many tropical paradise locations, we have tourism, but like many Caribbean islands (think Haiti), the locals are poor and live on meager incomes. But we are a special people and highly eco oriented.

You would fall in love with our land, our sea and our people.

The Ultimate Eco Home

Heard of Earthbag building? Our community came together for this massive project to carefully make strong bags about the size of a pillow. Then we selected an area with the perfect soil, with just the right elements and consistency. Thousands of these handmade bags are carefully placed  in the exact locations instead of using wood and nails. We named the house “Castillo”.

Think how well these insulate. Visualize how strong the walls are to protect the people inside against Pacific storms.

 

 

The Revolution

Something happened while we were building. Word travelled fast, and people came from all over, curious about our new way of constructing a total eco-built house. We became a revolution of sustainability in every sense of the word.

All these volunteers wanted to help so they could build their own houses using the same method. They don’t have to cut down trees and harm the unique tropical animal and bird habitats.

Our community has started a home building revolution. We all believe our “technology” is a game changer. Our revolution is a social project where everyone has a part, changing the way we grow, and provides a livelihood for thousands.

 

                                            Many members of our community came together.

 

 

 

Our methods became an idea generator. We talk about all the possibilities. You have a unique opportunity to change many lives. To change our future.

Now you can participate in our exclusive journey.

You get to turn dreams into a new reality for an entire community. The reality of promise and hope for our poor community.

You get to help our children with a greater future.

 

                                          Their dreams. Your help.

We’re about three-fourths complete on the house. It’s like a live-in model home used to teach our community. The home will also serve as a bed & breakfast and education center (until we can build another one to use as a community center and building co-op. Like any good startup, we have made mistakes and learned from them. Those mistakes become part of the fabric of who we are as a people.

When we finish this house, it will breathe life into additional livelihood programs, and an active business community around a new industry.

Oh, and it’s all natural, 100% eco. It’s sustainable in every sense of the word:

  • Our materials
  • Our community collaboration
  • Our low/no-energy design
  • Long-term social impact for us, our children and grandchildren
  • It’s huge impact on our society and even nearby communities. 
  • Giving back to the community over and over for generations to come
  • Leverages new knowledge fueling even more overall sustainability
  • This is just the beginning of our revolution

 

Use of the Funds

+/- 30 % of the funds raised will be used to buy sacks, lime plaster,  wood, tiles, paint, waterproofing and to pay the wages of the workers to finish the construction of the house. (To finish the kitchen, 1 bedroom, toilets and showers)

+/- 30 % to build a big water tank to store water/ rain catchment, water pump, Water purification system,  4 composting toilets ( B&B rooms) plus shipment,  a small Solar system for the house.

+/- 30 % to pay for all the  perks, for Indiegogo, paypal and bank charges.

 

The Support:

Here's a number of ways you can help us:

1. financial contribution and / or

2. promotional support: 

a. you can like us in facebook,

b. you can pin us in pinterest,

c. you can tweet about us,

d. you can mention us in your blog or paste our link  in your blog or facebook

e. and you can tell your friends about us. 

The Rewards:

I appreciate your time and support.

 

Please check our perks for our gift for your donation.

 

Love and gratitude from Coron,

 

 Susan

PS

All friends, contributors and promoters are welcome to visit Castillo in Coron.

 Susan

story:
When a birthday comes to pass, people usually only think about the gifts they will receive for their birthday. What I want to do is giveback to the world for my birthday. I want to raise atleast $500 for my local food pantry. The food pantry is called 'Family Sharing Saukville Food Bank'. 

While I was growing up, my family had to go to my local food pantry to get food for all of us. That mean't a lot to our family, so now I want to make sure that other familIes have the same resources.

story:
what is boko?

the aim of boko is to eventually be a place for a community to grow and learn together through making. We see it as a grand version of the community workshop or co-op which is dedicated to giving people the tools they need to pursue their creative dreams. 

we see boko as a model for combatting environmental accountability through creating local community, and by encouraging a connection with nature and material.

what we need 

as boko grows - we are collecting tools.

as we grow - we are collecting tools for use in the workshop. We are still not at a level which is ready to make a large public contribution, but we want desperately to get to that level.

by purchasing a notebook from boko - you are helping us to go forward with our goal and use the money we raise to give us overhead for sharing what we have learned and also to add to our tool budget.

specifically

- we hope to purchase an industrial paper trimmer for community use.

 

what you get

our sketchbooks are quickly becoming the prize of our local community here. designers and creative types are always in need of a sketchbook but we have found that all of our options in local stores come from overseas and are very expensive.

you will receive a sketchbook / journal made by us, machine stitched and trimmed by hand.

 

kraft eco journal

30 blank pages + boko stamped cover ( stamp optional )

 

decorative journal 

30 blank pages + decorative cover ( they are all beautiful )

 

 your impact

beyond making a local impact - our small actions have global impact as more people become actively involved in 'maker' communities all over the world.

together through our actions we can help build an education that engenders equality and compassion for each other and our living environment.

  

other ways you can help

make a money donation to contribute to our cause if you don't have use for a sketchbook. we would very much appreciate it. 

but who doesn't want a sketchbook made by us, using FSC rated paper ?

 

thanks for reading, 

 

boko

 

shipping

we will ship to anyone who is in support of our campaign - shipping costs will be extra. 

anyone can also pick up thier books at the following locations to avoid shipping costs. ( more locations to come )

 

TORONTO

1114 QUEEN STREET EAST
TORONTO, ONT
M4M 1K7
LESLIEVILLE

WATERLOO

90 Frobisher Drive, Unit 3
Waterloo, Ontario
N2V 2A1

CAMBRIDGE

Apt#501
10 George St South,
Cambridge, ON N1S 2L8

 

* local deliveries can be made for bulk orders

 

 

cost for 3 book package to be mailed:

 

canada - $1

US  - $2

International - $3

story: every year we host the zombie walk In hopes to feed a few families. in November, because of our walkers, we collected enough food to feed 368 people. we would love to carry on the yearly tradition, so we ask you for help funding it. your money will go towards the permits and insurance. whatever is left over will go to the food bank.

story:
My Name is Khalida Brohi, I am 24 year old from a small village in the Balochistan province of Pakistan and I have a dream:

To save the lives of 1 million women from the hidious custom of Honor Killings. 

Unlike others I didnt see my dream in the dark of the night nor in my sleep but it happened to me in the wake of the day when I was 16 years old and just discovered that my friend is murdered just because she wanted to marry someone she liked. 

My Journey started there...

I am a very fortunate person. Life offered me much more then I could ever imagine, coming from a small village that I was, I still got my freedom, education, opportunities and power of decision making that no other girl in my family or community could get. In a way I lived my life distributed between two very distinct realities: one my original inheritance, the second my gained identity. 

My original inheritance is that I belong to a tribal community in Balochistan to a society where traditions fix the fate of each girl. But luck turned out that I became the first girl in my community who could get her education in Karachi, and I was provided every opportunity to grow and learn and encouraged to speak my mind. 

My freedom every second became the nagging influence on my choosing to step forward and try my hardest to change the lives of other girls in my community who still live the life of a slave to the negative tribal traditions like exchange marriages, early marriages, arranged marriages and even honor killings. And when life shook me hard with the news of my friend I began my own kind of a fight against honor killing through Sughar!

Honor killings – the murders of women who are deemed to have brought dishonor onto their families – have existed in Pakistan for centuries. Women have been killed for such “offenses” as refusing to enter into arranged marriages, or dressing “inappropriately,” or even being the victims of sexual assaults.

Official statistics show that about 675 women were killed in the name of honor in the first nine months of 2011: (Reference, NewsWeek Report Dec 2011)   While UN declares that more then 1000 women are killed every year in Pakistan, however which are only registered and reported cases, the cases of murders unreported are enormous!

Everyday a mother is forced to leave the world of her children, a girl is killed for mere suspicion or a woman raped and murdered in the name of so called Honor! A recent report declares almost a thousand reported cases every year! (http://tribune.com.pk/story/353572/nearly-1000-pakistan-women-killed-for-honour/)

A NEW STRATEGY TO FIGHT HONOR KILLINGS: 

What is the Strategy?

We decided not to fight. But to use our enemies as our enemies as our Allies, instead of fighting against the traditions, we decided to promote whats the best. 

Instead of fighting against the traditional ways of tribal villages, we at Sughar Women Program PROMOTE those traditions in order to end Honor Killings. We work directly with tribal leaders, influential men and mullahs in tribal villages of Pakistan to promote traditional customs such as MUSIC, LANGUAGE AND EMBROIDERY. 

Once we have established a presence inside the village, and we have the strong support of its leaders on our side, we create Sughar Centers where village women are recruited to join for six months to have 2 hours of sessions everday on enterprise development, self awarenes, life skills, basic education and value addition of traditional embroidery. 

What actually happens in the Sughar Centers?

In this Sughar Center, while going through their life changing experience of education and awraeness, women create beautiful embroidered products which have become a huge part of the fashion industry in Pakistan as Sughar is launched as Pakistan's first ever rural women fashion brand.

Upon graduating from the six-month course, each woman is offered a loan to start her own small business, thus promoting entrepreneurship, which greatly influences women’s power through ownership.

We are now working with 700 women in the Sindh and Balochistan provinces of Pakistan. Our goal is to open more Sughar Centers throughout Pakistan, one village at a time, to reach 1 million women in the next 10 years!

More Women and more villages need Sughar Centers. WE NEED YOUR HELP!

This year, we plan to train 400 more women leaders, by creating 6 more Sughar Centers in 6 Pakistani tribal villages where honor killing, along with child marriages and arranged marriages, are most prevalent. The funds we are raising will go to: 

SHOP AT SUGHAR TO HELP SUGHAR WOMEN: 

One of the most innovative aspects of Sughar program is that we have launhed Pakistan's first Tribal Fashion Brand to help earn more income for the women as well as give them the space they need in this big growing industry. Here is the video of the Fashion Brand Launch: 

THE FUNDS ARE GOING TO BE USED FOR:

  • Mobilization meetings with the tribal leaders and influential men of the villages 
  • Establishing the 6 Sughar centers for 30 women in each village
  • Purchasing the modules, books, charts, learning material and embroidery material for women to take their 6-months course cycle 
  • Finishing and marketing the women’s embroidery products around Pakistan and abroad
  • Providing loans to women after the 6-month course cycle to start their own businesses 
  • Shipping our embroidery products to the UK, USA and Australia for sales 

HERE IS HOW YOU HELP: 

Choose your fav Embroidery product created by tribal women in Pakistan and order on the right side by clicking on the same number of the perk. 

Product # 1:

Dancing Camel Clutch

Product  # 2: 

Water Pot Clutch:

 

Product # 3: 

Balochi Gaj Clutch: 

Prodcut # 4: 

Balochi Gaj Small Size

Product # 5: 

Sughar Party Wear Code 001

Product # 6:

Sughar Pary Wear Code 002

Product # 7:

Tribal Hand Bag

Product # 8:

Rili Hand Bag

 

Product # 0:

The Frog Clutch

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t give money right now? We totally understand. But there are other ways you can help Pakistani women:

  • Send this link to three people who might want to shop at Sughar!
  • Share on Twitter, Facebook or anywhere else you are online
  • Help us spread the word, so that tribal women in Pakistan can lead lives of equality and security.

We thank you with all of our hearts for being with us in this fight. The impact we have been able to create so far – and the greater impact we are planning – wouldn’t be possible without people like you who believe in us, encourage and support us!

With Gratitude,

Sughar Team~

Sughar Women Program a TEDx Talk

Founder in NewsWeek List of 100 Women that matter in Pakistan

NBC Universal feature on Sughar!

Sughar Receives National Award

Ashoka India Interviews Sughar Founder

story:
Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! - We are here to stay!

 Because of YOU we are able to remain in the community and provide even better coffee and baked goods! We really can't thank you enough!  

So Now What? 

We're not done! We have 1 week left in the campaign and 2 stretch goals left! Please share the campaign and don't forget to pass the word along in the really real world. We're all about the interwebs but know that not everyone has used Indiegogo.



Stretch goal #2 OPERATION: BOOT THE BOOT! 

Speaking of that pesky parking problem...anyone who lives and works in East Liberty knows how hard it is to find all-day parking. We'd also like to utilize the 20 parking spaces at our roastery for public leasing. We've earned ourselves a fair share of parking tickets over the years, and if you work in East Lib, you know what we're talking about. We'd like to supply the public with a safe place to leave their ride in the morning and a free cup a day for any lease holder. All we need to do is a bit of clean up, install some safety lighting, and hire a line painter. If we reach $25,000 we'll be able to build you a parking lot! 

Anyone who has donated to the campaign gets first priority for the spaces and will receive a 20% discount on their lease! 

What happens if we reach $30,000?

Stretch goal #3 OPERATION: GREEN SPACE

We've been dreaming of adding some green space for picnicking or spring/summer get-togethers. How about a park grill for summer cookouts in the city!? Pour a few back and watch as we transform the outskirts of our property into a sweet spot to have a cup of coffee (or a beer), cook some ribs (or veggies!) and hang out with your coworkers or family. If we hit $30,000 we'll landscape the wild growth around our roastery that currently collects plastic bags and discarded trash and refuse from the city into a beautiful green space to chill and reflect. Tire Swing for the kids? Horse Shoe Pit? Picnic tables? Flower beds? New Trees? Yup. 

Pittsburgh! You've already given a lot, but we know these projects are within reach and would be a true benefit to our city. Please consider sharing or showing your support in whatever way you can.

Again, Thank You! Thank You! THANK YOU! 

-Zeke's Coffee PGH family. Chris, Brye, Alex, Savannah, Tyler, Chad, Danielle and Wes

Over the weekend we (with some friendly help) moved (almost) everything out of 6012 Penn, (a truly surreal experience as it's been our home for nearly 4 years!) and are hard at work on the new space.

At the New Zeke's Coffee Pittsburgh we will be able to have more seats and treats with better wifi and our signature fresh roasted coffee! Same Awesome Staff! More Drinks! Public Bathrooms! Oh My!

We're planning a soft opening in the coming month and hope you'll join us. We'll be sure to let everyone know once the date is nailed down. 


________________________________________________________________________

What’s a Zeke’s Coffee?

We are a small local business that refuses to quit! We are a family-owned small batch roastery, café and bakery located in the heart of the up-and-coming East Liberty neighborhood of Pittsburgh.  We’re in our fourth year here and we’re still pushing forward, fueling this community with our fresh-roasted coffee and baked goods made from local organic ingredients.  We offer over 30 varieties of highest quality Arabica coffee, many of which are Natural Fair Trade, roasted in small batches through the “fluid bed” method, which ensures a very high level of consistency.

We’ve grown quite a bit since our humble beginnings in 2011, when you could find owner/master roaster Chris Rhodes roasting a single pound at a time, riding around town and pouring hot cups for construction workers from his ‘coffee bike’, and bringing “pounds to the people” at local farmer’s markets. With the addition of Chris’ wife Brye’s homemade baked goods, as well as a kick-ass espresso machine, business has been growing steadily. Our customers have become like family – regulars who live/work in East Liberty and local businesses (cafés, bars, offices, etc) that buy our pounds – and they’ve helped to make us strong and push us to work harder every day to extend our reach throughout Pittsburgh.

Despite the odds (Pittsburgh has some pretty intense coffee competition), we’ve worked our asses off to establish ourselves here in this changing community, but we now face some pretty big challenges and need your help! We’re working non-stop to meet growing demand, and at the same time, we are faced with having to completely uproot our café/bakery and move to a new location by January, as developers get ready to demo the block for new projects.

That’s put us in a tight spot! We are lucky to have secured TWO new locations in our rapidly growing neighborhood:

A new café/bakery (6015 Penn Ave), just across the street from where we are now! We’ve completed the demolition and are steadily renovating the space. It will offer much more production space for baking and plenty of indoor/outdoor seating in a cozy environment for our growing East Lib family of customers. With this, we will be able to step up our coffee game, at the same time, highlighting local businesses with the addition of light breakfast and lunch.

A new roastery/packaging facility and drive thru (6314 Broad St). We’re stoked about this! Our new roaster there is helping to increase our production by 70%. Plus, we are turning the location’s huge parking lot into a much-needed (so we’ve been told) coffee DRIVE-THRU! We’re building this out in the next few weeks. Now if we only had heat, proper electric and maybe some hot water!

The stage is set, the work is in progress. Here’s where you come in...

We’re So Close!

With so much to do, we are running thin and need your help. So we’re launching this campaign for our Café/Bakery and want to offer you some great things for the holiday season, some cool perks and a chance to join our family here in East Liberty.

With everything happening all at once it's increasingly difficult to determine dollar for dollar where the money goes, but we can tell you what we need and our prospected expense to complete these projects, as well as what you'll get for your gracious support. 

1) Renovations: We need to finish renovations, i.e. paint, floors, doors, working surfaces, tables and chairs, plumbing and electric. We've got a kitty set aside for some of this work, but all in all estimated cost is another $30,000. 

2) Espresso Machine and Equipment: We need a new espresso machine as the one we currently use will move to the drive-thru. We also need to purchase other equipment for the new cafe to make us more efficient in serving you. Estimated cost $10,000 - $15,000.

Why then are we only asking for $15,000? Because we think it's insane to ask for more. We're working hard every day to find avenues to finance and get this work done as cheaply and efficiently as possible. We've created stretch goals with this campaign because well... every bit helps. 

What You Get

Just imagine, these could be yours! Here are some highlights of things we are giving away.

Pounds, pounds, pounds! If you haven’t had our coffee, we will hook you up with our little bags of fresh-roasted joy and make you a believer.



Sweet Treats - Brye and the Zeke’s bakery – she makes a mean chocolate-peanut butter cookie and her pecan bars taste like they fell from heaven.

Zeke’s T’s - Because we want you to look good. To be designed by Pittsburgh artist Chris Smith. (photo to come!)


Suspended Coffees! Because sometimes someone somewhere is in desperate need of a hug. Give them a hug in a mug. 

Why Bother?

Our community of East Liberty is changing – crime is down, foot traffic is up, and people are coming here for the first time since the 80’s. We’ve been here since the very beginning of this revival, and we want to remain part of the fabric and have a say! Your donation to our cause will help to maintain an independent, small local business in the midst of an increasingly corporate landscape. It will support  the mom’n pop, do-it-yourself culture that keeps our cities from being a big pile of lame!

We’ve got to be able to compete. So since we have to relocate, we are taking the opportunity to upgrade our operation so that we can. We want to offer more to our community without sacrificing what we believe in – more fresh-roasted coffee and homemade baked goods, more seating and accommodations at our café, and more support of other local business, whether that’s through wholesale, at farmers markets, or selling other locally-made goods at our shop.

Risks & Challenges

The deadline for our move is January 10th. It is likely that we will be unable to complete the new cafe to its full glory by that time (but we're trying!). We are hoping to simply remain operational and have the core work completed in time for the move. Some working capital will certainly help in this venture.

Like any business, we've had our share of obstacles before, and through hard work and sweat, we've overcome them one at a time. Your donation will allow you to be a literal part of the brick and mortar as you watch us grow and change. 

Other Ways You Can Help! 

We understand that this is the holiday season. Money is tight and sometimes you're just not in a position to be able to help some strange coffee sling'n peeps. If you're into what we do.... tell people! Help us promote this in any way you can. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools to make it easy for ya. Just a few clicks and you've done us a huge service!
story_txt:
Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! - We are here to stay!
 Because of YOU we are able to remain in the community and provide even better coffee and baked goods! We really can't thank you enough!  


So Now What? 
We're not done! We have 1 week left in the campaign and 2 stretch goals left! Please share the campaign and don't forget to pass the word along in the really real world. We're all about the interwebs but know that not everyone has used Indiegogo.




Stretch goal #2 OPERATION: BOOT THE BOOT! 
Speaking of that pesky parking problem...anyone who lives and works in East Liberty knows how hard it is to find all-day parking. We'd also like to utilize the 20 parking spaces at our roastery for public leasing. We've earned ourselves a fair share of parking tickets over the years, and if you work in East Lib, you know what we're talking about. We'd like to supply the public with a safe place to leave their ride in the morning and a free cup a day for any lease holder. All we need to do is a bit of clean up, install some safety lighting, and hire a line painter. If we reach $25,000 we'll be able to build you a parking lot! 


Anyone who has donated to the campaign gets first priority for the spaces and will receive a 20% discount on their lease! What happens if we reach $30,000?
Stretch goal #3 OPERATION: GREEN SPACE
We've been dreaming of adding some green space for picnicking or spring/summer get-togethers. How about a park grill for summer cookouts in the city!? Pour a few back and watch as we transform the outskirts of our property into a sweet spot to have a cup of coffee (or a beer), cook some ribs (or veggies!) and hang out with your coworkers or family. If we hit $30,000 we'll landscape the wild growth around our roastery that currently collects plastic bags and discarded trash and refuse from the city into a beautiful green space to chill and reflect. Tire Swing for the kids? Horse Shoe Pit? Picnic tables? Flower beds? New Trees? Yup. 

Pittsburgh! You've already given a lot, but we know these projects are within reach and would be a true benefit to our city. Please consider sharing or showing your support in whatever way you can.Again, Thank You! Thank You! THANK YOU! 
-Zeke's Coffee PGH family. Chris, Brye, Alex, Savannah, Tyler, Chad, Danielle and Wes



Over the weekend we (with some friendly help) moved (almost) everything out of 6012 Penn, (a truly surreal experience as it's been our home for nearly 4 years!) and are hard at work on the new space.
At the New Zeke's Coffee Pittsburgh we will be able to have more seats and treats with better wifi and our signature fresh roasted coffee! Same Awesome Staff! More Drinks! Public Bathrooms! Oh My!We're planning a soft opening in the coming month and hope you'll join us. We'll be sure to let everyone know once the date is nailed down.

story:
Today we're raising funds for the children of Necker Paediatrics Hospital. This hospital holds a special place in our hearts as one of our family members is being treated there.

This Christmas let's not forget the reason for the season. A time that is supposed to be filled with joy and cheer is in many cases filled with so much grief. This is something that is true for the children in Necker Paediatrics Hospital in Paris. 

Because they are so young, many of them have never spent holidays outside of the walls of the hospital, that's why we want to make this one special.

By donating any amount to our cause you can assist with making this holiday season the best yet for kids who have the simplest of wishes and that is to live to love and to laugh.

Our goal is to raise as much money as possible to purchase hundreds of wrapped Christmas presents for those that are on the children's ward this year. We're also trying to pull massive strings to get Santa a direct flight from the North Pole.

Thank-you in advance for making this year's Christmas their best one yet. With a little over 3 weeks to go until Christmas we want to make this campaign a successful one !

Alex, Ashleigh & Benjamin.

(pictures taken at Necker Paediatrics Hospital, Paris.)

story:
Our project started more than nine years ago, in 2007. We are dedicated to recycling used cooking oil. Everything started as an idea to help protect the environment because the used cooking oil in Peru is thrown to the drain and it ends up in the rivers, which pollutes the flora and fauna. We transform these oils into Biodiesel, an environmentally friendly fuel.

During our journey, we realized that we were helping not only the environment but also people’s health. The impact in this case is even greater.


  • We set up a small base that would allow us to transform used cooking oil into Biodiesel (In the pictures, my brother Renato). We were there for a year in 2007.


Since last midyear, 2015, the amount of used cooking oil that we recycle has decreased considerably because of the international oil price fall. This situation influenced our Biodiesel sales and our project depends directly on that. Consequently, our project is seriously compromised. The price of our Biodiesel has a direct relation with the fuel price.

We used to recycle the used cooking oil in the cities of Cuzco, Puno and Arequipa. Nowadays, we are only working in Arequipa and only at 15% of our former capacity.


Join our campaign and help us continue recycling used cooking oil.

WE NEED YOU!




We want to keep our project working. It is important to achieve this goal because we have contributed to our society in a very positive way. We have had many achievements and we are happy about that. Help us keep our dream alive!


How have we help others in our project?


The environment:

One liter of oil pollutes 1,000 liters of water.

  • Chili River in Arequipa.


  • We take part in events where we set up a 26-foot-diameter balloon. In such events, we present our project.


Every month, we were able to recycle 4,500 gallons of used cooking oil in Arequipa, 2,000 gallons in Cuzco and 500 gallons in Puno.

For each 264.17 gallons of Biodiesel consumed, 1,696.6 pounds of CO2 emissions were reduced by using the biofuel instead of Diesel fuel.


Health:

In Peru there is a black market of used cooking oil. This black market is really big and it is managed by a mafia dedicated to buy this used oil, reprocess it and then sell to restaurants and food companies as new oil. Sometimes, this used oil is also used to produce food for animals that will later be consumed by humans.


Right now, while you are reading about our campaign, there is somebody throwing used cooking oil to the drain, or someone is illegally filtering used cooking oil to sell it again as if it was new. There is also someone that, without knowing it, is consuming food prepared with used cooking oil, which will seriously affect his health.


There are many factors that cause people to have Cancer. In the used cooking oil there are two chemical components: DIOXINES and NITROSAMINES. Both of them are proven carcinogenic agents.



Your contributions would not only be helping our project but it would also be helping "Doctora Corazon" organization.
Dr. Gloria Paredes Guerra, is a Pediatric Oncologist and Director of “Doctora Corazon” Foundation.

  • Danerly was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer, She is now healthy.


BIODIESEL: US$ 35.00

We will donate the Perk value (minus commissions costs) to Dr. Gloria Paredes Guerra, who is a Pediatric Oncologist and Director of “Doctora Corazon” Foundation. She has created 45 children’s storybooks based on real experiences and anecdotes with her little patients, “the kids”. In her own words, “During all these years as a mother, teacher and pediatric oncologist I have been able to witness the happiness of every kid when they hear a love one telling them a story, and the joy and satisfaction of being able to read one on their own.

These storybooks are not intended to make money. They are given to kids at schools and donated to institutions that want to teach values to kids. The money gotten from this reward will be used to print her storybooks.


  • Fabricio was diagnosed with neuroblastoma cancer in mediastinal, He is now healthy.



T-SHIRT:

There are two amazing designs and two colors of T-shirts to choose from: white and black. When our campaign ends, we´ll ask for your size.



PAINTINGS:

Unique art work from the renowned artist from Arequipa, Tania Brun (www.facebook.com/iggymunralatake/photos_stream).




TOUR:

Come to Machu Picchu, one of the wonders of the modern world; it's a 5 days and 4 nights tour for one person in a destination that's considered one of the best in the world.


The program not includes: Plane tickets, extra meals, airport taxes.

We will be constantly adding more rewards along our campaign, so come back as often as you can!


USE OF FUNDS

To keep our project alive, we need US$ 73,600
To recycle used cooking oil in the following cities:


TIME LINE




Q&A

1) What sustains used cooking oil is harmful for our health?

You can check the health risks associated with consuming used cooking oil in the following links:

http://nehrc.nhri.org.tw/toxic/news/1030905-3.pdf

http://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Monographs/vol69/mono69.pdf

http://www.ejnet.org/dioxin/nas2006.pdf

ftp://ftp.fao.org/codex/Meetings/CCFAC/ccfac31/fa99_23e.pdf

https://www.inspq.qc.ca/pdf/publications/1263_CancerRiskAssessWorkersNitrosaminesRubber.pdf

https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Monographs/vol89/mono89.pdf

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2952429/pdf/nihms230386.pdf

2) What is Dioxin?

https://goo.gl/qp850e

http://dnzmagazine.com/toxicologist/gary-ginsberg-toxicologist/

http://publichealth.yale.edu/people/GLG4-2.profile

3) Alzhiemers from Nitrosamines

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2952429/

4) What are the Gastric Cancer risk factors?

http://www.cancer.org/cancer/stomachcancer/detailedguide/stomach-cancer-risk-factors

5) What are the Colon Cancer risk factors?

http://www.cancer.org/cancer/colonandrectumcancer/detailedguide/colorectal-cancer-risk-factors

6) How long will the requested funds last?

They will help meet the recycling costs for the first quarter of next year. We expect that by then, the fuel prices will rise again, which will allow to cover the project costs with the Biodiesel sales. If the fuel prices don´t rise, we will have to stop the project.

7) What will happen if we don’t reach our goal?

If we don’t reach our goal, we will prioritize our project to focus on recycling in Arequipa.

8) How do you calculate the amount of CO2 emissions reduced because of the use of Biodiesel?

Diesel Oil emits 5,873.33 pounds of CO2/m3 (Approx.)

Biodiesel emits 4,177.78 pounds of CO2/m3 (Approx.)

The difference between both is 1,695.6 pounds of CO2. This amount will not affect the environment.

(Source: Additional income from carbon credits for a Biodiesel plant, School of Agribusiness, Northeastern University - Argentina, 2005).

9) What ALDECO means?

"Alternativa de Combustibles" or "Alternative Fuels" in english and is the company's name.

10) What QUMIR means?

"Green" in Quechua languaje, a native languaje from the Incas.
