http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2952429/
4) What
are the Gastric Cancer risk factors?
http://www.cancer.org/cancer/stomachcancer/detailedguide/stomach-cancer-risk-factors

5) What
are the Colon Cancer risk factors?
http://www.cancer.org/cancer/colonandrectumcancer/detailedguide/colorectal-cancer-risk-factors
6) How
long will the requested funds last?


They
will help meet the recycling costs for the first quarter of next year. We
expect that by then, the fuel prices will rise again, which will allow to cover
the project costs with the Biodiesel sales. If the fuel prices don´t rise, we
will have to stop the project.
7) What
will happen if we don’t reach our goal?

If
we don’t reach our goal, we will prioritize our project to focus on recycling
in Arequipa.
8) How
do you calculate the amount of CO2 emissions reduced because of the use of
Biodiesel?

Diesel
Oil emits 5,873.33 pounds of CO2/m3 (Approx.)
Biodiesel
emits 4,177.78 pounds of CO2/m3 (Approx.)
The
difference between both is 1,695.6 pounds of CO2. This amount will not affect
the environment.
(Source: Additional income from carbon credits
for a Biodiesel plant, School of Agribusiness, Northeastern University -
Argentina, 2005).
9) What ALDECO means?

"Alternativa de Combustibles" or "Alternative Fuels" in english and is the company's name.
10) What QUMIR means?
"Green" in Quechua languaje, a native languaje from the Incas.

story:
Hello Everyone! 

My name is Dory and I am a 37 year old failure.  I always assumed that by the time my parents reached retirement I would be able to support them and make their retirement dreams of travel come true.  Unfortunately, I have never been able to push through that final barrier in my career where I would be making enough money to support both myself and them.  

All of my life my parents have been traveling the world and I have always been amazed by the stories they come back with and the joy on their faces when on a new adventure.  Now they are getting older and living on their retirement income and starting to have some mobility issues and I want them to have one last trip to the places they still speak of going to so wistfully. 

For Christmas this year I would like to give them that last grand vacation.  Let them go to those countries that they still haven't had a chance to visit.  I just can't do it on my own. 

If I don't make my goal I will take whatever is raised and send them on the best vacation possible.  I realize that times are really rough right now for a lot of folks (myself included) and we can't always spare the money but I would ask for you to signal boost my campaign as much as you can.  Indiegogo has some awesome share tools on their site for you if  you are willing to get it out there.

story:
WRDIF

WRDIF helps internally displaced women, refugees, and any survivor of domestic violence in Uganda and South Sudan learn a trade, gain independence, and live in safety.

My name is Laurie Jones. I had the great pleasure of meeting Karak Mayik, the founder of WRDIF, while in graduate school. I saw her absolute generosity and passion for empowering women and girls to gain independence and live a life free from harm. The recent turmoil in South Sudan has left the workers without much of their financial support. This year I decided to join her board of trustees and help advocate for better funding for this unbelievably giving organization. This Indiegogo is a push to help the women of Uganda and South Sudan who need food, tools, and safety immediately.  

South Sudan has a terrible record for domestic violence against women. Young girls are still forced into marriages, rape is taboo and increasingly common, and many women cannot hold jobs or support themselves on their own. 

With the current political turmoil, many women are internally displaced, and living in camps that expose them to further violence.

Women Rehabilitation Development International Foundation was formed in 2011 by the organization’s President, Karak Mayik Denyok Miankol, who has witnessed the positive and dynamic benefits that economic development intervention can have on the future of women in need.

Since the inception of the organization, Ms. Karak Mayik and her constituents have committed themselves to providing extensive development programs for women living throughout Africa who face dire financial limitations which limit their ability to find future progress. They provide a refuge for women who need safety and an opportunity to move away from their abusers. 

WDRIF provides :

  • Humanitarian Assistance
  • Life-Skills Training ( 1-year program for women to learn a new trade and gain independence)
  • Child Protection
  • Adult Literacy

Where Your Money Makes a Difference

Daily Meals for 6 people in the camp only costs $5.76 

· Charcoal for 6 people for one day: $1.53

· Bread for 6 people for one day: $1.72

· Maize Flour for 6 people for one day: $0.77

· Beans for 6 people for one day: $0.96

· Salt for 6 people for one day: $0.08

· Cooking Oil: $0.46

· Tomatoes: $0.38

· Onions: $0.19

· Curry Powder: $0.08

· Soap: $0.27

· Tea Leaves: $0.08

Resources for a women to complete the 1-year training program: $34.97

Chair: $8.42

Books: $6.89

Pens/Pencils/Ruler: $1.30

Clean Drinking Water per women per year: $18.36

Providing Tools for a family for an entire year: $191.26

Hoe: $3.83

Slasher: $1.91

Panga: $2.87

Spade: $2.87

Folked Hoe: $3.83

Rake: $2.87

Wheelbarrow: $55.46

Watering Can: $5.74

Basket: $3.83

Gum Boots: $5.74

Bicycle ( for safety, this is important) $102.32

Cost of a Salary for two trainers per year

2 life-skills trainers: $2,203. 27- enough money for shelter, food and transportation

The Impact

For minimal cost on our side, these women can live in peace, without abuse or the threats that IDP camps brings. These women can live independent lives and provide for their children. 

If you are interested in providing a monthly or annual donation, please contact wrdifsisterhood@gmail.com. You can be connected to a woman in the program, providing emotional and financial support for her year long program and provide her with tools for the rest of her life. 

    Risks & Challenges

    Safety is an issue in South Sudan and Uganda. Traveling between camps has been extremely challenging as the political unrest is devastating. The camp administrators have worked tirelessly to make travel as safe as possible. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We understand if you can't give money, but we thank you for your time and attention. If you could pass this campaign on to friends we would greatly appreciate it. If you would like to learn more about the sisterhood program- a way to give support to the women in the programs through letters and encouragement- please email wrdifsisterhood@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

When Hurricane Sandy struck the New Jersey shoreline in 2012, the media immediately focused on the impact on the more popular shore destinations, turning the Seaside Heights roller coaster into a symbol of the area's devastation. But while all cameras were turned on Seaside Heights, other equally devastated communities, of lesser commercial value, were overlooked.

The community of Union Beach, NJ was one such community. A residential town of predominately working class people saw their community equally devastated, with homes destroyed and public facilities rendered useless, but it went mostly overlooked as public officials and the media focused on the resort shore points.

In the aftermath of Sandy, as Union Beach struggled in relative obscurity, the town's plight caught the attention of public officials of Madison, NJ. Madison, an affluent community located to the northeast of Union Beach, also suffered damage during the storm, but far less than the shore points, and recovered more quickly.

Seeing the devastation in Union Beach and recognizing that it was being overlooked in the battle for attention from media and public officials, the community of Madison decided to take action, contributing time of its residents and resources to help Union Beach recover. In these times, it is a rare example of one community voluntarily helping another to overcome an unprecedented natural disaster.

This mini-documentary (10 to 15 minutes in length) will document the damage and the story of these two communities coming together, the relationships that are created in the process, the challenges, and the vision for the future.

Once produced and premiered, the documentary will be posted online for viewing. The producer will also seek time on Madison and Union Beach's local access channels, and explore other markets for distribution (NJ public TV, etc.)

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking $9,000 to produce this documentary. All funds will go to cover the compensation of the producer/writer/director (hereinafter the "producer") for time spent performing pre-production, production, and post-production tasks in support of the production, all production and post-production equipment and software required, as well as anticipated out of pocket expenses (travel expenses to Union Beach and back), potential costs to acquire rights to relevant Sandy-based local news footage, as well as still photographs which may not yet have been acquired.

All donors will receive a complimentary DVD of the documentary for their contribution and will be credited on a website dedicated to the documentary. All donors who donate $200 or more will be expressly named in the documentary credits, and be invited to the documentary's premiere, which will be screened at a place to be announced either in Madison or Union Beach. The premiere will be preceded by a small reception.

Should the project come in under budget, any unused funds will be donated to the Madison Union Beach initiative. Should the project go over budget, the producer will personally underwrite the overrun.

The Impact

I hope that this documentary will serve as an example for other communities which which fare better during crisis or natural disaster to look around and see if they cannot help nearby communities who were less fortunate.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially to this effort, I would appreciate it if you could share this via social media and spread the word about this effort.

story:
Short Summary

Peace and Love my good people...I am Bro. Gil Pritchett and this is something I feel very passionate about and I must take an active approach now, so that it will by faith encourage others to do the same , in their own authentic way. I have some 34 years of professional and community experience in the performining and creative arts having worked throughout the entire USA including Broadway and regional venues across America and internationally from France to Japan, all over Canada, Madrid and Manaco. My expertise is Musical Theatre, Digital Music Production/Composition, and Empowering the Creative Mind of Kids 4 years to Adults through the Performing Arts as a Teaching Artist, now living back home in Dallas, Texas. My campaign is simple yet challenging in that it involves a whole community, district 8 of Dallas, Texas. My action is this:" Season Of My Heart", a musical extravaganza featuring a synergy of old school Blues,R&B, Gospel,Jazz and Adult Contemporary music, is the vehicle I will use to shine a new innovative and positive light on a situation that effects hundreds of families, children and seniors alike in the Highland Hills Community of Dallas. I live in this community and so does my Mother. There are no grocery stores in the immediate community...the closest one is about 2.5 miles away. It has been said , the corporate stores won't come to this community for various reasons, and with all due respect, that is not good enough for me to sit by and allow this kind of decay to prosper. The district residences is made up of many seniors  and some disabled families members,who may or may not have transportation or even able to drive if they have access, to the stores over 2.5 miles from the community and this is a very disturbing issue to me. "Season of My Heart" will be used as a platform to encourage Self Help, in the community ,by creating a community fund, from a large portion of the proceeds, that will be used to help implement a community co-op oppoprtunity for the people living in the immediate community of district 8. It has been proven time and time again how taking responsibility for oneself and ones community , especially through the creative and artistic approach, invites, engage, and inspire people to action, thinking outside of the box and coming  up with innovative and creative ideas to help solve the problems facing the community. I believe people want to change, but sometimes the ideas are missing and the status quo speaks the same , no change theories, to the masses. I believe it is my duty as a member of this community, that is District 8, to act and do it in the most creative and professional manner possible as to why "Season of My Heart" is my approach to initiating this resolve. It will take time , discipline, faith and people of like minds, to make this kind of significant change happen but it is worth the effort if we can inspire this kind of change. Your contribution will go a long way towards establishing a synergy between  community, family, creativity, including the creating of jobs in the community,self help and thinking outside of the box for many people in and around the district 8 community.Building an entrepreneurial skill set for people who may have never thought it possible for them. Thank you and do keep us lifted up! Peace and Love Bro. Gil

There is a huge vacant building right in the heart of Highland Hills ,(Simpson Stuart and Bonnie View Road), it has been sitting there like a wounded animal, for several years. I want to egage the people of the community to purchase this building or get it donated towards our efforts, to take responsibility for what we need, here in our community of District 8. "Season Of My Heart" is a vehicle I believe as a professional artist, will engage the people to begin this on going process...It is my charge and I accept the challenge, will you help me, help others, help themselves. Peace and Love Bro. Gil

The journey of a thousand miles begins with just 1 step!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Please understand, I know the amount I am seeking here is not even a drop in the bucket of what it will take to complete a task such as this, nor is that my intent here... my intent is to raise enough money to establish the vehicle, to which through advertisement and media response, exposure and dialogue of action, will engage corporate and individual entrepreneurial support, here in the city ,to ensure the over all goal of establishing a co-op community grocery store, succeed in the Highland Hills District. "Season Of My Heart" will be the nucleus of what I pray will be a windfall of new innovative approaches to a very old issue in the community of people of color across the Americas. Taking responsibility for what we need in our community is empowering and sets an awesome example for our children as to what the future can hold for them and their children. Your contribution will set in motion something that will re educate the community and offer new skill sets of innovative, out of the box critical thinking, which is so vital to the survival of our children, and you will be able to look out here ,eventually, at the Highland Hills Distict and know YOU, were part of this growth and develpoment.

The $5000.00 will wholly go towards securing a venue for "Season Of My Heart", staffing, promotion, and any other incidentals that occur in mounting a theatrical production of this nature. Making sure I can staff the very best musicians within reason because we will be asking  people to come and spend money towards building this fund that will go beyond the ticket price of the production which means I must put the best foot forward. I am the best at what I do.... our ambition is to use "Season Of My Heart" as a stepping stone to building a dynamic community fund and thus creating jobs, developing community outreach as a result of the efforts to take responsibility for what is lacking in our community. It is a huge undertaking one that will be on going, but one that must be initiated and the spirit is leading me to do what I can in this regard.

The Impact

The impact this will have on the future of our children, in this community and around the nation, as they begin to hear and see the results, will be astounding and far reaching. YOU have the opportunity to be one of the founding fathers/mothers, if you will, of the new Highland Hills Communtiy, Co-op Grocery Market Place and see your contribution really make a difference.

"Season Of My Heart" had a sold out limited run in New York City at Cobi's Place and I believe it is the most effective way for me as an artist to approach this issue and give back to the community. I have witnessed this success in Los Angeles as well as New York City; it is only fair that Dallas, HIghland Hills, be next in line. I love my community and the people deserve to live better with more real access.

"Anything that shines a positive and productive light on an issue that is not so productive but is divisive and discriminatory, is a "THING" worth investing, is my belief and so ,this is my calling and I pray you will step out on faith with me here in your best authentic way to contribute what you can. Peace and Love Bro. Gil"

You and your contribution will certainly be acknowledged and reconized in all media , promotional and visual support attached to "Season Of My Heart" and the Highland Hills Community Co-Op Grocery and Market Place.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, if you have access to resources that can facilitate assistance to the cause, please feel free. Every litle bit helps and there are no small contirbutions, simply "CONTIRBUTIONS".  Please help me get the word out and please be sure to use and utilize all of the Indiegogo share tools at your disposal Thank you.

story:
For many years, Lori Phelps, of Lori’s Landscapes and Perennials and The Crazy Daisy, has served Hancock, New York and surrounding communities through plants, landscaping, and gifts. She has helped people celebrate weddings, births, birthdays, graduations, dance recitals, anniversaries, and she has grieved with her neighbors
with her funeral arrangements.

You may have heard that recently, Lori fell and broke her hip. Many people have sent her prayers and positive thoughts, for which she is grateful. Her recovery will take at least eight weeks, but the doctors say her bones are strong and her body is healthy, so they are very optimistic about her recovery.

Some people have already been asking what they can do to help out. Your patience, understanding, and support with Bill, her husband, and her Dirty Girls who are managing the shop and working out in the field would be greatly appreciated. But there is one more way you can help.

Lori’s family has created this campaign to raise funds to help with the enormous costs of dealing with this accident. On top of hospital bills, surgeons’ bills, anesthetist fees, and ambulance bills, there will also be the costs of therapy and rehabilitation. We will hold this campaign for 30 days and hope to raise $3000 to help pay her bills.

Lori loves her community, her husband, her workers, her dog, Joy, and her work. And that love has been returned by countless people with hugs, smiles, laughter, and support. She is grateful for the love everyone is sending her way, and hopes to be back in the shop as soon as possible. We, her sisters and nieces, thank you in advance for any financial help you are able to give to support Lori on her road to recovery.


If you would like to donate to help Lori out you can click to the 'Contribute Now' button that appears on the right. You can send donations either by credit card or through Paypal. Indiegogo is a trusted site and all fund transfers are secure.

story:
Help Save The English Bookshop

My name is Liesl Oliver and since 2005 I have had the privilege of being the sole proprietor of the wonderful English Bookshop in the centre of old Amsterdam. This cosy canal side space has housed a popular independent book shop for over 40 years attracting both Amsterdam residents and passing travelers from all over the world.  As well as selling new, used and e-books, the shop hosts book clubs, creative writing and poetry groups, classes, literary quiz nights, author readings and literary walking tours. There are even regular events for children dedicated to encouraging our young readers.

"I came across the English Bookshop soon after moving to Amsterdam with my newborn baby, and immediately got a very warm welcome at the playgroup.  There's no other place in the city like the Bookshop where I could go with my young baby and feel so much part of a real community."  A playgroup mum.

"a haven for writers, readers, and all lovers of the literary life" The Writers Studio.

Meet me and some of my customers and friends by watching the video - you'll see what a great place this is!

Why the campaign?

Despite all the economic doom and gloom the English Bookshop has been doing well and keeping a healthy cash flow.  Sadly however, under the terms of a previous agreement with the joint owners of the building, the two story shop has to be put up for sale. I do not have the €130 000 needed to buy the property and keep the doors open for business. It is heartbreaking to see such a valued and popular enterprise being brought to an end and that is why I am appealing for your help. Perhaps when you visited Amsterdam you dropped by for a cup of tea and to pick up a good read? Perhaps you have enjoyed one of our many literary events? Perhaps you have bought and enjoyed an English book not readily available outside the USA or UK? Perhaps you just love independent bookshops with a warm welcome and wall to wall books? If so, I am asking if you can help now and join our regular community in saving this well known and much loved institution.

The Break-down of the money needed:

  • €130 000 - Crowdfunded (Friends and Grantors*)
  • €130 000 - To be raised against the property via a mortgage.

*Grantors: for larger investments we have tax deductions and interest payment scheme please see:http://shop.englishbookshop.nl/our_community/save_the_bookshop

Other ways of helping:

  • To join our community 
  • To share this information with other people
  • Enjoy a cream tea or two at the bookshop.
  • To always buy your books at a bookshop.

My Goal

If I can secure the property the building will be given foundation (charity) status to ensure the English Bookshop remains a great meeting place for book lovers for years to come. We appreciate your help and support.

story:
UPDATE - 7/3 - We're making news! 

NBCBayArea: http://m.nbcbayarea.com/nbcbayarea/pm_108022/contentdetail.htm?contentguid=Yk61OYou

Huffington Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/06/20/nonprofit-bar-san-francisco_n_3475459.html

TIME: http://t.co/veRTVPN5dp 

SFist: http://sfist.com/2013/06/17/local_group_hopes_to_start_first_no.php 

Indiegogo: Featured on the homepage (6/27-6/30) and in Newsletter (7/2 & 6/27)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are opening San Francisco’s first not-for-profit bar where 100% of profits go to development projects across the globe!

We believe that making change should be easy, and fun. 

 

THE BAR:

We are working hard to open a unique type of bar: a place where people can relax, celebrate, and give back at the same time!

It’s a simple idea: we cover all of our costs like any other bar, but donate 100% of profits to life-changing projects around the world. 25% of each drink is automatically donated, so patrons know they are already making a difference with each drink.

Before we settle down and sign a lease, we’re going to throw 6 pop-up parties around SF. We’ll set up bar, drinks, DJ and everything in between-giving you a sweet taste of what’s to come. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Announcing the dates of our first Pop Up Parties: August 2nd & 3rd 

 

             

 

THE IMPACT:

We want to build a business that constantly generates funds for creating change. Let’s re-write the norms of fundraising — we can keep funding and bringing incredible projects to life as long as we have customers to celebrate giving back. 

THE FOUNDATION:

The UL Foundation is the partner non-profit (registered 501c3) to the United Libations bar. While the bar and the foundation are separate entities, they work together to realize the common goal of bettering lives. The bar runs the event operations while the foundation arranges donation to the projects around the world. 

 

HOW WE WORK:

1)     CONNECT: with small scale projects around the globe

2)     CHECK: that they meet our funding specifications

3)     GENERATE: money from every drink bought at the bar

4)     DONATE: the profit to fund and complete a project

5)     REPEAT: turn to the next project on our list and repeat!

                        

 

FUNDING SPECIFICATIONS:

  • The project is by a registered 501c3 non-profit organization
  • The project's total goal for funding must be <$3,000
  • The project holds no terrorist, political or religious affiliations
  • The project is outside of the United States
  • The project is in the fields of: Education, Health, Poverty, Hunger, Human Rights, Environment, or Wildlife
  • The project has a third-party sponsor that validates its data and reports, as well as performs financial audits through local and international experts 

 

FIRST 2 PROJECTS WE HAVE SELECTED TO FUND:

1) English Classes for Haitian Orphans

Location: Port au Prince, Haiti

Fundraising Goal: $2400

This project will provide English classes for at minimum 30 children who were left orphaned by the devastating 2010 earthquake. These classes have two main objectives: to help build the kids' self-confidence, and to set them up with English skills that will dramatically improve their employability in Haiti.                          

            

2) Building a Rainwater Collection System

Location: Bweyale, Uganda

Fundraising Goal: $2,900

This project will fund a rainwater collection system to bring a second source of water to approximately 1400 children and 1200 local residents of Bweyale, Uganda. Bweyale has no other nearby water source apart from a small stream which often dries up.

             

Bweyale children who will benefit from the new water source.

 

WHAT $8,500 WILL DO:

$1500    Start-Up Operations

$1800    Rent

$1500    Bar Equipment

$1500    Glassware

$1500    Inventory

$1000    Basic Bar Furniture

$700      Indiegogo Fee

After our summer pop-up events, the next step is to settle down in a permanent venue!

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

  • Spread the Word: my tech-savvy San Franciscans…we know you know how.
  • Donate Your Skills: the heart of our project is caring and talented individuals. There are so many aspects to United Libations, if you have a skill and want to contribute, we’ll welcome you to the family with open arms.  

 

PERKS

You'll be on our verified donors list with ANY donation

$10 – Backer’s Club

A donation of $10 and upwards gets an original UNITED LIBATIONS print postcard, along with the street cred of your name on our verified donors list.       

                      

$25 – Party Club

Get ready for more than just a night out. We’ll set you up with a voucher for one of our original cocktails—good at any United Libations pop-up event. We promise you’ve never seen (or tasted) libations like these! Also, we’ll send you a very special personal thank you note from our founder Nishi Boppana.

[Up to 200]

                             

$50 - Host Package

Donate $50 and receive a set of our custom designed drink coasters and instructional card with the recipes to four classic cocktails. Now you can play host and spread the message of living and giving in your own festivities.

[Up to 100]

                        

$250 – Bartender Package

YOU become the bartender for your donation of over $250. Our experts will teach you the basics and not-so-basics of bartending in a private two-hour session for you and 3 of your luckiest friends. Want more? Relax after your hard work and we’ll set your crew up with 4 free drink vouchers redeemable at any United Libations event. 

[Up to 10]

$500 – Honorary Team Member

Welcome to the inner circle. Meet and greet the core team--we’ll even give you a sneak peak of ALL our party plans! You’re invited to dinner, drinks and to demo the bar at a private team celebration –Experience the first test with everyone who has been crucial to the development of United Libations.

[Up to 5]

$750 - Business Sponsorship Package

Your business becomes an official sponsor of United Libations. We’ll spread YOUR message via our social media and live at our pop-up parties! Email us and we’ll happily create a custom partnership that works best for your business and ours.  

 [Up to 3]

MISSION STATEMENT

PEOPLE. IDEAS. CHANGE.

We believe in people. We believe that people are inherently good, that they care about others, and that they act benevolently where they can. 

We believe in ideas. Innovative ways of thinking are the fuel to developing solutions that are mutually beneficial to everyone.

We believe in change. The most powerful change to us is bettering a person’s life. To dramatically change even a handful of lives is a legacy that we are proud to be a part of. 

When caring people are combined with innovative ideas, change follows. This novel type of social enterprise is all about empowering people to enjoy themselves while making the world better for everyone.

*It's important to us to keep our organization TRANSPARENT-please contact us with any queries and we will happily provide you with the details requested.

story:
Kung Pao Chocolate Bars are a Sweet and Spicy Treat

I've love chocolate and I love spicy food and I've never had a candy bar that combined the two tastes successfully. No offense to other products on the market that try. They are serious and dark which is okay for once in a while. Kung Pao Chocolate Bars are milk chocolate with a proprietary blend of spices that is fun and satisfies both the chocoholic and the chili head.

Fact: there are more Chinese restaurants in the US than there are McDonald's

I developed Kung Pao Chocolate Bars over the last few years. I was living in Chinatown in Los Angeles and was considering opening a cafe and gift shop. I did a lot of research on food that was being offered and noticing what the market wasn't providing that might be needed (a “gap” in the market). The only sweets that were consistently being offered were baked goods. Cookies (fortune and almond predominately) and once in a while ice cream were the only sweet treats I could find. There were at least 2 different types of hot sauces or chilli on every restaurant table. I started to see some exotic, expensive dark chocolate bars with chilies in them. I tried all of them. They were all good but I felt like they would go better with a cigar and a bottle of port then after eating a steaming bowl of spicy pho or kung pao chicken.


Fact: kung pao chicken is the most popular item ordered in Chinese restaurants

Kung Pao Chocolate Bars are produced using a proprietary recipe of spices in a high quality milk chocolate bar.  There is a traditional peanut and a version without peanuts.  The logo and characters (Kung the chili and Pao the Peanut) were designed by Los Angeles artist, Philip Lumbang.

We plan on producing Kung Pao Chocolate Fudge Sauce and Kung Pao Chocolate Ice Cream Bars in the future.

We plan on selling Kung Pao Chocolate Bars in retail candy stores, convenience stores and as a point of purchase item in Chinese restaurants.  There are many people out there who love all their food to be spicy from their cottage cheese to their tooth paste, everything is better with a little heat!

The trademark application for Kung Pao Chocolate Bars has been submitted.

Your support will make this new business a reality. The first offering of Kung Pao Chocoalte Bars is through Indiegogo!

story:
Short Summary

WHO WE ARE:

Great Full Gardens is a Nevada owned Small Corporation owned by Reno native, Julianna Scala.  Together with her husband Gino, and a great team of people they have successfully built the first hydroponic tomato greenhouse in Northern Nevada, opened and run the Pathways café, which serves the University of Nevada Reno as well as created the Gino The Soup Man brand of frozen soups and entrees.  Currently, Gino The Soup Man brand can be found at Great Basin Community Food CoOp,Whole Foods Market and Swill Coffee and Wine.  Our products are currently served at Swill Coffee and Wine, Nevada Wolf Store, Lighthouse Coffee, Too Souls Tea Company and The Hub Coffee. 

The Great Full Gardens Concept
Great Full Gardens Cafe & Eatery (scheduled to open Feb 2013) is a concept that was born from a desire to provide the community with a fast, casual eatery with a strong focus on locally sourced food, community support, and sustainability.  It will be a place where people who are looking for a healthier way of eating can enjoy everything from a vegan wrap to an all natural beef burger that comes from grass fed, hormone free cow.  Out restaurant will cater to the specialty diet as well as the person looking for just great flavor and a menu that is unique and delicious.

Great Full Gardens' mission is to enrich the lives of our guests, our employees, and our community through providing wholesome, great tasting food and beverages at the best value possible, offering a life enriching customer service experience and creating a healthy, happy family of employees. We achieve these objectives by sourcing and supporting local product whenever possible, creating a warm, welcoming environment for dining patrons, as well as hiring and retaining a staff capable of delivering an exceptional experience to every customer, every time!

Great Full Gardens is committed to providing to their employees the healthiest workspace available in food production today.  For years foodservice and production employees have had to endure tough working environments by standing on hard floors and breathing in toxic gas emissions that come from the use of gas appliances.  We are providing an all-electric kitchen which is free of toxic gases, special floor mats that absorb much of the compression on the body, clean air, and a loving environment. 

As Great Full Gardens continues to grow and expand their employee base and community presence, we are presented with the exciting challenge of maintaining our committment to sustainability, community support and employee nurturing.

Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you:

Our campaign is built around solar power production, solar water collection for hot water, and the elimination of toxic gases and fumes in our space.  We will do this by installing a min 24 panel solar array on the roof of the facility, installing a water collector on the roof of the facility, creating Reno's first all-electric solar powered kitchen.  This will not only significantly reduce our carbon footprint, we will be able to create energy for the city and provide our kitchen staff with a healthy, non-toxic environment to work in.

Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve:

With the experience of working in kitchens consulting with chefs, manufacturing facilities, and restaurant owners, we have come to some basic conclusions.  The kitchen work environment is not generally a healthy environment for people to work in. 

Gas appliances are used for efficiency standards that are cost based.  Although a company can save money by using them, they come at a price we are not willing to pay.  Emissions and flames are breathed into the employee lungs and over time can cause emphysema, chronic cough, and of course cancer.  We cannot use this business model to make a living.  

In addition,   the use of gas is toxic to our long term economy.  We are willing to pay more for energy and over time reduce those costs with solar installations because of two main concerns.  Our team’s health and our local energy footprint.  With electric appliances we have the ability to manufacturer energy with solar installations.  Although the initial costs will be higher we believe that there is no other choice. 

Finally, this kind of commitment demonstrates to the community that we, as a community, can take a large footprint off the grid and be creators of our  our own energy sources.  The effect would snowball into other businesses which would make a difference in our communitie's effect on the environment. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

24 Panel  Solar Panel Array $28,000

Solar Water Collector - $5,000

Tomlinson C-Kure Light Anti-Fatigue Mat - $6,500

The solar panels that we are using are……AC Unison,PM240PA0 Photovoltaic Module with Microinverter.  This particular system Harvests 5 to 25% more energy than traditional systems and are Designed for 25-year reliability.

Their Modular flexibility suits any budget or rooftop.  The Simplified PV system reduces installation costs and with

No high voltage, DC means safe installation and ownership. 

 

BenQ Solar AC Unison is a new breakthrough in solar photovoltaic (PV) technology. BenQ Solar combines its premium PV module with reliable microinverter technology to maximize PV benefits for installers and end users.

The integrated microinverter converts module DC to grid compliant AC at each module. This increases system performance by up to 25%, reduces shading losses, and makes PV safer to install and own. BenQ

Solar AC Unison is installed, monitored, and maintained with ease. All BenQ Solar PV products are manufactured under BenQ Solar’s strict quality control standards. BenQ Solar AC Unison is designed for 25 years of efficient production.  We estimate that this starter system will handle about 25-30% of our needs and give us future growth options within the system. 

 

We APPRECIATE ALL CONTRIBUTIONS!

All contributors, regardless of the amount, will receive a special mention and Thank you on the Gratitude Page of our website.  We have put together some great tiered contribution perks as well, please check them out!

 

Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.


We firmly believe in this project and that it will have a positive influence in the community, on the health of our employees and that the environment benefits as well.  All funds collected will be used towards this vision.

The Impact

Our vision is that our Café be a model to other businesses, especially food operations which comprise the largest segment of power and resource use to use what earth is providing rather than traditional power sources that damage the earth.

For Great Full Gardens this project means the world to us.  We are committed to providing a place that our employees can work to provide healthy, great tasting food to our community while be nourished in prosperity and joy in their employment.  We are doing it now in at the University of Nevada Reno’s Pathway’s Café and this would amplify its effect.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you want to participate in the success of this project, but are unable to contribute right now?  

Spreading the word about this can make all the difference! 

  • Share this, share this, share this!  Make some noise!
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your support of this project!
story_txt:
Short Summary
WHO WE ARE:
Great Full Gardens is a Nevada owned Small Corporation owned by Reno native, Julianna Scala.  Together with her husband Gino, and a great team of people they have successfully built the first hydroponic tomato greenhouse in Northern Nevada, opened and run the Pathways café, which serves the University of Nevada Reno as well as created the Gino The Soup Man brand of frozen soups and entrees.  Currently, Gino The Soup Man brand can be found at Great Basin Community Food CoOp,Whole Foods Market and Swill Coffee and Wine.  Our products are currently served at Swill Coffee and Wine, Nevada Wolf Store, Lighthouse Coffee, Too Souls Tea Company and The Hub Coffee. 
The Great Full Gardens ConceptGreat Full Gardens Cafe & Eatery (scheduled to open Feb 2013) is a concept that was born from a desire to provide the community with a fast, casual eatery with a strong focus on locally sourced food, community support, and sustainability.  It will be a place where people who are looking for a healthier way of eating can enjoy everything from a vegan wrap to an all natural beef burger that comes from grass fed, hormone free cow.  Out restaurant will cater to the specialty diet as well as the person looking for just great flavor and a menu that is unique and delicious.
Great Full Gardens' mission is to enrich the lives of our guests, our employees, and our community through providing wholesome, great tasting food and beverages at the best value possible, offering a life enriching customer service experience and creating a healthy, happy family of employees. We achieve these objectives by sourcing and supporting local product whenever possible, creating a warm, welcoming environment for dining patrons, as well as hiring and retaining a staff capable of delivering an exceptional experience to every customer, every time!
Great Full Gardens is committed to providing to their employees the healthiest workspace available in food production today.  For years foodservice and production employees have had to endure tough working environments by standing on hard floors and breathing in toxic gas emissions that come from the use of gas appliances.  We are providing an all-electric kitchen which is free of toxic gases, special floor mats that absorb much of the compression on the body, clean air, and a loving environment. 
As Great Full Gardens continues to grow and expand their employee base and community presence, we are presented with the exciting challenge of maintaining our committment to sustainability, community support and employee nurturing.
Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you:
Our campaign is built around solar power production, solar water collection for hot water, and the elimination of toxic gases and fumes in our space.  We will do this by installing a min 24 panel solar array on the roof of the facility, installing a water collector on the roof of the facility, creating Reno's first all-electric solar powered kitchen.  This will not only significantly reduce our carbon footprint, we will be able to create energy for the city and provide our kitchen staff with a healthy, non-toxic environment to work in.
Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve:
With the experience of working in kitchens consulting with chefs, manufacturing facilities, and restaurant owners, we have come to some basic conclusions.  The kitchen work environment is not generally a healthy environment for people to work in.

24 Panel  Solar Panel Array $28,000

Tomlinson C-Kure Light Anti-Fatigue Mat - $6,500

Their Modular flexibility suits any budget or rooftop.  The Simplified PV system reduces installation costs and with
No high voltage, DC means safe installation and ownership. 
 
BenQ Solar AC Unison is a new breakthrough in solar photovoltaic (PV) technology. BenQ Solar combines its premium PV module with reliable microinverter technology to maximize PV benefits for installers and end users.
The integrated microinverter converts module DC to grid compliant AC at each module. This increases system performance by up to 25%, reduces shading losses, and makes PV safer to install and own. BenQ
Solar AC Unison is installed, monitored, and maintained with ease. All BenQ Solar PV products are manufactured under BenQ Solar’s strict quality control standards. BenQ Solar AC Unison is designed for 25 years of efficient production.  We estimate that this starter system will handle about 25-30% of our needs and give us future growth options within the system. 
 
We APPRECIATE ALL CONTRIBUTIONS!

We firmly believe in this project and that it will have a positive influence in the community, on the health of our employees and that the environment benefits as well.  All funds collected will be used towards this vision.

For Great Full Gardens this project means the world to us.  We are committed to providing a place that our employees can work to provide healthy, great tasting food to our community while be nourished in prosperity and joy in their employment.  We are doing it now in at the University of Nevada Reno’s Pathway’s Café and this would amplify its effect.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Do you want to participate in the success of this project, but are unable to contribute right now?   
Spreading the word about this can make all the difference!  

Share this, share this, share this!  Make some noise!
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you so much for your support of this project!

story:
What We're Up To:

We're opening a store in Washington, DC to bring you custom handmade one of a kind bags and jewelry made right in our store to your specifications as well as unique artwork by local DC artists. It's all about our core values of Community, Creativity, and Equality. 

Everyone likes to know where their goods are coming from right? We all are itching to see more made in America, right? Well here at Berwick we're being the change we want to see and we're so excited to be doing it here in DC with hopes this "locally made" movement will spread. The store is going to be all about making things locally, responsibly, fostering the creative spirit in all of us, and giving back to our community.

Every item in our store will be unique and in addition to ready made items that you'll be able to buy right away all of our styles will be fully customizable. Pick a style, select from a bunch of unique fabrics that we buy in low quantities to ensure uniqueness, and we make it right in the store ready for pickup in a couple weeks. We're currently forming partnerships with community partners and charities. Feel free to let us know if you know of any that share similar values to ours. We'd love to hear from you. Currently we're proud supporters of The DC Center, and Scrap DC. Be sure to check them out.

What We Need & What You Get:

Your support will help us open the store. We'll be opening up in either the Dupont or Mid-City neighborhoods, making the necessary renovations, and building our initial supply of ready made bags (by hand, with care) and fabric selections. Then you'll be able to stop by, unleash your creativity, and pick up some great rewards!

We've got some great rewards for our supporters! Be the first to get your hands on some of our unique bag and jewelry designs. If you're from out of town, you'll be able to select from many different variations featuring different fabrics, straps, etc on our website and we'll ship it right to you. If you're from the DC area we can't wait to see you!

Here's what we'll have for you supporters!

  • IGG Only Necklaces - Featuring smoky quartz in two forms, we're making them in several lengths that you'll be able to pick from after the campaign. They feature an easy toggle clasp. Look great on women and men.
  • Clutch Purse/Evening Bag - Our smallest bags, great for an evening out or to organize your larger bags. After the campaign and once we open if you choose this reward you'll be able to pick from many different variations of the bag in the store or on our website.
  • Device Covers - Seen below in the iPad size. These will be available to supporters in a variety of fabrics for any iPad version and Kindle Fire/Paperwhite. Great gifts!
  • Unique Handmade Jewelry Piece - Pick from any of our handmade jewelry. Examples shown below as well as so many more to come, all featuring gemstones or various types. The examples below are smoky quartz variations. 
  • The Everyday Bag - Our signature bag, simple beauty. Seen below in a wild orange and dark brown print, also shown above in blue chevron and solid brown. Many variations will be available if you choose this option. All unique! Pick from the selection online or stop by the store when we open to select yours. 
  • Tote & Messenger Bags - Our largest bags. As unique as you are. Messengers are great for commuters. Supporters who choose this reward will have many variations sporting different fabrics and hardware to suit their style when we open.
  • The Supporters Wall - Everyone who gives to us will receive their name on the supporters wall and a handwritten thank you from us.

The Impact

This is all about giving back. Yeah, we love making our products but it's also a vehicle that enables us to partner with community organizations, foster creativity, and support the community. The impact goes beyond Washington, DC too. We're hoping this is a trend that will spread, we believe there needs to be a focus put back on small retailers and manufacturers that truly do a craft and make an artform. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, you can still help. Like us on Facebook and Twitter. Spread to word to your family and friends!

We appreciate everyone's support big or small!

story:
Introduction:

We live in a world where the wisdom of our elders rots away in urine stanched buildings. Our loved ones die alone. Children are raised by flashy colorful screens. Teens replace speech with communication through their thumbs via text. Growing up we are taught that to succeed in life we must go to school, more school, get a job, spend sunny days in a cubical, come home, kiss the wife go to bed, start all over until we grow too old to be of use, then rot away in nursing homes. So the cycle goes round and round.


In public schools where we are not taught to cook, grow our own food, make our own medicines, clothes ourselves, speak from our soul through the arts, use our imagination, or share our stories. Our parents tell us not to talk to strangers. But I have learned from this thing called life, that the people I meet at the bus, street, or alley often carry as much teachings as Jesus, Mohammad, White Buffalo Calf Woman, or Buddha.

What is the point of living if we don't share our life with each other, if the lessons learned in life die with us? What is the point of being born with sparkling gifts if we don't use or share them? I do not see the logic behind living in a world where people live right next to people and yet don't even know their name. That's okay I understand that it works out for some people, but it is not how I want to live.

 Goal:

Create a multi-generational outdoor school. Focused on the importance of integrating every age. Offering education in food from seedling to table, renewable energy, arts, spirituality, philosophy, etc. by using the apprenticeship system and encouraging the youngest to eldest person the opportunity to share their passions with the group. Also offering retreat for artist, writers, and different spiritual paths to broaden the spectrum of education in the community and provide extra revenue to continue and expand.

Teachers are lined up for baking, dairy processing, nutrition, food fermenting, wild crafting, permaculture, herbalism, bee keeping, butchering, grafting, natural building, wood work, glass, pottery, fiber arts, language arts, and many more skills.

My Personal Background:

My name is Lily, I was born backwards with a right leg half the length of my left creating an interesting life from the beginning. I was blessed with two of the most amazing parents on the earth. They home schooled me so that they could continue their travels around the country and world. Immersing me in the education of life. I did internships with local artists, and learned through trial and error I could achieve anything I could set my mind to. By 13 I had been in three art shows, two in my parent's office, one in a professional gallery. By 11 through art I had raised enough to buy myself the lap top I had set my mind on.

 

In High School my family moved to an intentional community/retreat center cradled in the Cascade Mountains of Central Washington. The school I went to had 6-8 other high school and middle school students and one teacher. We ate our meals with the local volunteers ages 0-75+, participated in weekly and monthly chores, every member of the community contributing to the greater good. In school we had the opportunity to study any topic of our interest with community members with said expertise, from German, cooking, dance, to wilderness EMT training, and diesel mechanics. We took our ideas as students and put on fashion shows with clothes made of garbage, produced a radio show, wrote a play, and put on dance parties. Age was just a number.

The village hosted weekly forums on any topic you could possibly imagine from, warm fuzzies, to volunteering in Palestine taught by passionate members of the community to visiting professors. It was these two years that the root my community design lies.

Since then I have moved on to two years in college, and several years of travel around the country, volunteer work on farms, basic life. Waiting for the day to launch into action. Quietly networking, and checking daily for the perfect piece of property.

 

The money factor:

Obviously this is not a project that will pop up overnight.

Phase I. Buy land. I have found 688 acres bordering national forest land in central Washington. $150,000 will get the roots to create the eco village and begin the process one tree at a time.

Phase II. Drill well, and get plants, trees, and berry bushes in the ground so by the time the village is established for living on a large scale the land will be developed enough to feed the quantity of people. Well costs $11,000 to build, $3,000 to irrigate, $5,000 for trees (apple, apricot, cherry, elderberry, nectarine, pear, peach, plum), vegetable garden, and berry patch. $1,000 for outdoor community kitchen for hosting classes, and events.

These are the baby steps needed to begin this journey. From there the land would slowly begin to pay through natural building courses, permaculture courses, edible wild plant classes, etc, and begin to grow one building at a time. The most important start is having the land for roots, to grow up from.

Your Impact:

Let's start helping out our neighbors, drop the shackles of society and dance together in the rain.

Chip in to support a new kind of education for Central Washington. Help me provide a place for the local elderly to get out in the sunshine and take care of plants. Help me to bring children away from screens and play and learn under the big blue sky.

Be part of creating a better world. As a backer, I will keep you updated on the growth of the village one month at a time, and show off to your friends what you helped create, and know that you do have the power to change the world.

 

Other ways you can help:

Spread the word about this project, share it on facebook, tell your friends about it, tell your friends to share it. With the power of outreach in this day and age we can all move mountains!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Raphaelle Chenet and I was born and raised in Haiti.  I studied Office Administration in the United States and worked for 20 years for the U.S. Government in different fields. I also worked work extensively with Orphans and handicapped children. The need to help abandoned children is great especially after the natural disaster that Haiti has endured.  The precarious living conditions of these children, has led us, my colleague, Nicole and I to create the Fondation OUI.  Nicole is a nutritionist and also has years of experience in Child Protection. Our goal is to accommodate and nurture vulnerable children from 0 to 6 years old, abandoned in public health institution. These children are entrusted to the Fondation by the institute of Social Welfare (IBESR).  Your kind and much needed contribution will help us to have access to proper nutrition, medical care and to fulfill with the help of caring professionals the emotional gap created by their abandonment

The Fondation Oui is a non-govermental, non-profit organization founded in 2012 that works with abandoned children from birth to 6 years of age. Fondation Oui works closely with national and international institutions and :


  • Promotes a harmonious and emotionally stable home for abandoned children
  • Provides qualiity learning and a safe environnement
  • emsures adequate health care for every child. 


What We Need & What You Get

This intervention is motivated by a strong patriotic desire and a sense of duty to care for the increasing number of abandoned children and offset the likeliness of sickness and suffering associated with lack of nutrition, healthcare, and protection.  Always with the best interest of the child in mind, OUI will seek to play a key role in supporting IBESR (Institut du Bien Etre Social et de Recherches) to identify and mediate with parents for the purpose of reunification.  With the help of highly skilled social workers, parents will be referred to existing services and support to help them address reasons for having abandoned their children without judging said reasons at any time.  

In order to provide this support, Fondation Oui is seeking 50,000.00 dollars (valued at $0.68 per child per day approximately 150 to 200 children).  Funds will be used to cover food and medical cost.  In addition, the Fondation OUI will provide services and support to the children it serves twenty four hours a day, with two twelve-hour shifts. Personnel available during these shifts are the following: nurses, caretakers, security person, doctors on call.

Any money received from this campaign will be used for the welfare of these children in the care of the Fondation OUI.


The Impact

The Fondation OUI has the goal to serve approximately 150 to 200 children per year.  Fondation OUI will establish an individual program for each child based on his/her specific needs and best interest.  In addition to health and nutrition, this program will include case management wherein social workers assigned to each case will support family placement and continually document and update IBESR on the child progress and that of his/her case in terms of a stable long-term family.

Furthermore, we will work with relevant haitian government agencies to register and obtain birth certificate for each child it serves.  It will work with both national and international medical contacts and supporters to help OUI and IBERS identify and secure special medical support for children in need of surgery or a specific life-saving medical follow-up.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by spreading the word about Fondation OUI through social media, network of friends, workplace, church and by contributing to our campaign. Any contribution will be greatly appreciated and used toward improving the welfare of these vulnerable children.
story_txt:
Short SummaryMy name is Raphaelle Chenet and I was born and raised in Haiti.  I studied Office Administration in the United States and worked for 20 years for the U.S. Government in different fields. I also worked work extensively with Orphans and handicapped children. The need to help abandoned children is great especially after the natural disaster that Haiti has endured.  The precarious living conditions of these children, has led us, my colleague, Nicole and I to create the Fondation OUI.  Nicole is a nutritionist and also has years of experience in Child Protection. Our goal is to accommodate and nurture vulnerable children from 0 to 6 years old, abandoned in public health institution. These children are entrusted to the Fondation by the institute of Social Welfare (IBESR).  Your kind and much needed contribution will help us to have access to proper nutrition, medical care and to fulfill with the help of caring professionals the emotional gap created by their abandonmentThe Fondation Oui is a non-govermental, non-profit organization founded in 2012 that works with abandoned children from birth to 6 years of age. Fondation Oui works closely with national and international institutions and : 
Promotes a harmonious and emotionally stable home for abandoned children
Provides qualiity learning and a safe environnement
emsures adequate health care for every child. 

What We Need & What You Get
This intervention is motivated by a strong patriotic desire and a sense of duty to care for the increasing number of abandoned children and offset the likeliness of sickness and suffering associated with lack of nutrition, healthcare, and protection.  Always with the best interest of the child in mind, OUI will seek to play a key role in supporting IBESR (Institut du Bien Etre Social et de Recherches) to identify and mediate with parents for the purpose of reunification.  With the help of highly skilled social workers, parents will be referred to existing services and support to help them address reasons for having abandoned their children without judging said reasons at any time.  In order to provide this support, Fondation Oui is seeking 50,000.00 dollars (valued at $0.68 per child per day approximately 150 to 200 children).  Funds will be used to cover food and medical cost.  In addition, the Fondation OUI will provide services and support to the children it serves twenty four hours a day, with two twelve-hour shifts. Personnel available during these shifts are the following: nurses, caretakers, security person, doctors on call.Any money received from this campaign will be used for the welfare of these children in the care of the Fondation OUI.
The ImpactThe Fondation OUI has the goal to serve approximately 150 to 200 children per year.  Fondation OUI will establish an individual program for each child based on his/her specific needs and best interest.  In addition to health and nutrition, this program will include case management wherein social workers assigned to each case will support family placement and continually document and update IBESR on the child progress and that of his/her case in terms of a stable long-term family.Furthermore, we will work with relevant haitian government agencies to register and obtain birth certificate for each child it serves.  It will work with both national and international medical contacts and supporters to help OUI and IBERS identify and secure special medical support for children in need of surgery or a specific life-saving medical follow-up.
Other Ways You Can HelpYou can help by spreading the word about Fondation OUI through social media, network of friends, workplace, church and by contributing to our campaign. Any contribution will be greatly appreciated and used toward improving the welfare of these vulnerable children.

story:
WE ARE COMMISIONING GYPSY ROSE PIRATE SHIP .LLC TO BUILD US A 60ft SHIP.

THIS VESSEL WILL BE USED IN THE FT LAUDERDALE INTERCOASTAL WATERWAY FOR CRUISES AND PARTIES.  WE PLAN TO BE IN THIS YEAR'S INTERCOASTAL BOAT PARADE.  MY EXPERIENCE IN THE HOSPITALITY BUSSINESS FOR MANY YEARS, HAS TAUGHT ME THAT THIS IS A GREAT VESSEL FOR THIS AREA.  THE HISTORY CHANNEL SNAPPED UP ONE OF THESE VESSELS FOR THE HIT TV SERIES AX MEN !

THE VESSEL WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:

 

U.S. Coast Gard Approved Safety Package

Twin V 8 motors

V drive transmissions

6.5 Onan/Kohler Generator

Ship electric will be 110/12 volt

Cabin lights and outlets throughout

Navigation lights – port, starboard, aft and masthead light

Dual helm stations

30” wooden captains wheel on lower helm

48” wooden captains wheel on upper helm

Two bilge pumps, forward and aft

2 air conditioners, forward and aft

Stove

Kitchen sink

Refrigerator

2 bathrooms with electric toilets and macerators

Shower with electric shower pump

Bathroom sinks

25 gallon holding tank

100 gallon freshwater tank

Fresh water pump

Cedar planked interior walls

Wood planked floor throughout

Hand painted treasure map with compass rose on ceiling

Two (2) outdoor medallion rugs on upper helm

Three (3) stern lanterns on outside of ship

Custom made merman on front of ship

Two (2) aluminum masts, approximately 11’x20’ with sails, powered by a 5000 lb. electric winch

Pirate chest to hold life jackets

Hammock in front of ship

Hand carved name of ship on back

 

Ship will look authentic, from exterior through interior with air brushed aged wood.

I NEED YOUR HELP IN MAKING THIS DREAM COME TRUE!

       SEMI RETIRED AND LOOKING FOR A NEW AND EXCITING VENTURE.... THIS IS DEFINATELY IT!!! GETTING OUT ON THE INTERCOASTAL IS WHAT PEOPLE CRAVE ON VACATION...AND TOGETHER WE WILL MAKE IT HAPPEN.

 

THERE IS NOTHING LIKE IT ANYEHERE IN THE FT LAUDERDE AREA YET

 

Please call (631)-745-0289 Bruce

story:
Dear Friends-

As many of you know, I am in Uganda for the summer working for Slum Dwellers International/ACTogether Uganda. It has been an amazing experience, and something I am so proud to be a part of. Their model for helping the poor to rise out of devastation is the most effective I have ever witnessed. Briefly, this organization helps to mobilize through teaching individuals to save, then using the collective savings of the community to improve sanitation, install clean water sources, teach vocational skills to women, and many more projects. It is the classic "Teach a man to fish, rather than give a man a fish" model, and is sustainable, effective and involves entire communities in improving their own lives.

Unfortunately, the night before I arrived in Uganda on 1 June, most of the staff was involved in a very bad traffic accident in our newly purchased vehicle. There were no fatalities but sadly, some of our members sustained severe injuries and are still recovering. Additionally, after rolling several times, the vehicle was completely destroyed. Since the accident, the organization has incurred a significant increase in operational expenses; without a vehicle, we are spending considerable resources on transportation allowances that could be better utilized for the community projects. On Friday, July 26, 2013, I am holding a Happy Hour fundraiser in an effort to replace the car. Mish Mash Restaurant, Kampala, has generously donated their space, and I am collecting donations for the event, including beverages, entertainment and raffle prizes. I will be bartending (along with special guest Jennica Kilbride from NYC!!!) and the tips will also go towards the vehicle. It is going to be a fabulous evening!

I wish all my friends could be there with me, but you can still help!!! I'm asking you to donate, and no amount is too small (or too big!). It's easy! All you have to do is follow the easy instructions on this campaign page, and please know that your donation is safe and secure and that 100% of your donation goes directly towards the purchase of the new vehicle and nothing else! Your generosity will help countless people, and we are all grateful for your generosity. Thank you so much for your support! Please know how much this project means to me and to so many other people. Much love, Sue

story:
Needle in a Haystack Special Needs Childcare is a specialist childcare referral agency; we work solely with families who have children with additional needs (and their siblings) in the Boston Metro and surrounding New England area. We provide experienced nannies, buddies, mentors and childcare workers for positions that may be full or part-time, daily or live-in, temporary and permanent.

We deal with placements for babies, children and teens with a range of additional needs including mild learning difficulties, physical or learning disabilities and social-emotional and behavioral needs.

I am Robert Jones, Founder of Needle in a Haystack Childcare and here is a little about my background. Having started my education in Providence RI and receiving an Associate’s Degree in Culinary Arts, I decided to rekindle my enjoyment of working with children that started when I was seventeen as a voluntary year long class assignment. I applied to work as a Kitchen counselor at a camp in Ashford, CT as a summer internship. The camp is a residential summer camp for children between the ages of seven and fifteen with a chronic illness. I was offered the position as kitchen supervisor and camp counselor. Upon arriving it did not take me long to realize that I was at someplace very special. I felt extremely overwhelmed with the responsibility of taking care of the children and the trust that their families had in me as part of the staff. I started to question my ability to adequately meet the special needs and challenges many of these children faced. Looking back I can honestly say that my worries were ill conceived and wrongly placed. I have never felt that I belonged somewhere as I did at that camp. My first summer there was such a life changing experience that it is hard for me to attempt to explain it in words. After that experience I sought out to become an expert in working with children. I finished my culinary degree and started a second degree in Psychology while being employed as a Nanny for two young boys for 4.5 years. I enjoyed working with children so much that I worked as a substitute teacher in an integrated classroom when my charges were both old enough to attend school. After receiving my Psychology degree, I decided to study abroad at RoehamptonUniversity in London, UK where I received my Master’s in Education. I have enjoyed many different positions highlighting my passion of working with children, specifically with special needs; ranging from Elementary School Teacher, Learning Support Specialist and Behavioral Specialist to ABA Tutor and Nanny all the while enjoying every experience enough to allow it to lead me to the next.

 

Those past experiences have led me to point my passion in another direction. Instead of being the nanny who works great with children I want to touch more lives by finding others like me. People who love working with children but work especially well with those who have additional needs and put them in the homes that need them. Many parents who have children with additional needs will tell you that one of the hardest things is finding childcare that their child will respond too, who understands exactly what is being asked of them and who can deal with the good days as well as the bad ones that come with this type of position. While I still love working with children I have realized that there is a need for specialized childcare. I understand that being a mainstream nanny and being a special needs nanny are two completely different roles—and they require different types of people. My agency is about those special people and the special children that they love to work with. I want to share with my customers the benefit of  my 15 years experience working with children and showcase my ability in communicating with and understanding all children to help them find that Needle in Haystack that will make a positive difference in their family’s life.

 

I hope that you all will help me make this a reality. I am asking for assistance for advertising and marketing the agency to the communities that can use my services. Contributions will also go to help with some of the overhead cost of a business that is just starting out. (e.g. Supplies, incorporation fees ect..)

You can learn more about Needle in a Haystack Special Needs Childcare Agency at http://www.NIAHChildcare.com

story:
On March 11, our good friend Rian was in a very bad car accident in Providence, RI on I-95. His car means the world to him, and he completely lost it. Luckily he did not lose his own life along with it, however, at this moment in time, Rian is in the hospital with several injuries. He has a broken foot, multiple fractures to his face, a broken jaw and eye sockets, and missing teeth. While Rian will be in and out of the hospital for the next few months undergoing surgeries, we wanted to take this time and raise money and lift his spirits. This is the best gift we as friends can give him. Any donation, big or small, is greatly appreciated. Please remember that no donation is too small... anything helps! This fundraiser will also help Rian's family with any medical bills they need. A car, medical bills, whatever they want to use if for to help get him back on his feet.

Rian is the most genuine, energetic, and caring friend we have. He really is a great person and we love him so much. We know that if this happened to any of us he would be doing the same.

Rian's car was a third generation DC2 Acura Integra with a B18C5 motor and some rare parts from Japan! This car was his baby, and for anyone who is into cars will know that this is a great loss. Let's do our best to get him a new baby! :)


if you know him and have any questions about this fundraiser, you can contact Carlene Godsoe or Jenny Paradise! We are on Facebook and Instagram! Use this instgram hashtag to help us spread the word! #teamdirtyribeiro 













#teamdirtyribeiro
