story:
NOT JUST WHAT WE ARE DOING, BUT WHY WE ARE DOING IT

We are producing the first recognized Mexican whiskey that is comparable to the best selling whiskeys in the world.

Our goal is to raise $100,000.  Our funding will allow us to expand production, achieve nationwide distribution and export to our first international markets.  

More importantly, your donation drives Dorwart Whiskey to a scale that allows us to contribute 1% of annual net profits to education services in our local community for the life of the company.

I am Larry Dorwart, founder of Dorwart Whiskey and Distiller.  I have been pleased with the local success of my hand crafted whiskey.  But global scale allows my wife Eve, my team and I to give back in a big way and make a huge difference in our local community.

Why not contribute and be a part of making dreams come true?

IT'S OUR AZTEC CORN THAT MAKES OUR WHISKEY SO GOOD
 
Dorwart’s Single Cask Sour Mash Whiskey is the pride of our distillery. It is based on our Prohibition era Dorwart family recipe and is made with 100% natural, locally grown Aztec corn which originates in Mexico thousands of years ago. Our corn supplier, a local generational ranchero, has access to his fields only by mule to climb the winding path to his fields where he plants and harvests the crop in the Sierra Madre Mountains surrounding Boca de Tomatlan. By planting the Aztec corn at this high altitude, our corn thrives in the nutrient rich soil, temperate climate, and cool winds which roll in from the Pacific Ocean. 
 
Our 100% natural Aztec corn creates the start of an exceptional liquor.  We use a 100% corn bill recipe for our sour mash and our fermentation tanks are not sealed so that the natural yeast in the environment blends with our starter yeast to produce a ﬂavour unique to Dorwart Whiskey. All of our products contain an all natural recipe, revealing the true essence of the hand-selected, local ingredients. After being distilled, the liquor goes into custom-charred, once used, French red wine, white oak barrels.  The Mexican sun and humidity naturally age our whiskey, just as the natural elements of the Dorwart family farm had done for the 'shine so many years ago. What’s left is something completely new and refreshing that we have introduced to the whiskey market?
 
The quality, rarity, and extra effort given to our corn will be evident when you taste Dorwart Whiskey.  Our whiskey is reminiscent of some of Kentucky's lighter bourbons with caramel overtones. It is fresh to the palate with a light, long-lasting finish.  No other whiskey has what Dorwart Whiskey has - Aztec corn, our age-old Prohibition era family recipe, and the natural elements of our home in Mexico. 

HELPING OUR LOCAL COMMUNITIES - IT BEGAN WITH A DREAM

I was raised in Lampman Saskatchewan, Canada.  I spent my adult life building oil and gas plants and pipelines in Alberta, Canada.

My wife and I have been spending winter months over the past 10 years in a small fishing village, Boca de Tomatlán, 15 minutes south of Puerto Vallarta, Mexico.  We had fallen in love with this village, the people, their traditions and dreamed about retiring there, it was where we wanted to plant our feet for the rest of our lives. However, we weren't really ready to retire.  

My grandparents and father use to produce and market moonshine during the prohibition days.  My first experience at distilling began at the age of 11 and I continued with my passion through out my life.  We purchased a 100 litre stainless steel still from the United States, brought it to Boca de Tomatlán and began playing around with my family moonshine recipe, bourbon and sour mash recipes.  

After doing some research we had discovered that there weren't any whiskey distillers in Mexico. All whiskey products are imported into the country.  We saw an opportunity, well actually we saw a couple of opportunities.

The first opportunity is that people from around the world have purchased our whiskey products. We've been featured in a book written in the United Kingdom and approached by retailers to sell our products in Wal-Mart, Sam's and various liquor outlets in Puerto Vallarta.  Liquor distributors from the United States, Canada, India, China and across Mexico want to export and buy our Single Cask Whiskey.

This presents a GOOD problem, but a big problem, in that we just do not have the distilling capacity to meet the growing demand.  We have decided we DON’T want to remain a small business.

The second opportunity was our deciding factor.   Growing will give us the opportunity to provide something back to this village that we love so much.  Through the years we have done little things, quietly, but now it is time to do great things. We see an opportunity to provide jobs, bring more tourism into the village, funding for the schools, opportunities for the children to attend, finish and achieve further education through scholarships.  We saw an opportunity to encourage them to follow their dreams.  

WE NEED YOUR HELP

Becoming a Funding Partner isn't just about contributing to expand Mexico's first recognized whiskey distillery, it is an opportunity to provide jobs and giving children the opportunities that your children, our children and grandchildren have, fulfilling their dreams. 

Our goal is to raise $100,000.  Once we have reached our campaign goal,  5% of the funds received will be used to improve the education in the schools of Boca de Tomatlán.  But that’s just the start.  That kick start to growing our business means our commitment to 1% of net profits annually going to the same causes in our local communities.    

How to get there?  Reaching our goal will enable us to do the following:

  • Build an extension to the distillery to accommodate a second, larger still of 3000 litres.
  • Increase our current production from 1500 litres per month to 10,000 litres per month.  
  • Add a 3000 litre stainless steel fermentation tank. 
  • Purchase additional barrels and finish the barrel room.  
  • Assist in purchasing the new bottles, labels and caps that you our funding partner's have assisted in choosing.
  • Finalize our exportation licenses.  
  • Complete the first renovation of the Dorwart Whiskey Club 20° for members and guests and a tasting and boutique area.

PERKS

We would love to be able to share our whiskey with all of you who are funding this project, but we are not yet set up for exportation.  We hope that soon, though, you will be able to find our whiskey in your local stores.  

In the meantime, we put together gifts hand crafted and purchased locally.  We like to support the local economies.

VOTING on bottle and label designs:  Within a week or two following your donation you will receive an email from the Dorwart team email (info@dorwart.mx) with our bottle and label design photos attached.  You may also review these photos now in our Gallery of photos.  Just respond to the email with your preferences and feedback.  We look forward to you're receiving your vote and your great ideas! 

#

Every Funding Parter from $1.00 to $5,000 will have their names engraved on our 450 litre still. Every one of you that contributes deserves to be recognized.  You are making a difference in Boca de Tomtalán.

The Funding Partner's List will also be placed in the schools and at the local community office.

DORWART CLUB 20º

This is an artist's rendition of the club members section of the new future distillery.

This drawing has been done by Karla De La Pena V owner of the Boca Divers Shop in Boca de Tomatlan.

 CLUB 20º

A members only club situated in the jungle of the Sierra Madre's with the Horcones River flowing by. It is a place for a relaxing time.

As our distillery grows we will always be involved in R&D. We make a fine sour mash whiskey but we want to develop a single malt and I have been told that we make an exquisite rum also I want to see what we can do with  Gin. These will all be small one of a kind batches only available to members  as we develop the recipe. The Rum and Gin will only be available to members but when we develop a whiskey recipe that every one feels we should share we would send the recipe over to the main distillery for production. As a member you would be notified when a limited edition is scheduled for bottling and we would ship.

A members only club 

 

Thanks for reading this far, now a favour to ask..........

Contribute, please!  That would be great!  And share our Campaign!

And if you cannot contribute, we’d still like to ask for your help. Will you spread the word about our Campaign and about Dorwart whiskey anyway, please?  Use the Share tools all over this page.  Send our link in an email to your family, friends and contacts. Post our link on your Facebook. Tweet our link.  Talk about us on Indiegogo.  We’d really appreciate that.  Thank you for your support!

Dorwart’s Single Cask Sour Mash Whiskey is the pride of our distillery. It is based on our Prohibition era Dorwart family recipe and is made with 100% natural, locally grown Aztec corn which originates in Mexico thousands of years ago. Our corn supplier, a local generational ranchero, has access to his fields only by mule to climb the winding path to his fields where he plants and harvests the crop in the Sierra Madre Mountains surrounding Boca de Tomatlan. By planting the Aztec corn at this high altitude, our corn thrives in the nutrient rich soil, temperate climate, and cool winds which roll in from the Pacific Ocean. 
 
Our 100% natural Aztec corn creates the start of an exceptional liquor.  We use a 100% corn bill recipe for our sour mash and our fermentation tanks are not sealed so that the natural yeast in the environment blends with our starter yeast to produce a ﬂavour unique to Dorwart Whiskey. All of our products contain an all natural recipe, revealing the true essence of the hand-selected, local ingredients. After being distilled, the liquor goes into custom-charred, once used, French red wine, white oak barrels.  The Mexican sun and humidity naturally age our whiskey, just as the natural elements of the Dorwart family farm had done for the 'shine so many years ago. What’s left is something completely new and refreshing that we have introduced to the whiskey market?
 
The quality, rarity, and extra effort given to our corn will be evident when you taste Dorwart Whiskey.  Our whiskey is reminiscent of some of Kentucky's lighter bourbons with caramel overtones. It is fresh to the palate with a light, long-lasting finish.  No other whiskey has what Dorwart Whiskey has - Aztec corn, our age-old Prohibition era family recipe, and the natural elements of our home in Mexico. 

HELPING OUR LOCAL COMMUNITIES - IT BEGAN WITH A DREAM
I was raised in Lampman Saskatchewan, Canada.  I spent my adult life building oil and gas plants and pipelines in Alberta, Canada.
My wife and I have been spending winter months over the past 10 years in a small fishing village, Boca de Tomatlán, 15 minutes south of Puerto Vallarta, Mexico.  We had fallen in love with this village, the people, their traditions and dreamed about retiring there, it was where we wanted to plant our feet for the rest of our lives. However, we weren't really ready to retire.  
My grandparents and father use to produce and market moonshine during the prohibition days.  My first experience at distilling began at the age of 11 and I continued with my passion through out my life.  We purchased a 100 litre stainless steel still from the United States, brought it to Boca de Tomatlán and began playing around with my family moonshine recipe, bourbon and sour mash recipes.  
After doing some research we had discovered that there weren't any whiskey distillers in Mexico. All whiskey products are imported into the country.  We saw an opportunity, well actually we saw a couple of opportunities.
The first opportunity is that people from around the world have purchased our whiskey products. We've been featured in a book written in the United Kingdom and approached by retailers to sell our products in Wal-Mart, Sam's and various liquor outlets in Puerto Vallarta.  Liquor distributors from the United States, Canada, India, China and across Mexico want to export and buy our Single Cask Whiskey.
This presents a GOOD problem, but a big problem, in that we just do not have the distilling capacity to meet the growing demand.  We have decided we DON’T want to remain a small business.
The second opportunity was our deciding factor.   Growing will give us the opportunity to provide something back to this village that we love so much.  Through the years we have done little things, quietly, but now it is time to do great things. We see an opportunity to provide jobs, bring more tourism into the village, funding for the schools, opportunities for the children to attend, finish and achieve further education through scholarships.  We saw an opportunity to encourage them to follow their dreams.  

WE NEED YOUR HELP
Becoming a Funding Partner isn't just about contributing to expand Mexico's first recognized whiskey distillery, it is an opportunity to provide jobs and giving children the opportunities that your children, our children and grandchildren have, fulfilling their dreams. 
Our goal is to raise $100,000.  Once we have reached our campaign goal,  5% of the funds received will be used to improve the education in the schools of Boca de Tomatlán.  But that’s just the start.  That kick start to growing our business means our commitment to 1% of net profits annually going to the same causes in our local communities.    
How to get there?  Reaching our goal will enable us to do the following:

Build an extension to the distillery to accommodate a second, larger still of 3000 litres.
Increase our current production from 1500 litres per month to 10,000 litres per month.  
Add a 3000 litre stainless steel fermentation tank. 
Purchase additional barrels and finish the barrel room.  
Assist in purchasing the new bottles, labels and caps that you our funding partner's have assisted in choosing.
Finalize our exportation licenses.  
Complete the first renovation of the Dorwart Whiskey Club 20° for members and guests and a tasting and boutique area.



PERKS
We would love to be able to share our whiskey with all of you who are funding this project, but we are not yet set up for exportation.  We hope that soon, though, you will be able to find our whiskey in your local stores.  
In the meantime, we put together gifts hand crafted and purchased locally.  We like to support the local economies.
VOTING on bottle and label designs:  Within a week or two following your donation you will receive an email from the Dorwart team email (info@dorwart.mx) with our bottle and label design photos attached.  You may also review these photos now in our Gallery of photos.  Just respond to the email with your preferences and feedback.  We look forward to you're receiving your vote and your great ideas! 

#Every Funding Parter from $1.00 to $5,000 will have their names engraved on our 450 litre still. Every one of you that contributes deserves to be recognized.  You are making a difference in Boca de Tomtalán.
The Funding Partner's List will also be placed in the schools and at the local community office.
DORWART CLUB 20º

This is an artist's rendition of the club members section of the new future distillery.
This drawing has been done by Karla De La Pena V owner of the Boca Divers Shop in Boca de Tomatlan.
 CLUB 20º
A members only club situated in the jungle of the Sierra Madre's with the Horcones River flowing by. It is a place for a relaxing time.
As our distillery grows we will always be involved in R&D. We make a fine sour mash whiskey but we want to develop a single malt and I have been told that we make an exquisite rum also I want to see what we can do with  Gin. These will all be small one of a kind batches only available to members  as we develop the recipe. The Rum and Gin will only be available to members but when we develop a whiskey recipe that every one feels we should share we would send the recipe over to the main distillery for production. As a member you would be notified when a limited edition is scheduled for bottling and we would ship.
A members only club 
 
Thanks for reading this far, now a favour to ask..........


Contribute, please!  That would be great!  And share our Campaign!
And if you cannot contribute, we’d still like to ask for your help. Will you spread the word about our Campaign and about Dorwart whiskey anyway, please?  Use the Share tools all over this page.  Send our link in an email to your family, friends and contacts. Post our link on your Facebook. Tweet our link.  Talk about us on Indiegogo.  We’d really appreciate that.  Thank you for your support!

story:
Have your picture placed on Arie's Stadium Super Truck or his helmet for the entire race season!

 

**We are making progress!**

OUR GOAL HAS BEEN LOWERED!! Due to the fact corporate sponsors have contributed we are now that much closer to reaching our goal! Thank you for those of you that have helped me get this far, now lets push through to the finish! 

 

Together we can help put Arie back into a racecar!

 

Arie, best known for IndyCar and Indy Lights, has a new passion: Stadium Super Trucks. He wants to take all of you on-board with him during the 2013 racing season.

By offering sections of the truck, friends, fans and supporters can upload a 1X1 inch photo that will be placed on Arie's racing truck. You could ride along with Arie into victory lane in this exciting platform of off-road racing.

The overall budget for Stadium Super Trucks is in the millions but this portion of the budget will guarantee Arie’s seat for the 2013 season. Weekly racing blogs and videos, fan meet and greets, ride alongs and hospitality at the racing events are just a few ways Arie will give back to his contributors. Help him achieve his first full-time ride since his impressive 2008 Indy Lights season.

"Doing what you love is most important and racing is my life, my passion. The thrill I get when I’m racing is indescribable. I’ve always wanted to be able to better share that experience with the fans. I think with this initiative a part of everyone will be right there racing for the win with me. Sharing in the extreme highs of winning races and visiting victory circle. But also in the extreme lows of our sport—mechanical failures and frustrations from lack of results. We’ll be in it together as a team. Thank you in advance and see you at a Stadium Super Truck race this season!" -Arie

 

Here is a mock up of the Stadium Super Truck...

Here is a mock up of the Bell helmet Arie will use for 2013. The helmet will be auctioned off at the end of the season, all proceeds going to the Red Cross..

 

 

Here is the 2013 Stadium Super Trucks Schedule...

Here is a few shots of the Stadium Super Truck...

 

Frequently asked questions:

 

Q: What happens if we don't meet the $400,000 goal?

A: If we find ourselves in this situation, all contributions will go towards funding a full or partial season. Arie will start the Stadium Super Trucks season at the opener in Phoenix and will continue to raise funds, with the goal of racing the entire season. 

 

Q: Where does the money go?

A: The overall budget is nearly 2 million dollars for a full season of Stadium Super Trucks. The $50,000 secures Arie’s spot and makes it possible for him to contend for an overall Championship. 

 

Q: Why does Arie need our help? 

A: All of Arie’s experience has been in the IndyCar and open-wheel racing. Stadium Super Trucks is a new challenge for him and he needs your help to kick start and reestablish his career. Struggling to find sponsors after filming the Bachelorette, Arie thought this would be a great way to not only incorporate his fans into his racing career, but also interact with them at the racetrack.  The program is meant to include everyone.  If each of Arie’s twitter followers contributed $4, he could be fully funded for the season.

 

Q: When do we submit our photograph for the race truck?

A: Closer to the end of the crowd raising effort, expect an e-mail from Arie's team explaining the requirements for each photograph. The photos will be incorporated into the design of the truck and a picture of the completed mock up will be sent to all of the contributors. 

 

Q: Is there any room for major sponsors? If I own a company can I sponsor the Team Arie truck?

A: ABSOLUTELY! We will be selling larger spots on the race truck to corporate sponsors and are actively pursuing this. If we acquire these potential sponsors, our goal of $400,00 will be lowered.  Please tell all your friends and acquaintances.  You never know who is listening! For more information on corporate sponsorship, please e-mail klint@ariejr.com 

 

Q: Is PayPal the only option?

A: No! Now you can pay directly with any major Credit Card

 

Q: Where can we find more info on Stadium Super Trucks?

A: Check out www.stadiumsupertrucks.com for more Information, along with videos, interviews and a full schedule of events.

 

CONTRIBUTE!!!!

story:
UPDATE: Although we are still actively working on getting ROVE into your hands, we have stopped our Indiegogo campaign early to tweak both our marketing and the price of ROVE. 

Find out more and signup for updates through gorove.com

We developed ROVE to easily:

  • Share adventure routes from a GPS, along with all of the stats (distance travelled, average speed, elevation gain, etc.)
  • Download new information, such as multiple nearby geocaches, directly to the GPS.

ROVE does this all without cables and computers, anywhere there is WiFi or cellular service. 

ROVE is ideal for:

  • The woods: Hikers, Explorers
  • The water: Kayakers, Paddlers, Sailors
  • The mountains: Climbers
  • The road (off/on): Cyclists, Skiers, Drivers, ATVers, Snowmobilers
  • The air: Pilots, Gliders
  • Outdoor Groups/Businesses: Adventure Tourism, Tourism, Guides

Great for showing groups how far they've gone and where they have explored.

story:
Hello, my name is Erin. Im a 32 yr old woman battling lupus and other health problems. A period ago I did not have a roof over my head or any friends  in the area that I had to move to. I had no drivers license due to the seizures from my lupus. I had no way to my Dr. appointments or the hospital.

I met Donald McWilliams He was so nice and wanted to help me knowing that I could not return the kindness he showed. He is a hardworking single dad, upstanding member of his community. He goes to work everyday to take care of his son and on my worst days me. The truck that he has to drive an hour to work and an hour home everyday is on its last leg. It is always breaking down.

I saw this site and thought it would be a great way to give back to this wonderful man that has so freely and kindly helped others not expecting anything in return. So please help me raise the funds and support this campaign, so Donald can get a reliable truck in his time of need.

Donald has always taught his son to give no matter if you get anything in return. He has taught me that there are people that do care and are willing to help. Thank you for taking the time to be involved.

story:
Ideas! Coffee House was born in March 2002 with a vision of community first. We knew what we wanted to be: a seller of the best coffee drinks (with Counter Culture as our primary coffee roaster), a warm friendly place where people could come together to discuss ideas, network, read, study or just hang out and have a good time with friends. We wanted to provide choice drinks such as your best cups of coffee, frappes, cappuccino, red tea, milkshakes, smoothies and the list goes on. We wanted to be a positive place, a place where people could be uplifted, inspired, welcomed with a warm friendly greeting and prompt courteous service. We are now over 11 years old and have made great progress towards becoming that great establishment. People from all over the Triangle and beyond have found their way to Ideas! Coffee House.  We have encompassed a plethora of events, from VIBES open mic nights that feature poetry and song, book signings from local and nationally renowned authors, community conversations with the mayor of Durham and local business leaders, chess tournaments, birthday parties, movie nights and much, much more! Visitors and family have been delighted with the products, services, and atmosphere they have found here.  

Ideas! Coffee House is a great place for meetings, book clubs, showers and parties. It is easily accessible for senior citizens and persons with physical disabilities. We plan to further promote the exchange of ideas for better Durham communities individually, but more importantly, collectively as a city.  We believe the Triangle area is home to some of the greatest thinkers and Idea people in the world. We want Ideas! Coffee House to be one of the best places in this area for thinking people to congregate.

Being Durham born and bred, one of our biggest goals is to not only make a difference in our beloved city, but to revitalize the communities we serve. 

WE NEED THE SUPPORT, HELP, AND PARTICIPATION FROM GOOD PEOPLE LIKE YOU IN ORDER FOR US TO REACH OUR GOAL OF COMMUNITY FIRST!! 

We are renovating the building, which is located at 1230 Avondale Drive, Durham NC, and need to raise $20,000.00 to assist in renovations for your new neighborhood coffee house. We will need new AC units, plumbing, updated coffee equipment, and more. Your contributions will make YOU a part of this new endeavor.  Even if you can't support us financially, you can still help us by spreading the word and sharing this link with your family and friends.

We have put together some wonderful perks for those who can support this project financially.  Please take a moment to see what level of support you can give to assist in this establishment. We look forward to seeing you either in person or online.  Thank you all in advance for whatever level of support you give.

 

Delbert and Carmen Jarmon - Owners

story:
Short Summary

I'm a small developer looking for some money to make my small app TextFlick just a little bit bigger!

I'm a programmer whose been developing web apps for several years now. I know/am learning the languages HTML, CSS, PHP, MYSQL, bits of Python, Ruby, and Javascript.

I'm looking to create an app that will allow a person to send notifications via texts. You will also be able to send these text messages internationally. Along with these features you will be able to attach images and share them via texts in groups with family and friends. Unlike other texting apps, this app will allow users to send scheduled notifications, (e.g., "Remember to buy eggs at 12:00.") in groups and also allows one to send and open a multitude of file types.  

With the money I make, I plan to hire a designer to completely redesign my site with a clean UI. I will also be able to develop a native app for Android, Windows 7, and iOS users. Along with that I will be able to hire a team of developers.

What I Need

I will need $10,000 for the project. Here is how I plan to use the money:

  • I will need to hire a designer; and a team consisting of 2-3 developers.
  • I will need developer's licenses (iOS, Android)($150).
  • I need money pay for Twilio's API

The Impact

This is a great way to send texts affordably (free, actually) and internationally. It will also have some really cool features you can use 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute that doesn't mean you can't help. Let others be aware of this upcoming app and feel free to post a link on facebook or on Twitter. Remember there are always the Indiegogo share tools to use.

If you just can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • You can help to make some noise about my app. Try it for free and let me know what you think on Twitter and/or on  Facebook.

Use the Indiegogo share tools, too!

Thank you for reading about my app. Thanks in advance for any help you can offer.

story:
Hello, I am Michael Young. I'm a simple 18 year old kid from Texas. In October of 2011 I noticed that it had become increasingly more difficult for me to breath through my nose. I didn't think alot about it at first but when I got sick we went to see a doctor. They told me what I had but didn't refer me to see a specialist about my 'condition'. So we called Dr. Cepero and set up the next available date for an appointment. I went in a he looked for 2 seconds and told me what I had but that they were so severe that he couldn't put the micro camera in my nose to look so he set up a date for me to have a CT scan. I went to visit the doctor again a couple days after my scan. He told me what I had was called Allergic Fungal Sinusitis. He told me that I would need to see a specialist in Dallas and an allergist.

He also told me that the polyps that were blocking my nasal cavity had built up so much pressure that it has completely eroded the sinus wall between the cavity and the brain. He told me that it was common for small ammounts of erosion to happen but that my case was uncommon due to the severity of the erosion.

 

All I am asking for is a little help because the total cost of the surgery will be around $12,000. I'm just an 18 year old kid and I don't have that kind of money but the surgery needs to be done. I don't have a whole lot to give you but I will try and make it worth your time if you decide to donate. If you can't donate or don't want to donate, please at least take the time to share this with friends and family or on your facebook page or a youtube video. Thank you for your time. Every small bit can help.

He told me what I had was called Allergic Fungal Sinusitis. He told me that I would need to see a specialist in Dallas and an allergist.
He also told me that the polyps that were blocking my nasal cavity had built up so much pressure that it has completely eroded the sinus wall between the cavity and the brain. He told me that it was common for small ammounts of erosion to happen but that my case was uncommon due to the severity of the erosion.
 
All I am asking for is a little help because the total cost of the surgery will be around $12,000. I'm just an 18 year old kid and I don't have that kind of money but the surgery needs to be done. I don't have a whole lot to give you but I will try and make it worth your time if you decide to donate. If you can't donate or don't want to donate, please at least take the time to share this with friends and family or on your facebook page or a youtube video. Thank you for your time. Every small bit can help.

story:
Our Story  I am a single mom that has found her passion for boudoir photography! My first studio opened in 06 after I sold  my children's event company  in 06  then to opened my first small studio in Michigan for women. A place for women by women The Boudoir Loft

A place for women to get make up and hair done, feel pampered and sexy for a day> with photos and materials to give to others or keep for themselves. This journey started  four years ago and now I am trying to expand. I want to expand because I see a special need now and the time if right!!!  Women that have had some type of trauma, divorce, weight loss, cancer anything that has made them feel transformed.

 I have been offered space for a new studio in an amazing place.  In shooting women now for several years I have found out two major things. 1. Women that have been through trauma are strong and proud and do want to talk about it and document it 2. Women all want a day that is just for them to feel special and preserve it on film. 

I hope to be able to offer a beautiful studio for women to come that have been through weight loss and re-constructive surgeries, cancer survival,over fifty and well for just about any reason a woman wants to have her up to date moment put on film.


What We Need & What You Get

We hope to raise enough money to have a permanent make up artist on staff that can also do re-constructive tattooing for women that need color replacement, an airbrush make up area for women with scarring and a full blown dressing closest with amazing gowns, shoes, hats and fun accessories for the photo shoot of their dreams.The money will be used to set up these photo areas.  The studio is 1200 square feet that has been offered to us and needs flooring, updated bathroom, and beautiful seating and mirrors.  I also need to develop our lounge area for the client that needs to lie down possibly to take a little break.  Coffee area, juice area and so on.  My studio now is only 500 feet and too small to expand to my new clients.  I have been doing work with women for years that have lost 200 lbs and has scars, a client that has been a two time cancer survivor.  I really want to make this a wow place for these women to have a day of photos like the models do.


Other Ways You Can Help

I am asking for any furniture donations also.  I am willing to paint anything to make it work.  Old dressers, mirrors, so please anything helps!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ryan Miller and I am the Founder of Hunters Helping Heroes, a Not-for-Profit Organization in New Jersey concentrating on helping our Nation’s heroes participate in outdoor retreats.

Operation Veteran Support has set its sights on raising money to send our Nation's Veterans on fully paid outdoors excursions. These events provide our Veterans with unique opportunities to experience the great outdoors and enjoy the tranquility and therapeutic atmosphere that nature provides them. Getting our Veterans out on events like these are the key elements to the success of this program and this is too important a resource to go unnoticed.

Your willingness to contribute will help us immensely; we are motivated and committed to making this a successful venture. These trips will have significant impact on the ability to take our ideas and create something tangible for our Veterans to experience.

What We Need

Our goal for Operation Veteran Support is to meet or exceed the $1,500 mark. Every single penny donated to us will be used toward paying for an excursion so that no Veteran will pay anything out of pocket; it is our little way of saying thank you for your service and sacrifices. Whether we hit our goal or not, 100% of the money raised will go into paying for as many Veteran retreats as possible so that all they need to do is show up and have a great time!

The Impact

Since we started Hunters Helping Heroes in 2010, we have sent out 30+ Veterans on excursions all over the U.S.A ranging from striper fishing here in New Jersey to duck hunting in Washington and even a few Southwest Texas whitetail hunts. We have catered to a few Purple Heart recipients and also Active Duty members, Reservists and Veterans who previously served. We are looking forward to making 2012 our biggest year yet and with your help, it will be!

Our biggest project we are working right now is the Picatinny Arsenal Wounded Warrior Hunting Program here in New Jersey. This program is for six (6ea.) Combat Wounded Veterans only. We will take them out into one of three (3ea.) specially constructed wheelchair friendly ground blinds on a hunting retreat where they are allowed access to base property that has never been hunted before to harvest a whitetail buck with archery equipment. This unique opportunity came from material and volunteer donations thanks to Home Depot and our 60+ volunteers who helped build and install these blinds over a two day period.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot afford to donate to Operation Veteran Support you can still help us. Please spread the word about Hunters Helping Heroes and if you meet or know a Wounded Veteran or Servicemember who would like to go on a retreat with us, please send them to our website to contact us. We also have a FaceBook page where you can come and give our page a “Like” and see our latest activities and events.

Thank you for taking the time to read about Operation Veteran Support and God Bless,
Ryan Miller
Hunters Helping Heroes
www.huntershelpingheroes.org

story:
Who we are....

The Used Bookstore in Downtown Chico is in danger of closing.

As manager of The Bookstore in Chico, California for the last 22 years, Josh Mills has developed a passion for books. He and his wife, Muir Hughes have both grown up in this community and now raise their children there.

After 37 years in operation, the owner decided it was time to retire and close up shop. The Mills family wished to keep the store open, giving a deposit to stop the closure. The remaining balance must be raised in the next 45 days to purchase the business and keep the doors open. The Bookstore is a tremendous resource that can't be lost!

Located in the heart of downtown, community arts and cultural events will be promoted as a new vision for the store with the focus remaining on providing a large selection of high quality used books. Literacy advocacy, regular children's story hour and poetry readings will be implemented. 

This family of four are all artists. Josh Mills is a photographer, Muir Hughes is a textile artist and performance artist and both children aged 10 and 12 are visual and performance artists and actively collaborate within the community. With an opportunity to fully utilize the space, regular art events will take place showcasing artists in various mediums. They also have a vision for the underutilized back courtyard for small events, receptions and workshops.

 

Where will the money go?

We need to raise a minimum of $35,000 to pay the balance on the business. This will allow the doors to remain open to the community. The Bookstore has been a valuable and prominent business for locals and tourists alike but has not been fully realized as a resource. With this funding, community involvement will increase.

This campaign features unique perks including rare signed books and original art. 

  

What are the results?

 

Your donation means The Bookstore is important to you and has the potential to continue to be an anchor in the community. In this changing world, bookstores offer something tangible and meaningful.  We love books and the environment a physical bookstore offers. 

Now, perhaps more than ever, we need a place to explore, get lost in, get inspired by, and maybe slow down every once in awhile.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to see The Bookstore continue, please let people know about the store, the campaign, and spread the word. We will post updates about our progress. 

Thank you sincerely,

The Mills Family

story:
Summary

A loving mother that gave so much of herself to her kids and the community is struck with one tragedy after another. Four years ago after moving away from her children in NJ to take care of her mother in FL. Her oldest son of 38 years dies of a sudden heart attack, than while preparing her son's funeral, her son-in law dies in a tragic motorcycle accident. After returning to Florida her step-father passes, and then her sister is struck with pancreatic cancer. The heart-breaks are tragic enough. Now she is faced with losing her own life. She has very little money and no health insurance, so she fights for her life. Just recently going through radiation treatment for cervical cancer, she now faces the possibly of blood cancer, leukemia, or even bone marrow cancer. Also, her diabetes has taken over; she has become legally blind, and has less than 30% of her kidneys. Not only does she face major health problems but financial crisis as well. Her car has broken down, her washer just fell apart, and she has to decide whether to eat or to get her medication each month. She can no longer be driven to the clinics or cannot attend the blind school for help. This wonderful woman is my mother and we all are trying so hard to help her out financially, but my husband is disabled as well and we have seven children so I can't do this on my own. We need a miracle to radically change my mom and dad's lives. My dad is on SSD, physically disabled with heart disease and Emphysema. He is taken care of my mom that best he can. My mom has given so much to others and has been through so much pain. But I fear that her “will” to press on is ceasing along with her health. Please help me to put a smile back on my mom's face by allowing her to not only pay for her medical expenses but have a car that runs good, and food on the table. She is the kind of women that would give you the shirt off her back and not even ask why. For years she has pulled homeless people off the streets, taken them in, and feed them. She has run outreaches for families in need and worked soup kitchens. But now she struggles to be able to complete the tasks God has called her to do. So I ask that we as a community give back and help my mom fight for her life. 

The Impact

By helping my mom, you not only impact her life, but impact the community as well. She has a lot to offer to the comunity and she can make a huge difference in helping others by using the skills God has equipped her with. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Prayer is an essential part of my mom's healing. Please pray for her and the people donating. That God blesses them abundatly!

Donations: car, medical supplies (blind, diabetes), food.

story:
Me Voy A Mexico!

I AM GOING TO MEXICO!

On November 12th I will be moving to Mexico for a few months to work for a new company that I’m very passionate about called GlobeIn.

This will be a very exciting but challenging chapter in my life and I would love your support!

I will be headed to Mexico to launch GlobeIn in Latin America.
GlobeIn provides an online platform for artisans to sell their crafts, connecting artisans from remote regions to the global marketplace. GlobeIn’s online marketplace consists of a community of travelers, buyers, sellers, storytellers, and explorers around the world. It is a living atlas of crafts.

A large majority of my job will be to work directly with artisans, taking pictures of their crafts, listening to their stories, uploading their information online, assisting with the logistics of sending packages and money transactions. Most importantly, I will be helping artisans tell their stories while connecting them to the global marketplace.

I need your support!

  • I need $800 to purchase a 64GB iPad so that I can take photos, videos, record stories, and upload everything to GlobeIn in one streamlined process. Since, I will be traveling to artisan communities, having something small, portable, and reliable will be most efficient! This iPad will replace my computer which is no longer reliable as it seems like it is about to die.
  • I will be in Mexico for the Holidays. A contribution towards this iPad would be the best gift of all because it will allow me to tell the artisans’ stories more efficiently.
  • I leave November 12th so there is a limited time to contribute!
  • Everyone who contributes $25 or more will receive a unique personalized GlobeIn Postcard featuring a GlobeIn artisan whose story you helped tell!

The Impact

  • GlobeIn strives to empower families and communities by promoting technology and IT literacy, facilitating global market participation, and expanding economic inclusion for small-scale businesses and rural communities.
  • With GlobeIn's platform, artisans from all over the world will be connected to the global marketplace, providing a means for artisans to sell their crafts and tell their stories online.

Other Ways You Can Help!

  • Spread the word about GlobeIn to anyone who may be interested.
  • Like GlobeIn on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/GlobeIN/
  • Purchase a unique gift for the holidays from GlobeIn.com
  • Send me your support and love, keep me in your thoughts and prayers!!

Thank you for your support!

Abrazos,

Lauren Brown

Lauren@globein.com

Lebrown7@gmail.com

story:
Your Dream are our Dreams

As many of you viewing this campaign know, at EOB CrossFit we aspire to help others set and exceed goals they never thought possible. Our intent is to help change lives through mental and physical fitness. We strive to teach people to move better through practice and to create a fun environment of constant progress. Education is a primary goal for both coaches and clients. We stay true to these core values and strive to pass them in to everyone who enters our doors:

1. Community- It is important to us that we create a place where our members feel like extended family.

2. Generosity- No one can succeed without the generosity of others. We aspire to continually be giving.

3. Humility- There is always something to learn. We can always be better.

4. Passion- We have a passion for all that we do and all that you do. Without it we are empty.

Humble Beginnings 

EOB began with one member in a home garage in 2011.  Soon a small group of otherwise unlikely friends had started to convene a few times a week to train CrossFit. The group continued to grow until the driveway of the gated community home began to be suspiciously full a few days a week. Thats when EOB leased it's 2000 sq ft beachside home. Now, 2 years later, EOB is running classes seven days a week and many times members are spilling out into the parking lot to get a workout in. 

Our amazing community deserves a facility that they can be proud of and comfortable in. A place that can support the ever growing goals and dreams of each of its members. The funds raised in this campaign will help outfit a new, larger state of the art facility.

Where will the money go?

This expansion is not just about new shiny toys. Although there will be plenty of those. Its about generosity and helping others. Part of our excitement in growing as a community and business is our increasing ability to give back. With more space and equipment comes the opportunity to house more changed lives. With more changed lives comes more income to give our trainers thier dream jobs and more opportunity for charitable giving. EOB CrossFit will continue to donate to its charity of choice, Grassroots Giving.

We want to help others, but we want to make this effort worthwhile for you as well. This gym will be YOUR home. We are designing it with you guys at heart. We invite you to visit our gear registry at Rouge Fitness to view the list of equipment you can expect to see. View our dream blueprints to see sketches and examples of the plans we have been hard at work preparing for the next chapter. 

We are planning for the next facility to be upwards of 5000 sq ft, to include much nicer amenities including showers and special areas. To give you a better idea where these funds are headed we expect flooring alone for a facility this size to cost some where around $13,000. Our bare minimum equipment shopping cart on Rogue is weighing in at $25,000. 

Equipment Registry

 

What you get

Everyone on every level deserves to be thanked. Every giver will have their name inscribed on a Thank You plaque to be hung in the gym. In addition there will be some pretty cool swag up for grabs.  Tee shirts will be limited edition, run only once and only available by supporting this campaign. Probably the most fun is the opportunity to become a part of our box permanently by having your name or even art concepts incorporated into our new decor! Claim a piece of equipment or a place on our wall as your own. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to help financially but that is not the only way you can help support us! Our members success stories have always been our most valuable asset. After all we have gotten this far on word of mouth alone. Keep it up! Please continue to tell your friends and family about Crossfit. Send them in for intros and let us show them our amazing community. And please, share this page as much as you can. Get the word out about our vision.

After all we have gotten this far on word of mouth alone. Keep it up! Please continue to tell your friends and family about Crossfit. Send them in for intros and let us show them our amazing community. And please, share this page as much as you can. Get the word out about our vision.

story:
The above video introduces LAMP community through individuals who benefited from LAMP's offerings including - but not limited to - showers and bathrooms.


Skid Row SPA

Our vision is an integrated hygiene center with toilets, showers and laundry facilities serving the un-housed population on Skid Row in Downtown Los Angeles.  We intend to model the facility on the successful Urban Rest Stop program which has been operating in Seattle since 1999.

Our desired end product is a built-out facility with paid staff, extended operating hours and an ongoing fundraising apparatus supporting a sustainable public-private partnership. We intend this to be the first of several locations, a template for development elsewhere on Skid Row and greater LA. 

Members of our Redwoods classes are supporting the setup of a 501(c)3 for the Skid Row SPA, which will enable us to collect tax-deductible donations.  We expect the setup process for a 501(c)3 to take an extended period based on IRS backlog.


LAMP Community

For those who prefer to make a financial contribution we are asking for donations to LAMP Community.  LAMP Community's mission is to end homelessness of Los Angeles' most vulnerable individuals, primarily adults with mental illness, through a continuum of services and housing, enabling them to reach their highest level of self-sufficiency and community integration.  

In addition to its shelter, case management and housing assistance programs, LAMP operates a public shower, bathroom and laundry facility on Skid Row.  In the year ended June 30, 2014 the organization provided over 20,000 showers and hygiene kits to area residents! Demand exceeds supply, which is determined by how many hours per day the facility is able to be staffed to stay open.  The cost of operating the shower/bathroom/laundry is approximately $1,400 per day.  

Our goal is to raise the equivalent of 5 business days of operation.

Funds raised will directly support LAMP's shower/bathroom/laundry program and are 100% tax deductible.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please see the emails from Michael and Dan for ways you can help besides this financial donation.  

Asking friends, relatives, facebook contacts, people in the grocery store line (if you are so inclined!) to donate is also highly encouraged.

story:
Hello my name is Emiliano Rivera. I was diagnosed with psychosis and clinical depression last May. I am reaching out to find help in starting a farm where people with depression and psychosis can work the land as a form of therapy. Unfortunately, I have found that all support in terms of activities for people with my condition are in the city. The city is one big stresser. The plan is to begin this June with the help of two teachers of agriculture from UBC and if all goes well the farm will be self-sustaining after the first three months. We already found the farm :

 http://abbotsford.craigslist.ca/apa/5299248703....

The farm we found comes with a house where workshops such as wine making, bee keeping and herbal medicinal. 

We are looking to raise 20,000 dollars:

9,000 dollars (3,000) monthly rent until the farm becomes self sustained
5,000 dollars for infrastructure

2,000 dollars for animals (chickens and bees)

4,000 dollars safety net

All of our donors will receive a tshirt and will be welcomed to work on the farm anytime. We will also make a big dinner to celebrate reaching our goal this summer with food and produce from the farm.

story:
Everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression; this right includes freedom to hold opinions without interference and to seek, receive and impart information and ideas through any media and regardless of frontiers.

-The Universal Declaration of Human Rights, Article 19

Imagine your life without the internet. Imagine someone else arbitrarily deciding what you could and couldn’t see or risking jail and worse for accessing Twitter, Facebook, YouTube or Google. That’s how 1.6B people live every day. With your help, we can change that right now.

Meet Lantern, a new internet censorship circumvention tool being built on advanced peer-to-peer (P2P) technology.  We’re a small team of hackers, artists, writers and social entrepreneurs led by the former chief architect of Limewire, Adam Fisk. We love the internet and believe in the fundamental power of a community of people coming together for the greater good. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 70K to match a large grant that funds our server, development and outreach costs. We rely on grants and donations of both money and time to build and translate Lantern. To ensure that users have access even if they do not have peers, we maintain a global infrastructure of servers. We need your help to continue to provide access to users in censored countries and to expand the network even further.

We've created a bunch of great perks to thank you for joining the Lantern movement. From specially designed Lantern stickers, t-shirts and flashlights to your own server through our "Adopt a Server" program and one of a kind Raspberry Pi's.  

The Impact

Lantern is a user-centered project from code to communications. We are open source, relying on contributions from an international team of developers and translators. 

By running Lantern, every user with access to the uncensored internet can become a gateway to the open internet for those in censored regions. With your donation, you join a  global movement of people working together to defeat internet censorship.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help: 

    • Do you code? Check out our GitHub to help 
    • Translate? Join our Transifex project
    • Sign up for the next Lantern release at www.getlantern.org
    • Spread the word - email, post, tweet and share the Lantern movement!


    Blocked Sites from Around the World

    Iran


    Thailand


    Yemen

story:
A Library in the Heart of Lee County

I'm Lydia Crowe, and I grew up in the country outside of Donnellson, a small town locally known as "the heart of Lee County, Iowa." It's a special place, and it's still close to my heart. Some people might think a rural community would be a dull place to grow up, but I have many happy memories of playing outside on the farm, hiking through the woods, and -- most of all -- going to the library.  

Why is a library so important to a rural community? All public libraries serve their communities in many ways, but rural libraries are especially busy because they're often one of the only public spaces in town. It's a place to check out books, but it's also a community center. It's a venue for local events and exhibitions, a safe and fun location for children and young adults to hang out after school, and a place where adults can socialize, get technology help, and participate in educational events. Best of all, it's free!

The Donnellson Public Library does all that and more. It's classified as a size B library, one that serves a population of less than 1,000. Of the 124 size B libraries in Iowa, the Donnellson Public Library ranks:

  • #1 in hours open 
  • #1 in adult circulations per capita
  • #4 in overall circulations per capita
  • #7 in young adult circulations per capita
It's plain to see that this community values its library! But nevertheless, the library's hurting. The building has inadequate space for all the people it serves -- and worse than that, it is literally falling apart. There are no other suitable buildings in Donnellson that the library could move into. That's why we're raising the funds to build a new library. 

What We Need

  • The new building will cost approximately $980,000. More than $200,000 has already been raised!
  • We are trying to raise $15,000 to contribute to the campaign.
  • Matching government grants are available to help push the library's building fund to its final goal.
  • If we don't meet our goal, the library will still receive the funds -- but the project may be delayed.

The Difference You'll Make in Donnellson

Here's what you're paying for when you contribute to our building fund:

  • Expanded Space for Books -- The library has to give away hundreds of books a year because there just isn't space for them. We'd all love a bigger selection, right?
  • Expanded Seating -- I know it's a small town, but two comfy chairs just isn't enough for a community of avid readers!
  • Increased Accessibility for Disabled Patrons -- Due to the settling and crumbling foundation, the current library's handicapped entrance is in disrepair and is not ADA compliant. The new library will be accessible to all patrons.
  • Community Space -- You won't have to be packed elbow-to-elbow anymore when you attend one of the many community events this library offers.
  • Energy Efficiency -- Geothermal energy, skylights, and windows will all reduce heating, cooling, and lighting costs in the new building. 
  • Technology -- More public computers and e-readers will mean a shorter waiting list to use them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute money, you can still help!

  • Spread the word!
  • Share our campaign with your friends on Facebook and Twitter!
  • Share your time! Contact Brenda Knox, library director, for information about volunteer opportunities.

story:
Colorado Rhythmics Gymnastics is a very small team that needs some help sending 12 year old Abby, 11 year old Loren and 9 year old Arianna to Seattle to attend the Seattle Cup Rhythmic Gymnastics meet( http://www.seattlerhythmic.com/seattle-cup-2015/).  It will be the second meet for Abby and the first for Loren and Arianna.  Our team is has been around for 5 years and our coach has been coaching for more than 20 years, here and in Ukraine.  Check out our website http://www.coloradorhythmics.com/ for more information.

Our girls are very excited to go, but unless we raise the money we need we will have to cancel our trip and wait until next year while we try to raise funds.  There is only one  Colorado meet as Rhythmic Gymnastics is a new (but growing) sport, and only one of our competitive team girls qualify to go, Isabella, because she is a Level 7.  The Colorado meet is an International meet and only Level 7 and above are allowed to compete there. 

We hope by competing in Seattle and hopefully being successful we will help to raise awareness of our beautiful sport in Colorado.  We believe it is the sport of the future for girls, teaching grace, balance, hand eye coordination and flexibility.  It is very different than "regular" or Artistic gymnastics-the one with the beam, bars and vault.

 For each  donation we will send you an picture postcard of our travel team girls thanking you for your donation with results from the Seattle meet.  For $20 or more donation you will receive a certificate for 3 hour class working out with the team or a COR t-shirt. 

COR kids want to thank you for taking the time to check out our story.  We know not everyone can give money.  Please pass our message on. Instagram about us, Tweet our message out, share us on Facebook and use the Indiegogo share tools.  

Look for our meet results on our website in January.
