story:
Introduction

EEB is a renewable biofuel made from sewage treatment biosolids and other organic waste materials. This biofuel can power a vehicle, blend with gasoline and diesel, or produce clean electricity!

Updated: Media Coverage

Vitruvian Energy and EEB have been covered in the following places:

Navigate Our Campaign

EEB in a Nutshell
Using Organic Waste For Energy
Community-Powered Energy
From Fossil Fuels To Renewables
The Missing Piece of the Climate Change Puzzle
Help Our Campaign, Get Some Swag
Why We Can Do It
What We Will Do With Your Contributions
The Company Behind the Biofuel
Change the World
Frequently Asked Questions
Acknowledgments

EEB in a Nutshell

Using Organic Waste For Energy!

EEB is made from organic waste materials that are currently under-utilized as a potential source of renewable energy, including:
◆  sewage treatment biosolids
◆  agricultural by-products such as corn stover (corn stalks) and rice straw
◆  animal waste from ranches and dairies

We have chosen to focus on making EEB first from biosolids, which is the leftover, dirt-like organic material that remains after a community's wastewater is treated.

Sewage treatment plants must currently pay to dispose of these "waste" biosolids, but when used as the basis for our EEB biofuel, they can be a valuable energy source.

Biosolids create an amazing opportunity for renewable energy that is very cost-effective!

Developing the EEB process using biosolids will set the stage for us to make EEB from all other organic waste materials.

Combined, these organic waste sources can reduce our reliance on fossil fuels and dramatically lower our carbon footprint.

The potential EEB production from organic waste could generate enough energy to make the United States a net energy exporter!

(back to top)

Community-Powered Energy

By using biosolids as an energy source, every community already has the starting material to produce clean, affordable, renewable energy.

When communities generate their own energy from the organic waste sources all around them, they become more energy independent and create sustainable, family-wage jobs.

Energy is made where energy is used, and community self-reliance is the result!

EEB enables distributed energy generation at the community level. Then, when enough communities come together to create their own energy, entire countries can develop an amazing array of energy generation centers.

(back to top)

From Fossil Fuels To Renewables

EEB is an ideal energy source to help us transition from a fossil fuel economy to a sustainable energy economy. It's carbon footprint is lower than fossil fuels by 70%.

We can integrate EEB with our existing energy infrastructure by blending it with gasoline and diesel in existing engines.

EEB blends up to 20% with gasoline and diesel

EEB also has the potential to power an internal combustion engine on its own!

In addition, our research shows that blending EEB with diesel results in a significant soot reduction in diesel truck exhaust.

EEB reduces soot by acting as an oxygenate for diesel, like ethanol does for gasoline

We have extensively modeled the cost of EEB at the commercial scale and found that it can be produced for less than $4 per gallon, without subsidies.

Because EEB can be burned cleanly, it can also produce renewable electricity for our energy grid.

(back to top)

The Missing Piece of the Climate Change Puzzle

There is no one perfect solution for battling climate change. We need to use all the tools at our disposal to replace the energy we currently generate from fossil fuels.

Climate change is a complex problem that requires integrated solutions. EEB complements other types of renewable energy, such as solar and wind, by producing energy 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

(back to top)

Help Our Campaign, Get Some Swag

Not only do you get to feel good about supporting community-sourced renewable energy, you can also get some cool perks!

Your car will thank you for getting it a couple of these sweet bumper stickers:

We'll be pouring you a metaphorical drink for helping us, but you can pour a real one for yourself with one of these fancy mugs.

Now that you're going to save the world you can stop wearing your hero costume underneath your clothes, and put it in this great tote bag instead.

You and one of these t-shirts might look pretty great strutting around town.

Check out our other perks on the right side of the page!

(back to top)

Why We Can Do It

The idea behind this technology was hatched in 2007. At the time, Zack was working with Dr. James Smoot and they were writing grants to try to get all sorts of creative clean energy ideas funded. That’s when the California Energy Commission decided to risk a small amount of money in the form of a 12 month grant to see if their EEB idea could be anything of interest. After that grant ended, the National Science foundation funded another 12 months of research and EEB came to life. Years of research and development finally culminated in successfully running EEB in a Pontiac Solstice at Oak Ridge National Laboratory.

In 2013, Zack moved back to Seattle after his wife's naturopathic residency in Indiana, and began searching for ways to move the EEB technology out of the garage and into a real lab space here in Seattle. He met Todd, who was restarting his startup career after several years of caring for his special needs son. Both of us are passionate about creating an environmentally and socially conscious company, and our backgrounds give us a great mix of engineering, marketing, and business skills.

We have talked with people in the wastewater treatment industry and learned that they are interested in producing EEB at their sewage treatment plants ... but first, we have to prove that we can scale up EEB production in our own laboratory, in real-world conditions. That's where you come in!

(back to top)

What We Will Do With Your Contributions

This Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign will allow us to build a pilot EEB production facility where we can make larger quantities of biofuel to power a test vehicle, and demonstrate the economic and technical value of EEB.

In addition to the lab space itself, we will purchase all the necessary tanks, pumps, and processing equipment to successfully scale up this technology.

The biggest cost of this project is a chemical reactor, which will be about $50k, for the final step in the production process. We will also work with a diesel mechanic to evaluate the effects of running EEB in our vehicle during the year. This includes looking at gasket wear and fuel mileage throughout city and highway driving.

We've got our eye on a few lab locations in Seattle so as soon as we finish this campaign we can move in and get started. We hope you'll come visit!

(back to top)

The Company Behind the Biofuel

Todd and Zack created Vitruvian Energy not just to create awesome biofuel technologies, but to create a company with a conscience. Our company is named after the Vitruvian Man drawing by Leonardo da Vinci, which reflects our desire to balance science, nature, and humanity's impact on the world.

Vitruvian Energy is a licensed Social Purpose Corporation which means we have the ability to put people and the environment ahead of profits. We are focused on using EEB to bring good jobs and clean energy to every community.

Even though we are just getting started, we also have our eyes set on becoming a certified B Corporation. The B-Corp certification involves a rigorous application and review process by an impartial third-party organization, to ensure that a company is making a positive social and environmental impact in their business practices. Once we are selling EEB fuel and related services, we will be eligible to pursue this certification.

You can read more about Social Purpose Corporations and B Corporations in our FAQ below.

(back to top)

Change the World

We are trying to bring to the world a revolutionary biofuel that no one has ever produced before. Call it waste to energy, call it energy recycling, or call it poopaline, no matter what you call it, we think it’s a very cool idea.

This technology may be starting in the US, but we have our sights set on something much bigger. In addition to the many environmental and community benefits of EEB, our biofuel has the ability to bring energy and wastewater treatment to many rural areas around the world.

Many countries lack sufficient wastewater treatment facilities because they are expensive to set up and require significant infrastructure in place to operate. Building wastewater treatment plants that produce EEB from their biosolids creates affordable energy for the developing nation, and subsidizes the energy costs of wastewater treatment.

Ultimately, we are working to develop a technology that will change the relationship people have with the way they produce and consume energy. This technology will bridge the gap between small scale energy production (i.e. someone installing solar panels on their house) and huge energy production (i.e. mega refineries in oil countries) by enabling communities to invest in clean energy, lower their carbon footprint, and control their energy future.

(back to top)

Frequently Asked Questions

Q:  Why crowdfunding?

A:  We are choosing to do crowdfunding as our first phase of fundraising because we want to partner with communities to maintain control over how the technology is rolled out and not have to sell this technology to the highest bidder. When we raise the money from people and communities who are concerned about the environment, then they become our funders and we are beholden to them. When communities begin demanding technologies such as ours then companies and cities will start to develop them and bring them to life through continued support. It is by creating a great relationship with our community that we are able to be a better Social Purpose Corporation and ensure what we do benefits the communities and world around us.

Q:  What does EEB stand for?

A:  The letters E.E.B. stand for "ethyl-3-ethoxybutyrate", the chemical name for this renewable biofuel.

Q:  What is a Social Purpose Corporation?

A:  We are registered in Washington State as a for-profit Social Purpose Corporation. This is a special type of company that is exactly as it sounds -- a company that follows a social purpose. We are legally able to make decisions based on things other than profit margins, such as benefits to the community and environmental impacts. This is done by embedding special language in our by-laws, ensuring that we stay committed to acting in the best interest of our employees, our community, and the planet. (More information on Social Purpose Corporations can be found at www.spcwa.com)

Q:  What is a B Corporation?

A:  A certified B Corporation is a voluntary certification, rather than a legal structure such as the Social Purpose Corporation. B-Corp certification is obtained from B Lab, the nonprofit that developed benefit corporation legislation and that oversees the certification process for over 1000 B Corporations, which includes key language in corporate organizing documents. Periodic assessments by B Lab are performed and the company must publish the results of this assessment. B-Corp certification is considered by many to be the highest standard for a social enterprise and is an excellent way to ensure a holistic approach to triple-bottom-line impact. (More information about B Corporations can be found at www.bcorporation.net)

Q:  How I can get involved with EEB?

A:  Right now we are just 2 guys with a great biofuel technology, and big ideas for how it can change the world. We are interested in meeting other people who are passionate about sustainability and community empowerment. As we continue development we'll need all kinds of people to keep it going, from Microbiologists to Engineers, from Graphic Artists to Community Organizers. If you have any interest in coming along for the ride, please contact us!

(back to top)

Acknowledgments

Zack and Todd would like to thank the following people and organizations, for making this Indiegogo campaign possible:

Josh Long - video

Tristan Efremenko, Audio Network - audio

Roxana Paleologu - website design

Sean Kinney - accounting

Dr. James Smoot - co-inventor of EEB

If you've made it this far down the list then you should get an award just for that! But we would like to remind you that – even if you can't help us by financially supporting this campaign – you can still help us out by spreading the word about this great biofuel. We hope that this project will help keep people talking about how crucial it is for all of us to deal with climate change and strengthen our communities. Thanks!!

(back to top)
story_txt:
Introduction

EEB is a renewable biofuel made from sewage treatment biosolids and other organic waste materials.  This biofuel can power a vehicle, blend with gasoline and diesel, or produce clean electricity!

Updated: Media Coverage

Vitruvian Energy and EEB have been covered in the following places:







































































Navigate Our Campaign




EEB in a Nutshell





Using Organic Waste For Energy





Community-Powered Energy





From Fossil Fuels To Renewables





The Missing Piece of the Climate Change Puzzle











Help Our Campaign, Get Some Swag





Why We Can Do It





What We Will Do With Your Contributions





The Company Behind the Biofuel











Change the World





Frequently Asked Questions





Acknowledgments







EEB in a Nutshell





Using Organic Waste For Energy!

EEB is made from organic waste materials that are currently under-utilized as a potential source of renewable energy, including:
◆  sewage treatment biosolids
◆  agricultural by-products such as corn stover (corn stalks) and rice straw
◆  animal waste from ranches and dairies

We have chosen to focus on making EEB first from biosolids, which is the leftover, dirt-like organic material that remains after a community's wastewater is treated.
Sewage treatment plants must currently pay to dispose of these "waste" biosolids, but when used as the basis for our EEB biofuel, they can be a valuable energy source.


Biosolids create an amazing opportunity for renewable energy that is very cost-effective!

Developing the EEB process using biosolids will set the stage for us to make EEB from all other organic waste materials.
Combined, these organic waste sources can reduce our reliance on fossil fuels and dramatically lower our carbon footprint.



The potential EEB production from organic waste could generate enough energy to make the United States a net energy exporter!

(back to top)



Community-Powered Energy

By using biosolids as an energy source, every community already has the starting material to produce clean, affordable, renewable energy.




When communities generate their own energy from the organic waste sources all around them, they become more energy independent and create sustainable, family-wage jobs.
Energy is made where energy is used, and community self-reliance is the result!




EEB enables distributed energy generation at the community level.  Then, when enough communities come together to create their own energy, entire countries can develop an amazing array of energy generation centers.

(back to top)



From Fossil Fuels To Renewables

EEB is an ideal energy source to help us transition from a fossil fuel economy to a sustainable energy economy. It's carbon footprint is lower than fossil fuels by 70%.
We can integrate EEB with our existing energy infrastructure by blending it with gasoline and diesel in existing engines.



EEB blends up to 20% with gasoline and diesel

EEB also has the potential to power an internal combustion engine on its own!
In addition, our research shows that blending EEB with diesel results in a significant soot reduction in diesel truck exhaust.



EEB reduces soot by acting as an oxygenate for diesel, like ethanol does for gasoline

We have extensively modeled the cost of EEB at the commercial scale and found that it can be produced for less than $4 per gallon, without subsidies.
Because EEB can be burned cleanly, it can also produce renewable electricity for our energy grid.

(back to top)



The Missing Piece of the Climate Change Puzzle

There is no one perfect solution for battling climate change. We need to use all the tools at our disposal to replace the energy we currently generate from fossil fuels.



Climate change is a complex problem that requires integrated solutions. EEB complements other types of renewable energy, such as solar and wind, by producing energy 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

(back to top)



Help Our Campaign, Get Some Swag

Not only do you get to feel good about supporting community-sourced renewable energy, you can also get some cool perks!











Your car will thank you for getting it a couple of these sweet bumper stickers:


















We'll be pouring you a metaphorical drink for helping us, but you can pour a real one for yourself with one of these fancy mugs.















Now that you're going to save the world you can stop wearing your hero costume underneath your clothes, and put it in this great tote bag instead.













You and one of these t-shirts might look pretty great strutting around town.





























Check out our other perks on the right side of the page!

(back to top)



Why We Can Do It

The idea behind this technology was hatched in 2007.  At the time, Zack was working with Dr. James Smoot and they were writing grants to try to get all sorts of creative clean energy ideas funded.  That’s when the California Energy Commission decided to risk a small amount of money in the form of a 12 month grant to see if their EEB idea could be anything of interest.  After that grant ended, the National Science foundation funded another 12 months of research and EEB came to life. Years of research and development finally culminated in successfully running EEB in a Pontiac Solstice at Oak Ridge National Laboratory.


In 2013, Zack moved back to Seattle after his wife's naturopathic residency in Indiana, and began searching for ways to move the EEB technology out of the garage and into a real lab space here in Seattle.  He met Todd, who was restarting his startup career after several years of caring for his special needs son.  Both of us are passionate about creating an environmentally and socially conscious company, and our backgrounds give us a great mix of engineering, marketing, and business skills.
We have talked with people in the wastewater treatment industry and learned that they are interested in producing EEB at their sewage treatment plants ... but first, we have to prove that we can scale up EEB production in our own laboratory, in real-world conditions.  That's where you come in!


(back to top)



What We Will Do With Your Contributions

This Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign will allow us to build a pilot EEB production facility where we can make larger quantities of biofuel to power a test vehicle, and demonstrate the economic and technical value of EEB.
In addition to the lab space itself, we will purchase all the necessary tanks, pumps, and processing equipment to successfully scale up this technology.
The biggest cost of this project is a chemical reactor, which will be about $50k, for the final step in the production process. We will also work with a diesel mechanic to evaluate the effects of running EEB in our vehicle during the year. This includes looking at gasket wear and fuel mileage throughout city and highway driving.
We've got our eye on a few lab locations in Seattle so as soon as we finish this campaign we can move in and get started. We hope you'll come visit!


(back to top)



The Company Behind the Biofuel

Todd and Zack created Vitruvian Energy not just to create awesome biofuel technologies, but to create a company with a conscience. Our company is named after the Vitruvian Man drawing by Leonardo da Vinci, which reflects our desire to balance science, nature, and humanity's impact on the world.
Vitruvian Energy is a licensed Social Purpose Corporation which means we have the ability to put people and the environment ahead of profits. We are focused on using EEB to bring good jobs and clean energy to every community.



Even though we are just getting started, we also have our eyes set on becoming a certified B Corporation. The B-Corp certification involves a rigorous application and review process by an impartial third-party organization, to ensure that a company is making a positive social and environmental impact in their business practices. Once we are selling EEB fuel and related services, we will be eligible to pursue this certification.
You can read more about Social Purpose Corporations and B Corporations in our FAQ below.

(back to top)



Change the World

We are trying to bring to the world a revolutionary biofuel that no one has ever produced before. Call it waste to energy, call it energy recycling, or call it poopaline, no matter what you call it, we think it’s a very cool idea.
This technology may be starting in the US, but we have our sights set on something much bigger. In addition to the many environmental and community benefits of EEB, our biofuel has the ability to bring energy and wastewater treatment to many rural areas around the world.
Many countries lack sufficient wastewater treatment facilities because they are expensive to set up and require significant infrastructure in place to operate.  Building wastewater treatment plants that produce EEB from their biosolids creates affordable energy for the developing nation, and subsidizes the energy costs of wastewater treatment.

Ultimately, we are working to develop a technology that will change the relationship people have with the way they produce and consume energy. This technology will bridge the gap between small scale energy production (i.e. someone installing solar panels on their house) and huge energy production (i.e. mega refineries in oil countries) by enabling communities to invest in clean energy, lower their carbon footprint, and control their energy future.

(back to top)



Frequently Asked Questions

Q:  Why crowdfunding?
A:  We are choosing to do crowdfunding as our first phase of fundraising because we want to partner with communities to maintain control over how the technology is rolled out and not have to sell this technology to the highest bidder. When we raise the money from people and communities who are concerned about the environment, then they become our funders and we are beholden to them. When communities begin demanding technologies such as ours then companies and cities will start to develop them and bring them to life through continued support. It is by creating a great relationship with our community that we are able to be a better Social Purpose Corporation and ensure what we do benefits the communities and world around us.

Q:  What does EEB stand for?
A:  The letters E.E.B. stand for "ethyl-3-ethoxybutyrate", the chemical name for this renewable biofuel.

Q:  What is a Social Purpose Corporation?
A:  We are registered in Washington State as a for-profit Social Purpose Corporation. This is a special type of company that is exactly as it sounds -- a company that follows a social purpose. We are legally able to make decisions based on things other than profit margins, such as benefits to the community and environmental impacts. This is done by embedding special language in our by-laws, ensuring that we stay committed to acting in the best interest of our employees, our community, and the planet. (More information on Social Purpose Corporations can be found at www.spcwa.com)

Q:  What is a B Corporation?
A:  A certified B Corporation is a voluntary certification, rather than a legal structure such as the Social Purpose Corporation.  B-Corp certification is obtained from B Lab, the nonprofit that developed benefit corporation legislation and that oversees the certification process for over 1000 B Corporations, which includes key language in corporate organizing documents. Periodic assessments by B Lab are performed and the company must publish the results of this assessment. B-Corp certification is considered by many to be the highest standard for a social enterprise and is an excellent way to ensure a holistic approach to triple-bottom-line impact. (More information about B Corporations can be found at www.bcorporation.net)

Q:  How I can get involved with EEB?
A:  Right now we are just 2 guys with a great biofuel technology, and big ideas for how it can change the world. We are interested in meeting other people who are passionate about sustainability and community empowerment. As we continue development we'll need all kinds of people to keep it going, from Microbiologists to Engineers, from Graphic Artists to Community Organizers. If you have any interest in coming along for the ride, please contact us!

(back to top)



Acknowledgments

Zack and Todd would like to thank the following people and organizations, for making this Indiegogo campaign possible:

Josh Long - video
Tristan Efremenko, Audio Network - audio
Roxana Paleologu - website design
Sean Kinney - accounting
Dr. James Smoot - co-inventor of EEB

If you've made it this far down the list then you should get an award just for that! But we would like to remind you that – even if you can't help us by financially supporting this campaign – you can still help us out by spreading the word about this great biofuel. We hope that this project will help keep people talking about how crucial it is for all of us to deal with climate change and strengthen our communities. Thanks!!

(back to top)

story:
Hi there, my name is Jeff Harris and I am a young business owner with a background in natural food and living. 

I currently work at a Portland natural food market stacking apples, and chopping celery four days a week, ALONG with running my own business Aumbites. In my free time I enjoy yoga, hiking, dancing, cooking and spending time with my partner and friends. 

My campaign "Aumbites Expansion" has been created to spread awareness of my product and health-full living. The Aumbite paleo cookie is looking for a chance to please palettes beyond Portland Oregon! The money raised in this campaign is going to help me invest in the necessary machinery to get my cookie production levels up to a point where they could supply a higher volume and ultimately create a fruitful living for myself. 

Contributors to this campaign will assist me in lifting my business to the next level, helping me achieve a life goal and continuing to do the work I love and am passionate about! 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $20,000 in the coming two months. This money will be used for:  a down payment on a cookie depositer. These machines can create a sheet of cookies in 15 seconds. They cost anywhere from 15K to 30K depending on size, quality, etc. I am also looking to buy a used fuel efficient vehicle to make deliveries in town and beyond. I would use about 5K on a down payment for the vehicle. I will also be using 15%-20% of the funds raised to spread awareness of the physical cookie via the campaign perks. These costs are from the manufacturing and shipping of the product. I want to get the Aumbite to people's mouths! Everyone deserves to try and be able to purchase this healthy product in their hometown. This is what my vision is all about. 

My perks include plenty of delicious cookies and hazelnut butters plus personalized thank you cards. 

If I do not reach my goal, my raised money will still go towards a cookie depositer  and a vehicle and spreading awareness of the cookie. 

The Impact

My business supports and exemplifies healthy food, natural living and treats. By eliminating processed and artificial foods out of our diet we are helping heal the earth, the people and the local sustainable economy. Supporting my business is saying yes to organic/non-gmo foods,  paleo foods, natural living, high vibration and deliciousness.  

Challenges

Running your own business is no joke, and I have only seen the beginning. I am committed to the work and challenges ahead of me. I know it won't be easy, however I desire to create and work for myself and for something I believe in. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate the $10 minimum but really want to try the cookies, please send me an email at aumbites@gmail.com and we will work something out. I want everyone to have a chance to try my product.

Please share this campaign with co-workers,  friends, family and beyond. I want to get the message out far and wide!

story:
MY DREAM

Hello my name is Oxford Nordberg and I have a dream of being self employed.  I am tired of waking up every morning going to a place I hate being around people I don't want to be around and taking orders from someone I don't respect.  I bet most of you reading this understand where I am coming from.  I bet a lot of you feel the same way.  If this is the case and you feel my pain, do me a favor, please.  Stop being selfish and donate today.  Help someone that loves his family and wants to provide a better life for them.  Help someone that is willing to get out of his comfort zone and try something different.  Time is running out and I am getting low on funds to take care of my family.  Let me ask you something, Honestly, what is $10 to you?  I bet you spend $10 like it's nothing and all of what?  If I can get 1,500 unselfish people to donate just $10 I can provide for my family and show my five children that if you truly want something bad enough it CAN happen.  I want them to see that if you ask for something someone, somewhere will be more than happy to assist you in achieving your dreams.  
After you donate go to the Facebook page and the company website and begin to follow me.  Watch what your $10 is going for.  Watch how you turned a dream into reality.  Watch how your donation has changed the life of seven people.  
One last thing, after you donate please go out and get one or two of your friends and tell them to put $10 of their hard earned money to good use.  Together we can show the world that banning together we all can achieve something beautiful.
This is what is needed: $15,000 and what it will be used for:
$7,500 - Down Payment to current Owner (Balance will be paid over 2 yr)
$3,300 - Lease and Deposit
$3,500 - Restock Shelves
$700 - Cash On Hand

PLEASE DONATE AND SPREAD THE WORD TODAY!
Any questions are concerns please feel free to email me at any time:  nordbergscstore@gmail.com

story:
Bayou City Lawn Service

My name is Kyle Williams. I am seeking funding to start a small business here in Houston. With 5 years experience working for larger landscaping companies I am ready to set out on my own. One of my main focuses with this business will be to provide jobs for veterans and their families. As a veteran myself I feel I can help with the transition from military life to the civilian workforce.

What We Need

We are trying to raise $15,000
$3,988 for our website and initial marketing.
$5,238 for equipment costs.
$5,684 in operating cash and initial start up expenses.

story:
Hello

First and foremost, I want to thank you for visiting our little project page. My name is Jamie Ocean. On the first picture there, i'm the one to the right. Standing with me is Kawa Cheong, and we are the founding members of Sportsmode. 

As you can see I used to be overweight. Though it may not show, but in those bottom two pictures was close to 250 pounds. Before you think i'm advertising some sort of weight loss program, or some sort of diet shill, I'm not. I'm not here to preach to you the benefits of exercise, or the need to drive down the obesity epidemic. No. Both Kawa and I still believe that this is the United States, and this is an awesome country devoted to protecting personal freedoms. Weight like anything else is a personal choice. There is no reason for you to feel bad about your self image. 
What we are promoting, is a way to become more active. I used to live a very sedentary lifestyle. I'm an artist, so i mostly paint, smoke, drink, and sleep; i would eat, but it wasn't a necessity. This routine got boring for me. I wanted to do more with my time than satisfy that artistic itch on the back of my shoulder. I wanted to go play flag football, soccer, and dunk a basketball. So I signed up for a gym membership to get into shape, but often times i found going there uncomfortable and slightly alienating. Seeing all those fit people there lifting weights was rather intimidating for me. I wanted to lift weights and do that kind of stuff, but no one i knew was really interested in that sort of thing. 
At this point I was ready to quit. I wasn't seeing too much results, and trying to form a habit out of exercising became less and less attractive. It wasn't until Kawa came to visit me during spring break in 2012 that i really started enjoying exercise. He showed me some basic things to do, and places where i can find more information. But mostly, adding a social aspect to this endeavor made it a lot easier to bear. 
That's why we thought there has to be a better way of broaching the fitness world. To us, sports and fitness is inherently a social activity, and creating a communal atmosphere would help make it easier for folks to start becoming more active. More importantly for those who want to stay more active, it's usually those around them that keeps them going.

That's why we created Sportsmode

We want to build an online community dedicated to physical activeness, and we want to reward people for participating in both this community and in being more active. There are two sides of our project: one side focuses on bringing that sense of belonging for people like me who want to start exercising;the other is a rewards program that gives people free stuff for participating. Having people to support you while you exercise while getting freebies... who can say no?

Facts:

  • CDC report 2013: 80% of Americans are considered physically inactive.
  • 4/5 gym memberships becomes inactive within the first three months of the year.
  • It's clear that people stop exercising from a lack of community, not a lack of motivation.

Functions:

  • Search for group exercise events near you (basketball game needing a member, tennis player needing a sparring partner, etc) or personal coaches looking for trainees
  • Seek individuals with similar fitness interests
  • Chat with friends or people you've found
  • Post questions and  answers to an online chat forum for any topics related to sports and fitness
  • A unique points and reward system which offers real incentives for exercising.

Unique Rewards System:

  • Points will be rewarded for utilizing the different aspects of Sportsmode
  • Every action counts: Exercise, Events, Meet New Friends, Building a Community 
  • It is a Free Application and You do not Pay!
  • Better yet, you get things for free for living healthy!

Funding and Development:

  • Help us to raise $9000. 
  • All funds go to our Full-Time and experienced Developers in the next 6-8 weeks and gifts for you

Tell all Everyone!

  • If you enjoy our idea, spread the message!
  • Tell us what you think! We want to build the best exercise experience out there for everyone!
  • Support us on Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter, and iStart@Duke

story:
WTF is PodShare? 

We're a co-living space. 10 pods in a communal loft. We rent beds overnight for travelers. Your pod is your own personal space, and we share everything else. 

Our building has a new owner who won't renew our lease as a co-living space. Consequently, we have to tear down the pods on Jan 1st and relocate in 2015.

At its core, PodShare is more than beds rented by the night. PodShare is social travel, shared resources and experiences. 

After 3 years and over 4,000 podestrians at our Hollywood location, the pods have to come down on January 1, 2015. We're looking for a new home. 

PodShare was built by travelers, and together we can continue to grow. We’re seeking funds for materials, labor, and startup costs for the next location. 

Anything you can contribute whether it's $1, $10, or $1000 is greatly appreciated. By tossing a dollar into the hat, you're saying you support affordable, social travel.

We're inviting you to come stay with us at a discounted rate. Prepay for a pod, and sleep in the bed you helped build. =]

Come see why people love us on Yelp, we're ranked #1 on Tripadvisor, and LA Weekly thinks we're the "Best Place to Crash" in Los Angeles. 

  • Our numbers speak for themselves: 92% occupancy, 14% return rate, over 4000 podestrians.    
  • We’re the only hospitality brand to profile every guest, and we’ll be the first to offer membership based housing.
  • The vision is a network of co-living/co-working spaces across the country, so you have a home away from home wherever you go.

Short term stay, permanent impact.

How many travel brands can say 14 people have gotten tattoos of their logo?

It seems crazy to us too! The truth is the pods are something special, and our community is radically inclusive. Don’t take our word for it. Check out what other people are saying.



These aren't your parents' bunk beds.

As an early adopter of Airbnb, Elvina loved hosting, but never got to know the guests who rented her apartment.

Partly inspired by the slumber parties her mother never let her have, the idea for PodShare came to her in the shower.

Determined to create the ultimate co-living space, Elvina called her dad and together they built the pods. 

Pods are the bunk beds of the future. The custom design combats three problems with traditional bunk beds: the annoying ladder, the rickety frame, and the lack of storage space.

The pods are open and facing each other, eliminating barriers to interactions and creating opportunities to connect with other guests. 

Each pod is 60 in x 90 in and 5 feet high, and has all the amenities you'd want in a hotel room. 

  • Flatscreen television with Roku (Netflix, Hulu, Pandora for movies, tv, music)
  • Adjustable reading light.
  • Personal outlets for charging electronics.
  • Mini closet for suitcases, towels, and clothing.
  • Access to our community kitchen, bathroom, and lobby.
  • Complimentary food, toiletries, wifi, computers, and Xbox.

We are sons and daughters of the share economy.

Podestrians come from all over the world. Most are solo travelers, visiting Hollywood, searching for a new apartment or temporarily working on a production. 

  • 87% solo travelers
  • 82% international guests
  • 49/51 female to male ratio
  • average length of stay - 2 to 3 nights.
  • average age - 23-35

One thing they all have in common is they love to share. 

What makes PodShare different?

Social transparency. PodShare hosts safe, sane, and social travelers. 

  • With a small location of 10-20 beds, staff living on site, and an emphasis on inclusion, PodShare feels like a sharing space with friends.
  • We profile each guest – creating a virtual time capsule for podestrians to remember their stay. 
  • Our goal is membership-based housing. Each podestrian receives a unique number which  provides discounts and exclusive perks.

Sooo, why are we f*cking the man?

Good question. With five stars on Yelp, great statistics, and a committed community… the million dollar question is “Why are you closing in 2015?”

The short story: our building has a new landlord and our lease is expiring. PodShare simply doesn’t fit in the new owner’s long-term vision for his property.

It wasn’t easy telling people that we’re closing. And, quite often the response we heard was “f*ck it, let’s build a new one.” So, we ran with it.

Let’s build a new PodShare , and another after that, and another after that. PodShare has never been about a particular building anyhow; it’s about shared experiences with new friends.

Finding a new home in 2015.

We’re already in talks with landlords, brokers, and potential partners about our next location in Los Angeles. We need your help to build the pods once we secure the space! (More info about the where and when soon.)

FAQs and technical stuff.

To keep it “on the real”: opening new locations is hard work. There’s logistics, paperwork, city approvals… and we’re working on it. We’re confident that PodShare will have a new Los Angeles home in 2015.

Here are some anticipated questions:

Where is my money going?

Funds collected through Indiegogo will build the next iteration of pods. This includes building materials, contractors, city fees, etc.

If the amount raised surpasses our buildout cost, we’ll utilize funds for marketing and developing our social booking app. Rest assured, all of your contributions will go toward expanding PodShare and social travel.

Why Indiegogo? Why not take investor money?

PodShare is all about sharing. Couchsurfers and friends helped build the first set of pods, and we want to reach out to our community again.

We appreciate investor opportunities, but let's see if we can bootstrap PodShare 2.0.

One of the perks is pre-paid pods, what happens if there isn’t a new location in 2015? How do I redeem my perk?

No worries, this won't be a problem. There will be another PodShare. You’ll receive a voucher for a pre-paid pod! This perk will never expire, you can gift it, and it can be redeemed at any future PodShare location.

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of 6 students attending the University of Tennessee and we are running a campaign advocating for the Young Williams Animal Center located in Knoxville, TN.  Our campaign name is CosmoPAWlitan in which the goal is to raise awareness within the Knoxville community about the center's foster program as well as to raise $1,000 in donations. We are very passionate about animal welfare because we believe that pets deserve equal amounts of love and care. The YWAC strives on a daily basis to not only spread love to the animals in the center but also ensure that the pets enter a safe and loving home upon adoption/fostering. 

What We Need & What You Get

All the funds donated to our campaign will go straight to the center so that they can purchase supplies that are needed to run the foster program.  The supplies purchased are given to the foster parent/family so that there is not a financial commitment. As a donor, we greatly appreciate your donation no matter how small and we will be offering incentives to those who donate. Below are a few of the perks we are offering for your gracious donations:

  • Jersey Mike's Subs coupon for a free chip and drink
  • Jersey Mike's coupon for a free regular sub
  • Silvia's Mexican Restaurant gift certificate  

The Impact

The Young William's Animal Center strives on a daily basis to end pet homelessness and promote animal welfare. In order for this to happen, they need help from our community. By donating to our campaign you will be helping the center not only purchase supplies for the foster program but also help the center have the essential supplies needed for daily operation.​

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge we may face while running this campaign is not reaching our target audience. Our target audience consists of families with young children. We chose this audience because pets are typically child friendly and make a great companion. Another challenge we may face is not reaching our weekly goal of $170. Due to our campaign only being live for 6 weeks time, receiving this amount on a weekly basis will allow us to reach our $1,000 donation goal.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that donating is not feasible for everyone and that's okay! There are a couple of other ways you can help.

  • Spread the word! Tell all your family and friends about our campaign to increase traffic to our page
  • Foster! If you are able to open your home, consider becoming a foster parent. Fostering is free of costs as everything you will need is provided by the center
  • Donate items on their wish list! The link can be found in FAQ

story:
Summary

My name is Jeremy Schneider and I am a photojournalist/documentary photographer based in Miami, Florida. 

I have more than 15 years of experience in photojournalism, working for newspapers, magazines and online media outlets.

The Miami Fighters project is important to me because it is the first project utilizing crowdfunding. I am excited to try this opportunity and find people who are interested in supporting documentary photography works.

So, thank you for reviewing my project and I hope you'll become a contributor and also spread the word about this project.

Again, thanks and wish me luck!

What I Need & What You Get

I am seeking $1,200 to fund the project. The money will go to:

  • Purchase a Web domain and Web platform
  • Market the project
  • Fund travel expenses
  • Fund equipment rental

The Impact

Your contribution will allow me to launch this campaign in which to grow a long-term project. Ideally, Miami Fighters will turn into both a multimedia project and a printed book.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't fund the project, there are still ways you can help. Please help spread the word about the project using your social media outlets like Facebook and Twitter. Help me spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

Three Brothers' Distillery is a small startup distillery located in Chesapeake, VA which is opening to meet the growing demand for incredible craft and artisanal whiskeys in the Mid-Atlantic States. President and Owner, David Reavis, utilizes his passion for whiskey and love of history to create a fine craft rye whiskey and un-aged corn liquor. He also seeks to introduce the art and history of distilling to the residents of Virginia and North Carolina. Three Brothers' Whiskey’s mission is to provide quality products incorporating Virgina's long and rich distilling heritage to today’s and tomorrow’s marketplace.

What We Need & What You Get

In today’s economy, the banks still haven't recovered from the 2008 banking crisis they created and are not ready to support the Whiskey Brotherhood. In order to realize our vision, we need you, your passion for great whiskey, and love of artisinal spritits to join us on our journey.

Your financial support will be used to buy our first production still and generate enough capital, along with the money we have already raised, to open our doors and bring the Whiskey Brotherhood to Hampton Roads!  We intend to buy a 300 gallon hybrid pot still from our good friends at Artisan Still Design. Stephen and his guys make the best stills in the business and do it for a lot less than the big manufacturers. This committment to quality and craftmanship is the same kind of raw spirit we plan to build into our products.

We need to raise $100,000 dollars to get this outstanding still and the additional equipment to install it. With this still, we will be able to bring our whiskey, gin, and moonshine to you and others who share a love of craft whiskey and aritisinal spirits.

What's In It For You

Without a doubt, regardless of your level of donation, you get our unending gratitude in helping realize our vision and launch the Brotherhood! Additionally, you become part of the Brotherhood! How cool would it be to tell your friends that you helped bring a distillery to Hampton Roads!  While we know our gratitude goes a long ways, we recognize it might not go as far for some as it does for others. So for those of you who are looking for a little more, check out the list to the right for all of our incentives.  Here are a few of our favorites:

  • Who doesn't love a challenge coin? For an $8.00 donation, you will get one of our awesome coins. These coins are casino quality poker chips with our logo. Never be stuck buying a drink at the bar without one of our quality challenge coins in your pocket!
  • Help build our Tasting Bar... brick by brick. For a $100.00 donation, we will buy a brick, inscribed with up to three lines to be used in our Tasting room as part of the Bar.  Your commitment to the Brotherhood will be immortalized at the Distillery for everyone who visits to see!
  • Did I hear you say you wanted your name on the label? For a $2500.00 donation we will make that happen. We will help you create a custom designed private label to be kept on file and used when making personal bulk purchases of at least a case or more through the distillery.  Picture your friends' faces when you crack open a bottle of your own private label at parties or give that special gift to a friend showing your connection to the Brotherhood. This is the definition of 'Show Liquor'.
  • If we don’t reach our goal, the money raised will still be going to the purchase of the still and opening the distillery.  After we reach our goal, additional monies raised will go towards getting the site prepped and additional equipment ordered to make sure that the moment we get our still on site and the licenses secured, we will be producing great distilled spirits!

The Impact

Three Brothers' Whiskey believes that great spirits start with great ingredients, a strict attention to detail and a passion for sharing a great spirit with you.

When you support Three Brothers' Whiskey, you are not just helping us get going; you’re helping local suppliers throughout Virginia. We will work to continually source our products from other Virginia business when possible. As we grow, we will work to help our suppliers grow with us.

Being part of the Brotherhood starts with your donation, but does not stop with your incentive. We will share our progress with you, our milestones, our highs and our lows. You become one of the Brotherhood and the relationship that goes with it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, and believe us, we understand times are tough. That doesn’t mean you cannot support us and the dream of bringing a destination distillery and a great line of spirits to Hampton Roads:

  • Share the campaign on your Facebook, your Twitter, your message board at work, the windshield of your car. Getting the word out is as critical to the success of our campaign as clicking on the donate button.
  • You can use the tools here to share this to everyone you know and even those you might have just met. Together we succeed!

We thank you ahead of time for your aid and support as we move this vision forward!

story:
PLEASE CONTRIBUTE HERE ----------------------------------->

How did SkinnyMe Bangles come to be? 

Well, exercising isn’t really my thing. Gyms intimidate me. And my Wii Fit died some time ago. I care about my health, but if I'm going to exercise I need something I can adopt easily. Many people feel the same way. So, SkinnyMe Bangles were born. 

What exactly are SkinnyMe Bangles? 

They’re wrist weights, redesigned. The concept is the same. By wearing wrist weights, you can tone and strengthen your shoulders, biceps and triceps because your muscles are working against the resistance. Unfortunately, most wrist weights are ugly and bulky. 

Because SkinnyMe Bangles look like jewelry, you can wear them often, for longer periods, and still reap the benefits.

Can I see some up close pics of the SkinnyMe Bangle? 

Absolutely! These are the finished prototypes. We spent 10 months designing, testing, patenting, and finessing them. We’re so proud of the quality of the bangles, we’re etching our logo into each one. And at a 1/2 pound each, SkinnyMe Bangles are the same size as a standard bangle. 

Looks more 'hot pink' in person.
 

Where’s my money going? 

With your help, we’ll be able to manufacture our first production run! This run will help us with our promotional packages.

Perk: SkinnyMe t-shirt

And fellas, research shows that SkinnyMe Bangles will get you brownie points with the ladies! Polled 1 subject.

Thank you for your support! 

<3 Tiffani

 P.S. - Join us on our journey at facebook.com/skinnymefashion

story:
Hi! My name is Nick. I’m the past owner of Five Guys and a Lawnmower, and I’m proud to say I’m Gay. When I ran this business several years ago, I was afraid to allow any current or potential clients know that I was gay. Why was I afraid? I was worried that people would judge my orientation instead of my work. Times have changed. But, they are still changing. And I believe strongly that I can be a positive part of that process. I’ve seen more and more local stores be hesitant to hang a small rainbow flag in their window, for fear of losing business, losing customers, and even vandalism. I’d like to beat that fear. I’d like to have the first Lawn Care/Landscaping company in the Northern Kentucky area that is 100% openly GLBT-Friendly.

In intend to re-open Five Guys and a Lawnmower. And this time around, I want my potential clients to know that my company is owned & operated by someone that is very open-minded and willing to show it. I would like to provide local teenagers and adults a mobile business that is willing to take a stand for them and others. And, I want to provide them the comfort knowing that they can do the same. They should know that being GLBT or GLBT-Friendly shouldn’t affect their life negatively. I intend to lead by example. My example will be through running a successful Lawn Care/Landscaping service in this Northern Kentucky area.

I’m sure every one of you knows someone or is related to someone that is Gay, Bisexual, or Transgendered. Show your support for them! Help reopen Five Guys and a Lawnmower and help get 10% of all profits earned by Five Guys and a Lawnmower donated to other GLBT-Friendly businesses & GLBT organizations!

What We Need & What You Get
Here is a quick rundown of where the contributions will be going:
$15,000 total
70% Equipment Expenses (Used: Truck, Plow, Mowers, Trimmers, Blowers, Trailer, etc)
10% Advertising (Yellow Pages, Newspaper Ads, Door Hangers, etc.)
10% Insurance (Liability, Commercial Auto, etc)
10% Purchasing Perks for Contributors

Of course, I don’t expect you to simply donate your money! Instead I’m offering several different packages that you could purchase to get a return on your contribution. Everything is listed in the column to the right with each contribution amount requested.

If you are a local resident (Boone County, KY), you can opt for ½ of what you contribute to be used to cover the Labor Expenses for Lawn Mowing & Landscaping. Simply get in contact with me and we can discuss everything! :)

If we are unable to hit the $15,000 goal, everything will still be set in motion, but equipment will be purchased as needed, and at a lower quality. I do not intend to give up on this project!

The Impact

Your contribution is not only valuable to me and my local area. Opening a business that is 100% open about being GLBT-Friendly will help provide a benchmark for others to hit in this world. It will show acceptance of change and will help others feel comfortable about being themselves. Local GLBT consumers will also be able to have access to a company that they know will not be judgemental, allowing them to be comfortable using their services! Being LGBT-Friendly isn't just socially active, it's good business too!

On top of that, 10% of all profit earned by Five Guys and a Lawnmower will be donated to GLBT-Friendly businesses and GLBT organizations!!!

My Proven Track Record

From 1999-2007 I ran Five Guys and a Lawnmower in Florence, KY. I started with a simple push lawn mower and went door to door. By the end of my second summer, I had purchased a residential Riding Mower and a small trailer to tow my equipment. I was able to drive my mower throughout my neighborhood to expand my working area. I continued to grow the business and was very successful in doing so. In 2007 when I closed, I had over 35 weekly clients and an additional 15 bi-weekly clients.

So, why close the business? In 2007 I left to focus on my education and pursue other interests. But now I have decided that this is the right time to return to something I love- and to do it in a way that will make a real impact!

I have long been committed to making a difference for the LBGT community. During the 2006-2007 School year, I opened a Gay-Straight Alliance at Boone County High School with the help of friends, family, and local GLBT-Rights groups. This took months to accomplish, but once it was started, it helped promote change in the area schools. I am extremely proud of this accomplishment and determined to continue my positive influence as I move forward with my career.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to contribute money to this campaign, you can still help out! One of the HUGE ways to make a difference, is to spread the word! Tell your friends and family about the campaign. The more people that know about it, the better chances that this goal can be hit.

Thank you so much for whatever support you are able to give!
story_txt:
Hi! My name is Nick. I’m the past owner of Five Guys and a Lawnmower, and I’m proud to say I’m Gay. When I ran this business several years ago, I was afraid to allow any current or potential clients know that I was gay. Why was I afraid? I was worried that people would judge my orientation instead of my work. Times have changed. But, they are still changing. And I believe strongly that I can be a positive part of that process. I’ve seen more and more local stores be hesitant to hang a small rainbow flag in their window, for fear of losing business, losing customers, and even vandalism. I’d like to beat that fear. I’d like to have the first Lawn Care/Landscaping company in the Northern Kentucky area that is 100% openly GLBT-Friendly.
In intend to re-open Five Guys and a Lawnmower. And this time around, I want my potential clients to know that my company is owned & operated by someone that is very open-minded and willing to show it. I would like to provide local teenagers and adults a mobile business that is willing to take a stand for them and others. And, I want to provide them the comfort knowing that they can do the same. They should know that being GLBT or GLBT-Friendly shouldn’t affect their life negatively. I intend to lead by example. My example will be through running a successful Lawn Care/Landscaping service in this Northern Kentucky area. I’m sure every one of you knows someone or is related to someone that is Gay, Bisexual, or Transgendered. Show your support for them! story:
My Story

With support from my friends and family, I successfully made aliyah after two years of hard work and lots of emails, phone calls and "no's." Thankfully I made it here and fought my way through to get to serve in the IDF. Not many 28 year-olds get the opportunity to join the IDF, and after more hard work, I am so grateful to share that on April 22nd, 2012 I will join the IDF as combat soldier.


I'm asking my friends and family to help me once more achieve my dream of serving in the army...I want to see my family before I enlist for three years in a combat unit.


The Impact

I would love to see my family and friends back home in Miami before I start my service. Please help me get home to spend time with my family, have a homecooked meal and see my Grandpa.


What We Need & What You Get


I need to raise $1200 to cover the cost of my roundtrip ticket from Tel Aviv to Miami. Even if I don't raise the full $1200, every little bit helps to get me home.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this on your various networks with friends, family and rich people.

story:
Friends Friends of Faire (FoF) was founded in 1998 and, with the help of Renaissance Entertainment Productions, numerous volunteers and limited income, the original meeting area (the FoF Garden) has been improved with additional tables and benches, a roofed pavilion, a new garden gate, wall and fence, and numerous plantings.  Our membership has grown from just a few over 400 full members in 2011 to just over 560 last season.  Without your help the FoF Garden would still be an area with a few picnic tables and minimal amenities.  Over the past few years we have opened the garden to any Faire goer willing to pay a $5 daily fee for use of the garden and amenities which include a shady and usually breezy place to rest with adequate seating, private privies, classes and entertainment, and unlimited filtered ice water and Gatorade.  Most folks who avail themselves of this privilege become full members the following year.

2013 is FoF's 15th birthday at Bristol and we are getting ready to take on the biggest project since the building of the pavilion - a nearly 1,000 square foot expansion of the garden and the building of a lockup,roofed amenities area and new gates and fencing.  The area on the drawing in gallery tab is the back of the garden. Bottom of drawing is South.  Except for an 8x16 area in the south-east corner, the entire current "back of the garden" will be available for member activities. 

The largest expense for this project is the lockup.  That is $18,000.  We have been saving every cent we could over the past 4 years and still need $12,000.  This will give us funds to do the following:

  • Build the 16x20 lockup to building inspector standards, with our own electricity and water.  The lockup will have a "garage" door at the back and a 30 year roof.  An 8 x 16 cedar shingled porch will cover the sink and gator/water dispensing area.
  • An instant hot water heater.
  • A separate, stand-alone sink next to the privies for handwashing.
  • New sink and prep tables
  • A built-in ice cooler for the filtered gatorade and ice water.
  • A roofed area for the privys, the THREE dressing/nursing rooms, the member storage area (keep), and hopefully a baby changing station and Diaper Genie.  This will be similar to the current pavilion, only smaller and we hope to re-use the canvas for the roof.
  • Benches and tables to provide seating in the expansion area.
  • Build new fencing and gates to enclose the expansion.
  • The usual painting and sealing and repairs.

The Friends of Faire has successfully added amenities and completed projects to improve the Garden area in each of the past 4 years.  We have added seating, removed the pond and added a smaller water feature, gotten rid of the large rocks that were an attractive nuisance and installed a lovely wall and estate fencing for safety.  The pavilion was built completely with volunteers and donated cash.  It was re-roofed for the coming season the same way.  The current project cannot be done in phases and as a result we must resort to asking for funds.

We WILL post photos of the project as it goes on as well as of the completed project.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is in a position to donate even $10.  That's okay.  We understand.  We have ALL been there.  But you can STILL help!  If you would spread the word that would be awesome. Use your Facebook, Twitter or other social media account to link to this site.  Use the Indiegogo share tools.  Talk to your friends.  We have some awesome thank you gifts for helping us out!

story:
Bill Gates and Warren Buffet give staggering amounts of money away every year but did you also know that the world’s most important donations don’t come from them? They come from people like you, giving $25 or $50 at a time?

What if we could empower millions of people every day to create their own tax-deductible accounts dedicated to charitable giving? And then, what if we asked companies and retailers to support that effort with matching contributions or a percentage of sales? If we can get millions of people giving a couple of hundred dollars a year to charities all over the world, we could move billions of dollars and change everything!

But we need your help to make this vision a reality.  We built the platform and over three years and 2.4 million dollars later, we are ready but we need your help to cross the finish line. Right now any person, of any financial status, can create their own foundation. Better yet, they can get more to give away to their favorite charity through the GiveBack Rewards programs we’ve created. We are now ready to grow the world’s largest charitable foundation, but we need your help to complete the task and get people to sign up and to give. Check out the site at www.giveback.org

 

A Personal Giving Account:

 

Have you heard of Giving Tuesday? Well this year, we are trying to sign up 1,000 companies and 1 million people and commit to giving money away in 2014. We are doing all of this in conjunction with Giving Tuesday, the National Day of Giving scheduled for December 3rd. In order for us to succeed, we need to raise $110,000 by August 15th so we can get the word out, market the idea, and change the world for good. We need you to help us get there. We need you to be a founding philanthropist of the world’s largest foundation.

 

Help us make the world a better place, increase giving in 2014 and create a new world of everyday heros funding charities all over the world. GiveBack; It's Your Foundation

story:
Our campaign is to help the children at R House become more stable and successful by creating an environment for teen recovery through personal empowerment. R House is a registered non-profit 501C (3) which operates a licensed residential treatment center and charter high school for youth. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose, and will be used to serve the children by funding our organization.


Help make a difference in the lives of the children at R House!

R House has been serving youth for more than 35 years. Many of the children who enter our program come from disadvantaged families and communities, or many times have no family. Our dual diagnosis facility offers a comprehensive quality program that provides youth a stable caring environment to receive treatment to overcome obstacles, including substance abuse and mental health issues.

Our goal is to educate, support, and serve foster children and at-risk youth in helping them grow to their full potential and become successful and fulfilled in their lives. 

We provide adolescents with an education that gives them tools to be successful in life, including academics and life skills.

Our clinical services give individual treatment to children to address their needs. The specialized services combine with our onsite school and a structured residential setting to provide an abundance of opportunities to help teens in need.


Here is a story from one of our graduates:


My life at R House, By Christina Lile

I remember my first day at R House: the sun setting as I was transported to the country, the silence in the car, just the loud thumping of my heart racing. I remember in juvenile hall I planned to jump out of the car at a stoplight before even making it to R House, but I didn't. I don’t know if I was scared of jumping out of a moving vehicle, or if common sense took over. I was nervous in an unfamiliar area with unfamiliar adults supervising me. During the day I slept and there were girls from all over California housed together, 24 girls. I was terrified, terrified of the unexpected. I just wanted to go home, turn back the clock and start over. I was not bad; I was just a hurt little girl inside. I thought I would never be able to trust anyone, especially adults I did not know; I could not even trust my mother. I felt abandoned by my mother when her parental rights were terminated and I became a ward of the court. 

Group homes can be difficult, but I can say that R House saved my life. At the time I hated it, but it kept me safe. I learned to trust adults and create real bonds with girls my age who have felt the pain I have experienced, feelings of loneliness and distrust. I knew deep down that I was tired of living the destructive lifestyle I was living before coming to R House: a 16-year-old truant from school, running away from home and having no respect for myself or any positive goals ahead... disloyal and disrespectful to the woman who brought me into this world, her health deteriorating. I made a promise to myself that I would finish this program for my mother. With each passing day it got easier and easier to be here, to the point where I started calling R House “my home.” I felt out of place when I went on home passes; I could not wait to come home and see my mentors and friends.

The R House program has taught me how to be patient, how to trust, how to realize my own self-worth and become independent. Mentors who truly cared about me guided me before I could walk tall on my own. I was so proud to get a job through the vocation services offered by R House. I worked as much as I could, and I loved it! I was able to save $10,000 while working. I stayed at R House from December 2002 to January 2005. I remember around my 18th birthday, 2 months before leaving R House, I begged my probation officer to stay longer. I was terrified to leave; I felt so safe being there. He told me it was time to spread my wings and leave the nest. I was upset! We started laughing together because during our first visit. I was arguing with him about wanting to leave as soon as possible... and now I was crying and begging to stay longer!

I wanted to give back to the place that saved my life. Today I am employed by R House, and I am truly grateful to be able to serve through this wonderful program. Although it is challenging to work with these children; they have such tremendous pain. I am happy to be able to help them become stable and grow. I wish you could feel the overwhelming love and admiration I have for this program.


Our Needs

We need money to be able to serve the children by operating our program. Your contribution is critical for us to make a difference in their lives.

The money we raise will be used to pay for the following:

·  Deliver quality services in the program;

·  Facility improvements for creating a safe and comfortable environment for the children;

·  Staff training;

·  Support for our on-site charter school, the Abraxis Charter School;

·  Program development, including enhancing our awareness and behavior modification training, music, and other enriching activities for the children; and

·  Salaries to run our program.


The Impact

Your contribution will give us the opportunity to continue to provide children a safe and comfortable  environment, an education, and a place for them to heal and grow. We have helped thousands of children grow to overcome addictions, obtain an education, and develop life skills. Your help will give us the resources needed to provide them with what they need.


Donate Now

Our organization needs donations to continue to deliver quality services to the children. Your help will provide the resources for improving the quality of these teenagers’ lives and help our society by giving them a holistic environment that can inspire and prepare them so they can make a positive contribution.


Other ways you can help

There are many ways you can help and serve the children that recover within the R House Program, such as donations of goods and services.


SPREAD THE WORD... Share this campaign with people you feel may be interested in helping R House.

Contact us for information on donating.

Our contact information:

donate@rhouseinc.org

(707) 539 - 1880

you can also visit us at www.rhouseinc.org

Other ways you can help
There are many ways you can help and
serve the children that recover within the R House Program, such as donations
of goods and services. 

SPREAD THE WORD... Share this campaign with people you feel may be interested
in helping R House. 
Contact us for information on
donating.
Our contact information: 
donate@rhouseinc.org
(707) 539 - 1880
you can also visit us at www.rhouseinc.org

story:
Hello everyone,


My name is Andrew Boutselis, and I am a junior communications/creative writing student at Southern New Hampshire University.

As a SNHU student, I am incredibly lucky to have the opportunity to pursue my dreams at a university with bountiful opportunities. One of these opportunities is the SNHU Alternative Break Program through the Center for Community and Engaged Learning.

This winter break, a group of fellow SNHU students and myself will travel to Kurland Village in South Africa for two weeks through an organization called Willing Workers in South Africa (WWISA). The village, much like many South African communities, is a multi-cultural village recovering from 50 years of Apartheid government rule and the ramifications that resulted from a half-century of inequality. During our time there, we will work with WWISA to aid the developing village.

I truly believe everyone has a story. Regardless of nationality, social class, creed or any fathomable difference, every individual has a story that is unique and significant in its own special way. My passion has always been storytelling, and I've become increasingly dedicated to using filmmaking and writing as my medium in doing so. 

There is no greater success in the world than making a genuine difference. That being said, when one can use their own passions or talents to make that difference, the victory is tenfold. I am going to use my experience in filmmaking to make a short documentary about the trip in an effort to raise awareness regarding the program and the absolute necessity of service in the world, on a community and global scale.

To make it to Africa, each participant is paying a total $2,000 to cover the costs. Although a small price to pay for an experience of this magnitude, that number can be steep for a college student. On top of the trip expenses, I intend to purchase lighting/camera equipment for the documentary that will increase the overall quality of my project.

My goal is to raise half the cost of the trip at $1,000. Any donation, no matter the size, is incredibly helpful. I will be working two jobs going forwards, and every additional penny makes a difference. Thank you all so much in advance. 

Andrew
