story:
The Kiva Fellowship

On February 1st, I will be heading to Johannesburg, South Africa, and Maputo, Mozambique to spend four months as  a fellow with Kiva.

As the video above describes, Kiva is a micro-financing nonprofit whose mission is to alleviate extreme poverty through connecting entrepreneurs in economically disadvantaged communities with willing lenders, like you or I. 

To make this lending possible, Kiva works with 230 field partners, or micro-finance institutions, in 73 different countries.  Because of the large size of this network, Kiva depends largely on volunteers and fellows, like me, to work in the field with Kiva's field partners.  As Kiva describes, “the Kiva Fellowship is an unpaid, volunteer position designed to increase Kiva's impact and to offer participants a unique insider experience to the world of micro finance”.  As a fellow, I will provide critical training, program software, and technical updates to field partners as well as ensure that processes are running smoothly and efficiently in the field.  Kiva Fellows remain to be the strongest connection between Kiva and its field partners and are an essential part of Kiva's success.

Why Kiva?

Growing up in a middle-class family of 6 children, money always held an intrinsic value to me, and birthdays didn't get much better than receiving a fresh-faced $100 bill.  I would save it to put towards a new bike, or some trivial material good that wouldn't actually make a difference in my quality of life.  However, after studying abroad in both Brazil and Indonesia, the meaning of money changed drastically.  The same amount of money that can buy me a new pair of running shoes in urban America can serve as two months' rent for a college student in East Java, Indonesia.  20 cents, which can't even get me a decent gumball at a diner, can mean the difference between having a nourishing meal and going hungry to a working mom in Jakarta.  I Kiva because by giving up my coffee habit for a week, I can invest $25 in an entrepreneur in need, and all too easily help them break above the poverty level and have a better quality of life.

Moreover, while working to alleviate poverty in Los Angeles' most disadvantaged community on Skid Row, I was exposed first-hand to the lack of financial resources available to those living in poverty, decidedly the ones who need them the most.  With Kiva, these financial resources are made available to the most impoverished areas of the world, having a direct impact on combatting global poverty levels.  I am very excited to use my extensive training background to serve Kiva's field partners in South Africa and Mozambique, creating a more efficient lending cycle and ensuring critical financial resources to over 2,500 borrowers in need.

Who will I work with?

As a Kiva Fellow, I will spend 3 months working with Hluvuku-Adsema, a micro-finance institution in Maputo, Mozambique.  Although Mozambique's economy has been largely improving over the last couple of years, Mozambique remains to be one of the poorest countries in the world.  Hluvuku has 8 branches in the Maputo area and since partnering with Kiva, has provided over 2,500 loans to borrowers in need in order to combat poverty levels in this part of the country.  To learn more about how Kiva loans have impacted Hluvuku clients, please click here.

I will also spend 1 month of my Kiva fellowship working with Maharishi Institute in Johannesburg, South Africa, a vocational educational institute that provides critical training and work experience to students. This greatly strengthens students' marketability in a country where the unemployment rate has stubbornly plateaued around 25% in the past few years.  (To learn more about South Africa unemployment rates, click here.)  Kiva partners with Maharishi to provide micro-loans to students, helping combat the cycle of generational poverty and allowing them access to a higher education and eventually, stable employment.  To learn more about Maharishi students that are positively impacted by Kiva's loans, please click here. 

How can you join the cause?

After talking to past Fellows in the region and doing extensive research, my estimated budget for my fellowship will be at least $6,000 for my 4 months in Africa.  This estimate includes airfare, in-country transportation to visit borrowers/field offices, visa costs, required vaccinations, and food and accommodations, among other costs. The budget breakdown is as follows: 

  • Airfare: $1,500
  • Accommodations for 4 months: $2,500
  • Food for 4 months: $1,000 - $1,500
  • Vaccinations: $150
  • Visa: $150
  • In-country transportation: $500

As I previously mentioned, the Kiva fellowship is an unpaid, volunteer position.  However, I am confident that investing in a Kiva fellowship will have lasting effects on my future career path and I am excited to lend my services where they are needed the most.  I will be spending $2,000-$3,000 of my personal savings to fund this trip, but I need your help to make the fellowship possible. My goal for this campaign is to raise at least $2,700.  Any contributions to this page over the fundraising goal, if not used for emergency or unseen expenses in the field, will be donated back to Kiva.

By giving a tax-deductible donation to this fellowship, you will have a direct impact on the lives of borrowers, and moreover, like-minded students and entrepreneurs looking for a bridge to a better quality of life, a common goal that transcends all social, ethnic and geographic boundaries.  Not to be undermined, you will also receive an exclusive perk of your choice listed on the right side of this page.  If you feel compelled to support Kiva's mission of alleviating global poverty by creating a connection between those in need and those who can lend, I hope you will consider making a contribution in whatever way possible - and no amount is too small! 

Want to help but can't contribute? 

Here are some other ways to help: 

  • Share this page using the tools above - The visibility of my Indiegogo campaign is directly related to my fundraising success.
  • Donate airline miles - if you have airline miles saved up that you would like to donate to my airfare, let me know!
  • Connect me with your networks in Mozambique and South Africa - I will be arranging all in-country housing accommodations, so any tips or tricks will be greatly appreciated.  Also, I just really love networking.
  • Spread the word about Kiva or make a loan on Kiva's page!
  • Let me know about any social causes or social enterprise models you think are worth knowing about!
  • Keep in touch - connect with me via LinkedIn.  You never know when our paths might cross and opportunity may come knocking.

story:
Everyone loves to travel, and we all want an authentic travel experience based on real connections with other people and the places we visit.

Yet we’ve found that there is nothing available that lets you find real time location and interest based connections with other people, as well as with local events and services. Our research has also shown that there is an explosive smartphone adoption rate and use while travelling, including in-app purchasing, to the point where our mobile devices have become a vital part of our travel survival kit. We've surveyed visitors and tourism businesses to discover what, why and how they use - and don't use - mobile devices, and what their challenges are.

The Solution

TravPal© connects travellers with each other, with small or independent and family owned tourism providers, and with local people themselves -- who we call our Local ambassadors - all based on your interest, location and in real time when travelling with your mobile device.


Real time locator filtered by interest to find other travellers, locals or service providers


Complimentary social media features helps you to discover, connect, record and share your journey with friends, family and with the TravPal community for a more authentic experience that connects travellers with people and place.

Personal User Profile Synced up with Facebook, etc.


TravPal also helps visitors to a destination save money through our Local Hero packs, which are regional offline maps that elminate the need to worry about roaming charges. These Local Hero packs offer premium content, services, deals and discounts - again all based on interest.

In doing so we provide mobile market access that doesn't currently exist for the vast majority of small scale, local and family owned tourism providers, by increasing their visibility and offering direct customer engagement.

New Mobile Marketing and Sales Channel with enhanced visibility & more direct customer engagement.


Our Team

We have extensive global experience in tourism development, international journalism, branding & communications, social / mobile marketing and web / App development.

Peter @ Linkedin
Jas @ Linkedin
Judith @ Linkedin

Business Model

Our free mobile app will compliment selling “in-app” a range of premium content and services, exclusive offers and third party services such as local discounts, free wi-fi spots, etc.

A free basic listing to business partners provide a new mobile market channel, and premium paid listings offer enhanced visibility and e.g. to showcase events.

Unique Value Proposition

For traveler users, we provide an enhanced visitor experience (exclusive content, local connections, etc.); Saves $ and reduces hassle

For small, independent businesses, we provide a new, and for many a first mobile marketing channel to help them flourish in a challenging market

For both, TravPal enhances the buyer-seller relationship & in destination experience.

Us & You

We have come a long way and raised the funds needed to get to where we are at, which is a complete technical roadmap and app prototype with user experience mockups, business model & financials, and extensive market research to ensure that we’re on the right path. Crowdfunding through Indiegogo is the best way that we can rapidly get the minimum viable product to market and into the hands of happy travelers and even happier small, local independent and many family owned tourism businesses all over the world.

Your support will go primarily toward developing the website and App initially for iOS devices (80%) and the rest for perks and taxes (20%). However, PLEASE DON'T STOP CONTRIBUTING once we reach our target!!! Anything left over will go toward development of the App for Android devices, and for getting TravPal onto the market and promoting it.

If you are involved in tourism as a provider or a destination champion and like what you see and want to support each other - please drop me a line!

Thank you!!!

story:
There Is Nothing Like a BATS!

Help us keep it going!

For 22 years we've put on the best Tarot party on the West Coast for those who study, work with and love Tarot. We need your help to continue to produce this important event!

This year the event takes up residence in its new home, the San Jose DoubleTree Hotel on Augst 17-18.

Visit www.dodivination.com for more info and to register!

BATS in the Belfry? You Betcha!

From the start, SF BATS has been dedicated to bringing Tarot enthusiasts together for learning, growth and fun.  The emphasis has always been on the exchange of information in an environment that is friendly, supportive and fun (see that word again? The one that begins with an “f”? yeah, that one - we're all about the Fun).  Fun has a way of relaxing the mind, and facilitating communication (science has proven it so it must be true!) and a relaxed mind is more receptive to learning. Relaxed, happy participants are able to peer around preconceptions and look at things from different and challenging angles. Connection and growth abounds!

We have been thrilled to watch the event grow, expand and change to meet the needs of the Community it serves while retaining its essential characteristics. However (and here is where you come in) we need your help! If you want to see SF BATS survive and thrive in the years to come, help us now!

Why Support SF BATS?

One of the most exciting things about SF BATS is the tremendous camaraderie - everyone is equal in their love of, and curiosity about, the Tarot. Many books, decks and systems have come out of the effervescent ferment that is a BATS, which is to be expected when you get a bunch of bright, dedicated enthusiasts together in an enclosed area. It is not an exaggeration to say that this is the “Mother Ship” of Tarot events. Even if you haven’t (yet) been to a BATS, if you work with Tarot or divination the chances are pretty good that you have been affected by what comes out if it. If you have been meaning to participate in a BATS, your contribution now helps ensure that there is a BATS in your future!

So What the Heck is SF BATS?

SF BATS is a currently a two day event featuring workshops, presentations, experiential activities and entertainment, all constellated around Tarot and Divination. This year we’re including more Lenormand and other oracles to shake up the mix even more! The speakers are a mix of local favourites, up-&-coming talent, and some of the most respected and venerable members of the Tarot world. On Saturday night there is a "BATS in the Belfry Mystical, Magickal Mixer," with entertainment, libations and even more opportunities for schmoozery.

There is a “Tarot Bazaar,” a marketplace of Tarot tools and trinkets, that offers a wide array of Tarot themed merchandise for purchase, much of it sold by the presenters.  Readings are available by several of the presenters as well as the core production Daughters of Divination in what is known as the Pagan Science Reading Room.

Attendees are encouraged to put flyers, brochures and business cards on the “Table of Shameless Plugs” to help spread the word about their doings - we are big fans of sharing and support! There is also a Raffle of Fabulous Prizes <tm> featuring delicious offerings from all over the Tarot world, the proceeds of which go to various local and national charities, including bat conservation groups.  

The SF BATS Programme is at the printer, so although our gratitude for contributions made after August 12th  is every bit as deep, those names will not be included. 

www.dodivination.com

story:
UPDATE 10/3/13 - Over $360 donated from US Military Troops serving in Afghanistan!  Thank you for your service to our nation!  God Bless!!!


ANY AMOUNT IS GREATLY APPRECIATED $1, $5, $10, $20, $100. 
Thank you, Thank you, Thank you!!!! 

Our goal for this campaign is very simple.  On November 22, 2013
(Thanksgiving Day) we want to SUPRISE Adalia Rose and her family with an all expense paid, 5 day Christmas Vacation to Walt Disney World.  This will be the inaugural sponsorship from the H.A.L.O. Project (Hope, Aid, Love and Opportunities). 

We are VERY excited to sponsor Adalia and her family with this trip of a lifetime that will create unforgettable memories.  Please help us and pass on the word.

Short Summary of H.AL.O.

H.A.L.O. is an acronym for Hope, Aid, Love and Opportunities.
This is the humanitarian vision of Manuel "Manny" Torres.
Our focus is to create humanitarian aid missions around the world
along with random acts of kindness.

Projects will include:
- Trips to Disney World for terminally and chronically ill children
- American Wounded Warrior support and assistance
- European Orphan Outreach
- AIDS/HIV awareness and education in Africa
- Delivering school supplies to Asia's third world countries
- Reconstructive surgeries for cleft lips and palates in South America

What We Need

A feasible goal of $8,000 USD has been set. This will cover airfare, park passes, hotel, meals and souvenirs for Adalia, her mother, father and brother.  All donations earned thereafter will be applied to H.A.L.O.’s endeavors of becoming an official 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. In addition, surplus funding will be applied to future projects and humanitarian aid missions as listed above.

 

See Where Your Money Goes.
See The Impact It Leaves.

Highlights of each H.A.L.O. Project will be documented by a professional videographer and shared on YouTube.




Manny Torres
MTorres@SocialMediaTowers.com

**Disclaimer**  Currently, H.A.L.O. is NOT a 501(C)(3) non-profit organization so your donations will NOT be tax deductable. We thank you for your understanding and most importantly we thank you for your trust!!!
story_txt:
UPDATE 10/3/13 - Over $360 donated from US Military Troops serving in Afghanistan!  Thank you for your service to our nation!  God Bless!!!
ANY AMOUNT IS GREATLY APPRECIATED $1, $5, $10, $20, $100. Thank you, Thank you, Thank you!!!! 
Our goal for this campaign is very simple.  On November 22, 2013 (Thanksgiving Day) we want to SUPRISE Adalia Rose and her family with an all expense paid, 5 day Christmas Vacation to Walt Disney World.  This will be the inaugural sponsorship from the H.A.L.O. Project (Hope, Aid, Love and Opportunities).  We are VERY excited to sponsor Adalia and her family with this trip of a lifetime that will create unforgettable memories.  Please help us and pass on the word. 
Short Summary of H.AL.O.
H.A.L.O. is an acronym for Hope, Aid, Love and Opportunities. This is the humanitarian vision of Manuel "Manny" Torres. Our focus is to create humanitarian aid missions around the worldalong with random acts of kindness. Projects will include:- Trips to Disney World for terminally and chronically ill children- American Wounded Warrior support and assistance- European Orphan Outreach- AIDS/HIV awareness and education in Africa- Delivering school supplies to Asia's third world countries- Reconstructive surgeries for cleft lips and palates in South America
What We Need 
A feasible goal of $8,000 USD has been set. This will cover airfare, park passes, hotel, meals and souvenirs for Adalia, her mother, father and brother.  All donations earned thereafter will be applied to H.A.L.O.’s endeavors of becoming an official 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. In addition, surplus funding will be applied to future projects and humanitarian aid missions as listed above.
 
See Where Your Money Goes.See The Impact It Leaves.
Highlights of each H.A.L.O. Project will be documented by a professional videographer and shared on YouTube.

Manny TorresMTorres@SocialMediaTowers.com

story:
For all our backers // If you can please be sure to add an additional $5 for US shipping and $8 for International shipping if your incentive requires shipping! We would really appreciate it!


Q: What is the concept for the collaboration?

A: There are hair and nail salons where you can get your hair done; boutiques for buying clothing and home goods; and lounges or cafe's where you can have drinks with your friends. Su'juk weaves facets of these distinct environments together to create a lifestyle boutique offering one extraordinary experience!

Our Idea!

Q: Who is Su Beyazit?

A: I'm Su Beyazit; I currently own a clothing and home goods store called Su'juk in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, New York. I was born in Adana, Turkey, a region just above the eastern Mediterranean. I left Turkey at the age of five and spent the rest of my youth in North Carolina in a non-traditional Turkish-American household. In the summer of my junior year in high school, I attended Rhode Island School of Design and finished a prestigious summer program focusing on Fashion illustration which led me to attend Parsons The New School For Design in New York City. I graduated college in 2010 with a degree in sustainable Fashion Design. After college I worked as a stylist and continued selling vintage online which led me to opening my own boutique in the fall of 2012. You can find out more about my personal work at www.subeyazit.com.

Q: Who is Elena Ruiz?

A: I'm Elena Ruiz, and I've been a hair colorist for 10 years, working both in Beverly Hills and New York City. At the age of 19, I received my cosmetology license at Paul Mitchell, Cosmetology School. Within the first three years of my graduation, I worked at two prestigious salons in Beverly Hills, California: Giuseppe Franco and Umberto. Eager to take my career to the next level, I decided to move to New York where I set my goal for the city's top celebrity salon for color, Rita Hazan. During my five years at Rita Hazan, I worked frequently with clients including: Jennifer Lopez, Thalia, and Jessica Simpson. My signature style hones in on a client's unique natural beauty and enhancing it with with a look that is at once sexy and sophisticated.

Q: What is the reason to expand the current Su'juk space?

A: I’ve had my current space for almost a year and I can feel the need for expansion and growth. I’ve partnered up with Elena to create a lifestyle boutique that’s a fun, relaxed venue where you can take care and beautify yourself and your home in an environment that is more social than traditional salons or boutiques. We're striving to re-make the way we shop for ourselves and our homes. Our first step towards this is expanding our home goods and furniture products by partnering up with Nomadic Trading Company. Step two is transforming part of the boutique to comfortably offer designer hair cuts, color, brow shaping, manicures and pedicures in a neighborhood that currently lacks a Salon that cater to the 20-40 young and mid-career professionals, students, and artists that make this community what it is.

Q: Why do you need this much money?

A: Our vision requires more space than what my current boutique, Su'juk, offers. Most of the spaces we've looked at would need to be built from the ground up. The creative freedom we would have excites us, but it also requires great care and a huge up-front investment. The initial work includes: breaking down walls, adding track lighting, buying paint and wood to build all of our display cases, racks and salon space. We also need help covering our awning and creating additional signage + a applying for a salon license. Any additional money (if we have any) will go towards buying new merchandise for the store.

Here is a Pie Chart of how the money will be distributed:

Q: What kind of services will the Salon be offering?

A: We will initially offer hair color and styling by Elena Ruiz; Gel manicures by Mei Kawajiri; and men's grooming by Josh Livingston. We will eventually add a women's hair cutter, a makeup artist and eyebrow groomer. This will take some time however we plan on offering a full salon service for women and men!

Q: Do you plan to ship internationally?

A: Sure do! Please just add an additional $8 dollars for international shipping!!

Q: What are some of the incentives offered?

A: We have an exciting array of fun gifts to treat yourself to! Donors can choose from: personalized USA state charm bracelet, a free blow out, keratin treatment, a gel manicures by Mei; or a color job (highlights, ombre or full head) by Elena! For our gents we have beard trims or hair cuts by Josh Livingston!

Please just be sure to add an additional $5 bucks to your donation for shipping!!

Our Incentives to name a few...

Q: When will I get my Su'juk services and incentives?

A: As soon as we can get them to you! We plan to roll them out in the order we get your donation! We have estimated delivery time which we will try our very best to stick with; however, we are gonna be undertaking a huge venture, so please be patient if we get a tad behind. We haven't forgotten about you!

Q: What does your current space look and feel like?

A: Our current space is very cozy and homey. We were inspired by nature so it has a rustic Americana vibe to it. Check it out below or go on our website to get an idea of our products:

Image from our Brooklyn Magazine Interview

Image from our Brooklyn Magazine Interview

Image from our Brooklyn Magazine Interview

Q: What kind of press have you already gotten?

A: We got some really rad press from a bunch of great New York Magazines and blogs! Here are some just to list a few: Time Out New York, Black Book, Brooklyn Magazine, Racked NY & Runway Passport

Q: What inspired the intro of your Indiegogo Video?

A: Our video's intro was inspired by the Iconic American TV sitcom Lavern and Shirley. "Best friends and roommates Laverne De Fazio and Shirley Feeney are single, working girls in late 1950s Milwaukee (later early 1960s Los Angeles) coping with dates, neighbors, and each other.

You can watch the original intro HERE

 

Be sure to check out our outfits! They match the orginial Intro:)

Risks and challenges

Our main challenge right now modifiying our current space or finding a space big enough, in a good part of the neighborhood, that's in our budget! We have given many local business and friends the low down of what we are interested in. So we have many eyes out for us:) As of now we have only found 1-2 spaces that meet that criteria. That said, we don't want to settle on any location since we plan on being there for a long time. However we are also negotiating a deal with our current landlord to expand our current space. In that case we will break down walls and revamp the space to be both a boutique and salon!

Another challenge for us is construction. One of the main spaces we are interested in needs a lot of modular work. So we are trying to figure out how to build out a space that can be the most economical. We are interested in making it look amazing but we also know that we can always over time improve aesthetics. So our main goal is to make it function and capture the essence of the concept! But fear not we have an amazing group of friends who are designers and architects that will help us out in every step!

Q: How can we stay in touch and follow Su'juk?

A: You can be connected with us through many social media outlets:

story:
>> Campaña en Español

Historical Memory Project

My name is Ebony Pleasants. I have been involved in social justice work and advocating for youth, women, LGBTQ, survivors of abuse and the homeless since I was 15 years old. I am currently in El Salvador, volunteering for Voices on the Border; a US nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting just and sustainable development in El Salvador.

The Objective:

To raise support and funds for the invaluable process of collecting and reconstructing the historical memory of a community that has lived through many trials and tribulations. Stories of extreme poverty, war, exile and collective development will be shared, heard and used to create a book, a digital library and a video documentary. The community will work together to lead this project, emotional supportive resources will be available throughout and in the end the community will have practical materials it can use to demonstrate the past and educate the future.

Three Methods of Memory Collection:

  • Personal Testimonies
  • Collective Memory Workshops
  • Material Archive
Community-led Commissions:
  • Workshop Facilitators
  • Interviewers
  • Archival
  • Emotional Support
  • Youth
PROJECT DEADLINE: NOVEMBER 2014 (25th Anniversary of the return from exile)

1. Follow the Money

$1,500

  • 5 Collective Memory Workshops (Meals and Materials)
  • 4 Emotional Support Workshops (Transport, Meals and Materials)
  • Voice Recorders ($$ or Donations)
  • Post-Production Committee (Meals and Materials)
  • Publishing of the book with Equipo Maiz in El Salvador
It's important to demonstrate each and every act of solidarity and for that reason we will mention your generous support on our finished material. If we don't reach our goal we will use what has been donated to ensure the continuation of the process. Going beyond our goal will allow us to increase the community involvement, offer them more opportunities to reflect and amplify the distribution.

2. The Social Impacts

This is more than a project for the production of media. The impact of memory work can have a variety of effects on survivors when they choose to remember and publicly document, assess and recognize the past and the particularly violent acts that have violated international humanitarian law and human rights.

The reconstruction of historical memory has the potential to rebuild social networks and facilitate the healing process through contributing to the psychosocial well-being of the community. 

Allowing different voices to describe and explain the history of facts can help identify the responsible parties, what happened and (at times) the reasons which hopefully has the potential to eliminate a survivor's guilt.

Rebuilding history allows recovery of the biographies of the dead and the rescuing of their dignities.

3. Other Ways You Can Help

  • Let us know of potentially interested individuals, groups, orgs or businesses!
  • Help Spread the word and use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank You for your consideration and for your solidarity  |  Project Website

_______________________________________________________________

Proyecto de la Memoria Histórica

Mi nombre es Ebony Pleasants. He estado involucrado en el trabajo de la justicia social y la defensa de la juventud, las mujeres, LGBT, los sobrevivientes de abuso y las personas sin hogar desde que tenía 15 años de edad. Actualmente estoy en El Salvador, el voluntariado para las Voces en la Frontera; una organización sin fines de lucro EE.UU. dedicada a promover desarrollo justo y sostenible en El Salvador.

El Objetivo:

Para aumentar el apoyo y los fondos para el proceso de valor incalculable de la recogida y la reconstrucción de la memoria histórica de una comunidad que ha vivido a través de muchas pruebas y tribulaciones. Historias de la extrema pobreza, la guerra, el exilio y el desarrollo colectivo serán compartidos, escucharon y se utilizan para crear un libro, una biblioteca digital y un video documental. La comunidad trabaja en conjunto para conducir este proyecto, recursos de apoyo emocional estarán disponibles en todo momento y al final la comunidad tendrá materiales prácticos que puede utilizar para demostrar el pasado y educar al futuro.

Tres Métodos de la Recogida de la Memoria:

  •   Testimonios Personales
  •   Talleres de Memoria Colectiva
  •   Archivo de Maateriales

Equipos del Trabajo:

  •   Los Facilitadores del Taller Colectivas
  •   Los Entrevistadores
  •   Archivo
  •   Apoyo Emocional
  •   Juventud

FECHA LÍMITE DE PROYECTO: NOVIEMBRE 2014 (25 años de la vuelta del exilio)

1. Siga el Dinero

$1,500

  • 5 Talleres de Memoria Colectiva (comidas y materiales)
  • 4 Talleres de Apoyo Emocional (transporte, comidas y materiales)
  • Grabadoras de Voz ($$ o donaciones)
  • Postproducción Comité (comidas y materiales)
  • Publicación del Libro con Equipo Maiz en El Salvador

Es importante demostrar a todos y cada acto de solidaridad y por eso vamos a mencionar su generoso apoyo en nuestro material terminado. Si no llegamos a nuestro objetivo vamos a utilizar lo que se ha donado para asegurar la continuación del proceso. Yendo más allá de nuestro objetivo nos permitirá aumentar la participación de la comunidad, les ofrecemos más oportunidades para reflexionar y ampliar la distribución.

Esto es más que un proyecto para la producción de medios de comunicación. El impacto del trabajo de memoria puede tener una variedad de efectos en los sobrevivientes, cuando optan por recordar y documentar públicamente, evaluar y reconocer el pasado y los actos particularmente violentos que han violado el derecho humanitario internacional y los derechos humanos. 


2. Los Impactos Sociales 

La reconstrucción de la memoria histórica tiene el potencial para reconstruir las redes sociales y facilitar el proceso de curación a través de contribuir al bienestar psicosocial de la comunidad.

Permitir que diferentes voces para describir y explicar la historia de los hechos puede ayudar a identificar a los responsables, lo que pasó y (a veces) las razones que se espera tenga el potencial de eliminar la culpabilidad de un sobreviviente.

La reconstrucción de la historia permite la recuperación de las biografías de los muertos y el rescate de sus dignidades.

3. Otras maneras de ayudar

  • Cuéntanos de potencialmente interesados ​​individuos, grupos, NGOs o negocios! 
  • Ayudar a difundir la información y el uso de las herramientas compartir IndieGoGo!

Gracias por su consideración y por su solidaridad | Sitio Web del Proyecto

story:
**Update**

A huge thank you to everybody who has contributed so far. With your help, we have managed to put together a teaser of our class handouts, which you can see below. We're both really excited to have got this far and to have something to show to you all. Our next step is to get these printed on waterproof, rip proof, indestructible paper so our students can take pocket field guides out with them wherever they may go!

With less than three weeks to go, we're extremely grateful for everybody's contributions, but there's still a long way to go, so please keep the donations coming and don't forget to share our campaign with all your friends!

Matt & Robin


Our Campaign

Freelance Photographic is a small Edinburgh based photography company run by Matthew Crisp and Robin Jeffries, two photographers with over 12 years of combined experience in art photography.

We’re looking for a little financial assistance to start something we’re calling “FP:Teach” - an initiative aimed at getting the Edinburgh community more in touch with the photos they’re taking. These days a photo has become a throw-away thing - something to post on Facebook and then forget about - but we don’t think this is how things need to be. A photo can be a work of art and something to be proud of. Imagine if all your Facebook photos were like this. Imagine printing and hanging your own work on your living room wall, or even being approached by friends and family for prints of your art.


Simple costs like rent, stationery and educational materials for our courses need to be paid up front before we can start running FP:Teach as a viable project, so we thought we’d ask you guys for help. In return we’ll give you all something to show for your generous donations. Be it a voucher for some of our excellent courses or a piece of beautiful artwork for your home; you’ll be getting something well worth your money and we’ll be one step closer to our goal of brightening the Edinburgh community with new skills and creativity. Not to mention helping keep this beautiful art form alive through the digital age.

 

What We Need & What You Get


We’ve worked out that all we need to get ourselves off the ground is £800 to pay for educational handouts, studio rent and insurance to run our classes. As a stretch goal, we have a target budget of an additional £400 to pay for advertising material throughout the city and in local media in order to spread the word. None of the money you donate will go towards paying ourselves. We just need to raise the start-up capital to get this project underway.


As a thank you for your contributions to our work, we’re offering a selection of hand-signed framed prints of your choice from our portfolio, as well as postcards, canvas prints and even a framed monster print for our first donation exceeding £150! For our backers in and around the Edinburgh area, we’re offering bundle packs of our photography courses, allowing you to come along and fuel your creative side at a significant discount on the standard rates! Please note that our classes will be held in Central Edinburgh and your own transport will need to be arranged!


Know someone with a passion for photography? Why not feed their fire by buying them a voucher for our classes? Simply drop us an email after selecting one of our class bundles and we’ll sort out the rest!


If you choose any of our prints as a reward, send us an email at info@freelancephotographic.co.uk with your name and which print you’d like and we’ll make sure you get the one you’re after. Available prints can be found at the bottom of the page.


The Impact


Over the last few years, both of us have volunteered our knowledge and experience in Schools and Societies, helping to share our love of photography with others across the UK and soon, the world (with our upcoming YouTube photography blog). Now we feel that it’s time to take our work to the next level and publish our full series of educational classes and professional materials to help others find their footing in an art that has so much to offer to anyone with a smartphone, compact camera, DSLR or even hand-me-down relic from their grandfather’s attic.


We aim to make this possible for anybody with a camera by running regular courses on photography, teaching people how to take photos to be proud of. We’ve devised a syllabus to work with people from the ground up, showing them how to take professional level photos in just two months.


With your donations, we can create a new source of education in our community. In turn this will afford us the time and freedom to expand our work, learn new skills to expand our course and - in time - offer our experience and knowledge to other communities throughout the country.



Other Ways You Can Help


Don’t worry if you can’t afford to donate to our cause! All we ask is that you help spread the word of what we’re doing and share this page with your friends and family. Every penny will help us to grow in our work and bring us one step closer to our goal.


Know someone with a keen sense for photography but would like to learn something new? Share this page with them to keep them informed of this exciting new development in their area!


Available Prints:




** Please Note: Due to international shipping costs, we will be unable to provide frames or signatures to prints delivered outside of the UK **

A huge thank you to everybody who has contributed so far. With your help, we have managed to put together a teaser of our class handouts, which you can see below. We're both really excited to have got this far and to have something to show to you all. Our next step is to get these printed on waterproof, rip proof, indestructible paper so our students can take pocket field guides out with them wherever they may go!
With less than three weeks to go, we're extremely grateful for everybody's contributions, but there's still a long way to go, so please keep the donations coming and don't forget to share our campaign with all your friends!

story:
Upstairs Hair Affair is a woman owned hair salon that will use only certified organic haircare products, including color, perm solutions, keratin smoothing systems, and daily use products too.

We will strive to be as Eco-friendly as possible. We will serve fair-trade refreshments and water in boxes rather than bottles. Our buildout is utilizing non-toxic materials wherever feasible. We plan to use all-natural cleaning products and will aim to utilize recycled paper products and will implement a strict recycling program.

We will offer clients a safe, comfortable environment where they can relax with a glass of wine or craft beer after work while catching up on the latest news or with a friend while munching on healthy fruits and veggies. We will be an Organic Concept salon, which means all of our products will be purchased from Organic Salon Systems, allowing us to guarantee every single color, perm, keratin smoother and shampoo and conditioner will be certified organic. Unlike traditional salons, clients' hair will remain beautiful and healthy because no harsh chemicals will ever touch it at Upstairs Hair Affair.

We are determined to provide excellence in all we do, including client service, all aspects of haircare, creating a perfectly safe and healthy salon, while always protecting the environment. No longer will clients have to endure strong odors or breathing difficulty due to harsh chemical treatments. There is a much better, safer way to achieve healthy, beautiful hair. Upstairs Hair Affair is proud to be part of the small community of forward-thinking salons. We hope more will follow soon.

Upstairs Hair Affair has it's permits, the architect has finished her work, and the contractors are now working. The electrician is finished and about ready to install the green LED lights purchased from the woman who owns a small local lighting store. The plumbing is fully installed and the carpenter is about ready to start painting using toxin-free paint bought from the woman at the local paint store. The funds raised here will finish paying for all of the above and a sign for the front of the building, and help pay our employees and operating expenses for the first few months we open. Also, boxed water is extremely expensive, so we hope to use part of the funds raised here to help us provide it for our clients.

All equipment was chosen to be comfortable and inviting. Who doesn't want to recline in a shampoo chair with their feet up and head comfortably nestled on a headrest in the shampoo bowl? How wonderful will it be to relax at the color bar while looking out the large windows that serve as two walls in the salon? Upstairs Hair Affair is on the second floor of the newest, most energy efficient building in Morton Grove.

Serious thought has been given to selecting perks we are so excited to offer. All donors will have the opportunity to see their name listed prominently on our website. We will offer t-shirts and tote bags with our logo, haircare products, and complimentary hair services to donors in our area.

If our goal is not met, the funds will be used toward paying our contractors and for materials.

Upstairs Hair Affair is in diverse Morton Grove, in the Chicago suburbs. We are on the second floor of a beautiful new office building. We were fortunate enough to secure the last space in the building and, luckier still, it is a beautiful loft with two walls of windows. Both the building and our space is fully ADA compliant, with a new elevator and an open and safe staircase. There is plenty of free parking and the building is just blocks from the expressway. Public transportation runs along our main thoroughfare and two different train stations are within two miles from our building, with bus stops in front of the building.

story:
I am Billy Pavlos, a 28 year old Industrial Designer with a passion to create innovative products and services.

I live in Greece, experiencing the Economic Crisis.

But no obstacle can stop creativity and dreams.

It might sound obvious but we still have to state it...  We need to change this world! From my designer’s point of view but also as a person sensitive to what is happening around me, I believe that our creativity is more powerful than any problem that might arise. We are creative by nature and are built to find solutions. 

The secret behind changing the current economic environment is found in divergence, or otherwise, in thinking outside-the-box, at every level! This divergent thinking should erase everything that we have taken for granted in products and services, and start from scratch, but this time, with one very important mission in mind: to create products that make a social impact.

This divergent thinking philosophy can be already found in projects all around us. The solutions to bigger or smaller problems are actually hiding in you and in me.


Divergent Movement (Divergentism), artworks using all symbols we have created to classify and represent our experience in life to the betterment of society

The issue is that we do not have a meeting-point to share our divergent thinking ideas and designs, a place where we can find supporters, producers or investors for our proposals and innovative suggestions.

Our current social structure, is based on companies. So to accomplish our aims, we have to speak the language of commerce, we have to sell our ideas in a store. On display in that store will be concepts and ideas that could be useful to business owners and marketers. People who want to grow their business, break into new markets and launch innovative new products that make a social impact.

The “Divergent Store” will become an online meeting point, where designers who create innovative product prototypes and services will come together with producers/investors/companies that share the same vision of making a positive social impact. This online global platform will also be accessible to anyone interested in finding out about divergent ideas and socializing through them.

The mission is to inspire the creation of new projects and brief life into old ones in topics that we support. We will get those product prototypes on to the market and use them as tools to enrich Education and support the Arts on a whole new global way.

The shared philosophy of the investors and the product creators using this store, will be a wish to make a positive social impact.

How will the Divergent Store work?

There will be two major activities/sections on the Store:

1. “Competitions”

A Production company may publish on the Divergent Store a brief about a need that they have. Creators will receive notifications about new briefs and will be invited to post their “proposals”. The best proposal will be the winner of the “Competition” and his/her proposal will be sold to the producer in order for it to move into production. The Divergent Store creative team will assist creators through this process.

2. “Showroom” 

At the “Showroom” we will showcase ideas and product prototypes by creators from all around the world after having gone through a process of selection and improvement by our team of experts. Here proposals from Competitions will also be showcased. Finally, we will make the communication between them and the right production companies of our network.

Final Goal:

Basic Divergent Organization structure, Inspiring-Teaching-Directing-Hosting-Helping Culture to thrive

Our final goal is to become a widely recognized Creative Organization that will drive Creators, Companies and Buyers Divergently to the betterment of society, as a Marketing tool, an Educational platform and a Research and Development department.

We aspire to re-design the product development process. People will work and educate themselves while they work. They are going to share knowledge and help others by working together, so they will be able to share tasks effectively, with themes that affect them and the whole of society.

Lets do this!

Support my dream and help make it a reality.

Be inspired, inspire others and make things happen.

Begin now!

Share our video and link to our funding campaign so we make it viral 

http://youtu.be/7qaus5n8G94

http://changethisworld.info



Explore our website for more informations

http://dvrgnt.org

________________________________________________________________
Get it for FREE, if you win the Sharing contest, so I suggest you start to like this project on facebook, tweet, share, and post  your link (dedicated to this campaign) everywhere.(no spam, please)
________________________________________________________________

Sharing Contest.

What is a Sharing Contest? That's simple: you and anyone else can promote the campaign, in any way (but spam) and the person who raises the highest amount of money based off of referrals will get a price.

How do you enter the contest? Well, if you sing up for Indiegogo website, you are already in! If you liked this project on facebook, tweeted it, or plused it on Google, commented on forums or reddit for example, then you are automatically apart of the referral contest.

How can I refer this project?

You can see here in the page, just below the video, a box saying "Share This Campaign:" followed by a link (something like http://igg.me/at/divergent/x/1234567). The seven digit number in the link (that will be different from 1234567 in your case) is your very own personal code. This means that when you share this link with anyone, your link is being tracked and you can actually view visitors came from your reference on your personal page on Indiegogo, where you will find a box dedicated to the referrals.

So all you have to do is get online anywhere and share with as many people as possible your link, and then wait. The person who brings the highest amount of funds by his/her referral code will get the stunning price!!!


________________________________________________________________

Our Unique Perks


Divergent Music Gift.

Divergent Thinking "Art Pack"

DVRGNT Organization - Inspiration Procedure

Finding the idea of your life!

Divergent Store 3X Pack for Creators.

Super Collective Gift ! ! !

story:
Who We are

Hartatac.com LLC was founded to provide firearm accessories to the common man, from the common man. We are recreational shooters and hunters just like you and are interested in spreading our love of the sport, as well as protection of the Second Amendment. We sell a broad selection of firearm accessories on our website Hartatac.com. 

California and other states have passed restrictions on detachable magazine capacity limits for many types of firearms. The most popular is the AR-15 style rifle. This rifle was designed for a 30-round magazine, yet many states consider a magazine with a capacity over ten rounds to be a threat to society and must be modified to satisfy their legal demands.

What We Need & What You Get

We have developed a product that will limit the capacity of a specific type of AR-15 magazine, the Magpul Gen M3 PMAG. Our internal limiter is called the "HartBlock", and will convert a 30-round magazine into a 10-round magazine, complying with the laws of many restrictive states. 

We need funding to develop the plastic injection mold tool and bring this product to life. Plastic injection molds cost thousands and thousands of dollars, and we are running our business debt free so loans are not an option. We want to bring this product to market immediately to provide options to those in ban states to make their existing magazines compliant for use in their states.

By funding our project, you will be first in line to receive our HartBlock and your support will allow us to expand our selection of limiters moving forward. 

The HartBlock is made from glass-filled nylon and is extremely durable. It will hold up much better than other ABS plastic limiters on the market today. It will outlast the UNCONSTITUTIONAL laws that require you to need this product. 



The Impact

This campaign is flex-funded, meaning we are moving forward with the development regardless of the funds raised. The more support we receive through this project, the quicker we can mass-produce the products and get them to your door.

  • Help the firearm community develop additional product lines
  • Encourage a group of entrepreneurs driven to develop new and cheaper products
  • Send a message to politicians that they will never be able to silence gun owners

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate but wish to support us, please post a link to this project on your local firearm website, Facebook, Twitter, and any other soapbox you can find. With your help, our HartBlock will allow AR-15 enthusiasts to keep the look and feel of the 30-round magazine while complying with local laws and saving money all at the same time.

Share the link to our product page if you can. 

Thanks for your interest and support!

-Hartatac.com LLC

story:
Short Summary

I founded Buddha's Belly Smoothie Cafe after being a raw vegan for the past 2 years. Changing my diet changed my life- it made me happier, healthier, and gave me more passion for life. About 6 months ago, I decided that I wanted to dedicate myself to bringing health and awareness to as many people as possible.

Denver is a perfect place for a raw, vegan restaurant since SO many people are vegan and enjoy eating healthy food! Everyone I talk to about Buddha's Belly Smoothies is so passionate about the mission because they realize that we desperately need a restaurant like this in Denver.

Our goal:

Our goal is to bring the most delicious, healthy food to people that are on the go. Instead of being a sit-down restaurant, we decided to brand ourselves as a "fast food" cafe and smoothie bar. We realize that restaurants like McDonald's and Burger King are extremely popular for people with busy, hectic lifestyles- but when people eat such unhealthy food, they are not able to perform to their highest ability. We want Buddha's Belly to be able to compete with these fast food chains, while at the same time only delivering organic, raw, vegan, gluten and soy free, and non-GMO food.

Food quality and health are our HIGHEST priorities. Buddha's Belly will never sacrifice the quality of the food we serve in order to bring down prices or add to the taste of our food. We believe that organic, raw food brings out the most delicious flavors, and no added fillers or preservatives are ever needed!!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 for the following items:

  • Professional Food Dehydrator
  • Juicers
  • Blenders
  • A fridge

 

The reason why the goal is set to only $7,000 is because if we get less than $10,000 we will take out a loan to pay for the rest and we did not want to risk us not reaching our goal. But if we could raise $10,000 in 15 days, that would be amazing!

The Impact

Buddha's Belly is a company dedicated to bringing healthy, farm-to-table, Non GMO food to its customers. By supporting us, you will be welcoming a new business to Denver that will strive every day to bring awareness to health, nutrition, permiculture, and eco-concious living.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with all of your friends and family! Tell them that it would mean so much to you if you had a raw, vegan cafe in your city.

Thank you all so much for the support!

story:
America Is Changing 

A lot of folks, especially millennials, are finding meaning and belonging outside traditional religious communities. In April 2015, we published How We Gather, a report about the rise of new forms of community that are helping us to live better lives. The reception was fantastic - we even got covered in the New York Times! 

The best part of the project has been getting to know the folks leading these innovative communities. And the more conversations we have, the more we realize how much the leaders want to be in conversation with each other. So we've decided to help make that happen. 

This November, we're bringing together 40 community leaders from around the country - to share with each other what they've learned, what they're struggling with, and how they might collaborate. 

Some of these communities are well known and have the ability to sponsor travel. Others are less financially secure and need our help to bring their leaders to Boston. We believe passionately in the work they're doing for us all. We hope you'll join us in supporting it! 

Participants in the Millennial Trains Project on the road. 

What We Need

We need two things to make this gathering happen:

  • Local hosts for guests from out of town - sign up here!
  • Money to subsidize travel costs for community leaders who have requested help. 

A big thanks to The Crestwood Foundation, Ryan, and HDS for putting in place the necessary finances for food, space, and all the materials for the gathering. Thanks to The Crestwood Foundation, all donations are tax-deductible. We're so grateful! 

Lennon Flowers, co-founder of The Dinner Party, rocking it.

The Possibilities

We don't yet know what will come out of this gathering. It may end up being a one-time meeting. It may be that these groups are too different to be of value to one another. Or they might thread together to form the new community fabric in our country. At the very least, we know how much the leaders want to be with others doing similar work. 

Leadership is lonely and the challenges each community faces are big: How do they survive financially? Respond to demand and growth? Handle conflict? Engage in social justice issues? Raise new leaders? Address the spiritual lives of their members? 

We've put together a program that will help open difficult conversations and lead to rich learning. What happens next is up to the participants, but we hope to continue to be of service long after November!

CrossFit Jacksonville, FL cheering one another on.

Join Us In November!

Although the gathering itself is for community leaders only, we hope you'll join us for a public conversation about new forms of community on Thursday November 5th at 4pm at Harvard Divinity School in the Sperry Room, with the founder and CEO of CrossFit Greg Glassman, HDS faculty, and us.

Thank you! 

Angie & Casper

story:
For A's fans, 2015 has been, well, pretty discouraging. But it seems there is still something to salvage, a wee glimmer of joy, if we can get the A's to bring up Barry Zito for the September 26 match-up against the Giants, and Tim Hudson. We saw Barry come in as a reliever in Mesa back in March of this year, and Hohokam went wild. It was an awesome moment.

Figuring complaints or emails to Billy Beane and the Oakland A's would likely not get any traction (we know if it was only left up to Bo Mel he would do it!), we decided that maybe if we take it with a positive spin to the fans, we might draw enough attention to it to, as Captain Picard says, make it so.

The ask is simple. We thought if we set an ambitious goal of $10,000, we could hope to raise money for the Oakland A's Community Fund, and generate a story that might, just might, have some influence as to who is on the mound on September 26 for the A's.

Donate a dollar, or whatever you want, to place your vote in support of just one more time. All donations will go to the Oakland A's Community Fund.

Right Field Bleachers, spread the word!

Oakland, make some noise!

story:
Hi!

I'm Susie Johnson.

It has taken me seven children to realize that moms are missing something. We are missing a resource that would benefit all of us.

There are plenty of platforms out there.

Plenty of sites out there that show you how to make the perfectly decorated house. The perfect meal. The perfect wardrobe. The perfect birthday party. The perfect child. The perfect… EVERYTHING.

But there aren’t many that let you know that nothing about life is perfect. That it’s very often messy and challenging and overwhelming.

That’s why I first started Not Your Average Mom. I wanted to write some funny stuff to 1) let moms know that it’s okay for your life to be completely imperfect, and 2 ) to share  stories about my failures and challenges as a mother, wife, and human being so that moms (and dads) would know that they are not alone in their struggles.

There aren’t a whole lot of websites out there that do that. That paint an accurate picture of parenthood and life in general. 

So I’ve succeeded in accomplishing that!

Now I want to take care of the other stuff!

You know what’s missing from the internet?

A website that helps us navigate all aspects of parenting without making you feel like a complete failure or total dumbass.

There are plenty of websites showing you perfection.

But how many entertain and reassure you while also offering you realistic, manageable, reasonable solutions?

Um….

NONE!

And that is the impetus for this Indiegogo campaign.

But first, a little bit more about who I am.

I'm a 47-year-old mom, stepmom, wife, divorcee, daughter, sister, coach, business woman, runner, writer, blogger, mental health advocate, failure and success, all wrapped into one.

I have a lot of kids but I'm not super religious. I'm a former elementary school teacher, but I enjoy using the f-word. A lot.

I'm married but I've been divorced. I love to laugh but I've been hospitalized for depression (more than once).

I know what it's like to file for bankruptcy, be on food stamps, and almost lose a home to foreclosure, but I've also raised over $30,000 for charity.

There have been highs and lows and I've shared them all. 

For the past four years I have been examining, contemplating, broadcasting, enjoying, surviving, and navigating these ups and downs of my life with seven kids at not-your-average-mom.com.

What started out as an idea and a desire to create an open, honest and fun outlet for moms has grown into something bigger than I had ever imagined.

In four years, the Not Your Average Mom Community has grown from a small audience of less than 100 people made up of my close family and friends, to almost 1 million readers last year.

And now we're taking it to the next level.

Why?

Because being a mom is f***ing hard.

Because there are plenty of websites out there that show you how perfect your life could  look on the outside and how other moms from all over the place seemingly have picture-perfect lives on the internet.

But most moms aren't looking for perfection. Quite often, we are looking for a place where we feel we belong.

And that's why Not Your Average Mom has become so popular. Because I prefer to show it and tell it like it is. I like to talk about the good and the bad. 

The pretty:


and the ugly:


I talk about these moments:


But I also talk about these:


Because I think it's so important that we all know we are not alone in the bad and the ugly. Because so often we all think that we are.

If you're a mom who has ever contemplated getting in the car and driving far, far away for, um, EVER, then you may have already landed on the Not Your Average Mom site.

And if you have landed on the site, you know that this is a site for the real mom. The mom who loves her kids to death but who also questions her parenting abilities. The mom whose goal is sometimes (or often) just to make it to bedtime. 

This place reassures you that you are not alone in your struggles. That there are plenty of other moms out there who haven't showered for days, whose sinks are always full of dishes, who can't remember the last time they brushed their kids' hair (or teeth), and whose kids are not the only ones still wearing a Pull Up to bed at night when they are in first grade.

Now, with your help, we can do so much more.

The new platform will provide moms with more resources. Real resources. To help you not just make it through the day, but to enjoy it. Or at least part of it.

I have provided you with a place to come where you know you are not alone. Where you know someone else is living it. And gets it.

Hundreds of thousands of women have already come together here.

But now I want to give you more.

Because motherhood shouldn't just be about survival. 

We shouldn't just be striving to make it through the day.

I want to build a place where moms have resources... and plenty of them.

Moms need resources. All moms. Young moms, old moms, expectant moms, moms of 1, moms of 10, moms of young kids, and moms of older ones. 

Moms need a relatable place to go where they can get reassurance that they are doing enough. But they also need resources to be able to do better.

Because sometimes you just want to know your kids are not the only ones pulling their own poop out of their pants, other times you could really use some advice from another mom, and other times what you really need is an expert.

Moms need a place where they can laugh, cry, get help, share ideas, and where they can find ways to give their families what they need while also keeping themselves on the priority list.

Because when they can do all that, then they will really have all the tools necessary to be the moms they envisioned themselves being before all the not-so-pretty, unexpected, and unpredictable realities of motherhood set in!

Your small investment will make this a reality.

By investing in this campaign, we will build a seriously kick ass platform. We will give you and every other mom a one-stop site that not only entertains and reassures, but that teaches  and guides, and educates and connects. An authentic place that gives us an abundance of tools to improve the quality of our families' lives and our own.

Your investment into Not Your Average Mom is an investment into your sanity, yourself and your family. 

Your investment into this campaign will give you access to the things you need. Its whole entire mission is to help you and every other mother like you to truly enjoy motherhood instead of merely survive it.

Where does your contribution go?

Your contribution directly facilitates the development of the new NYAM platform, which will allow for the access of all of the brand new NYAM resources to anyone and everyone. It enables the gathering of resources, educational tools, professional & expert advice, and it empowers us to launch from a place of usefulness and value.

The current Not Your Average Mom site simply cannot support the vision for the platform. So, it's time to grow.

And growth requires investment. It requires saying goodbye to the old and making space for the new.

So what will your investment give you?

Remember your first time reading one of my posts? 

Remember what made you love NYAM— the honesty, the laughs, the comfort of knowing you aren't alone in any of your experiences?

All of that same stuff that made you fall in love with Not Your Average Mom will still always be there. It's what makes the site what it is, and the last thing I would ever want to do is change that.

This new platform is going to take everything that NYAM already is, and take it to the next level. 

Easier navigation, community forums, expert financial advice, meal planning advice, fitness courses, webinars, parenting advice, not losing your mind advice, book clubs, a store full of useful products that will make life better and easier. 

Honestly, once the new platform is built, the sky is the limit. I'll be able to provide you with just about anything you need to make this journey through motherhood easier.

How can you help?

The most impactful way you can help is to invest! There are lots of great perks available to you for your investment! Check them out!

And if you're not in a position to invest, I'm certain that you know someone who could use this platform. In fact, I'm sure you know many people who could. 

So if you can't invest, I'd strongly encourage you to spread the word! The more people we get behind this, the more expansive and helpful the platform will be for you and other parents everywhere!

And when you share about it, be sure to use the hashtag #NotYourAverageMom! I'll be watching for it!

You can also help by staying up to date and sharing my blog posts online and with friends and family that you think would enjoy them. 

Let other moms out there know what you love about Not Your Average Mom.

Together we will build a seriously kick ass site for moms. And dads. And everyone else. And I'm so excited that you want to be a part of it.

Let's do this!

story:
Short Summary

The idea to start this campaign came to us when floods were still ravaging the country. Although there are still some flooded areas, the country is now facing a number of additional problems. Huge areas need to be dried out, disinfected and rebuilt. Animal corpses are posing a big danger so it's necessary to clean the country in a proper way. Infectious diseases and viruses are starting to rule and there is an additional danger coming from landmines displaced by the water (please see http://theibtaurisblog.com/2014/05/23/floods-in... can also see now that the government support missed out completely and there is no precise recovery plan. We see that every day some areas get a lot of necessary help, and some areas are totally left out. It is the same with people, since cases of misuse of humanitarian aid are increasing. If there weren't for individuals and organizations helping and leaving their hearts and strength in the field every day, the country would be facing an inevitable collapse. This is why we decided to update the deadline of the campaign to July 19, 2014. and will try to raise the full amount and reach our goal. With your help we'll definitely succeed. 

ORIGINAL TEXT: I come from Bosnia and Herzegovina, a small and not so wealthy country in Europe. Our country has been affected with an unimaginable destruction caused by flooding due to a heavy rain, unrecorded during the last 120 years. There are several cities that are completely flooded, people are left without water and electricity, lacking even basic things like food, blankets, clothes, shoes, shelter...Some of them permanently lost their homes. The situation is getting even worst, since it is really cold and these people are freezing. Although Bosnians are really sympathetic, there are ongoing campaigns for help and a number of donations have been made so far, it's going to be hard, since people are facing even more problems when the level of water goes down, like infectious diseases, continuance of food shortage, construction of all the broken bridges, roads and public facilities, and the fact that they have no place to call home. Please help with as much as you can. We are aiming for the most affected areas, cities of Maglaj, Doboj, Olovo, Bijeljina, Zepce, Travnik, Zvornik...

All the donations will be given directly to the endangered people with full public reports.

Even if we do not reach our goal all the donated money will go to these people. If you can not donate please make sure to share this page and inform other people.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/serbia/10835292/Bosnia-and-Serbia-hit-by-worst-flooding-for-120-years.html
story_txt:
Short SummaryThe idea to start this campaign came to us when floods were still ravaging the country. Although there are still some flooded areas, the country is now facing a number of additional problems. Huge areas need to be dried out, disinfected and rebuilt. Animal corpses are posing a big danger so it's necessary to clean the country in a proper way. Infectious diseases and viruses are starting to rule and there is an additional danger coming from landmines displaced by the water (please see http://theibtaurisblog.com/2014/05/23/floods-in... can also see now that the government support missed out completely and there is no precise recovery plan. We see that every day some areas get a lot of necessary help, and some areas are totally left out. It is the same with people, since cases of misuse of humanitarian aid are increasing. If there weren't for individuals and organizations helping and leaving their hearts and strength in the field every day, the country would be facing an inevitable collapse. This is why we decided to update the deadline of the campaign to July 19, 2014. and will try to raise the full amount and reach our goal. With your help we'll definitely succeed. ORIGINAL TEXT: I come from Bosnia and Herzegovina, a small and
 not so wealthy country in Europe. Our country has been affected with an
 unimaginable destruction caused by flooding due to a heavy rain, 
unrecorded during the last 120 years. There are several cities that are 
completely flooded, people are left without water and electricity, 
lacking even basic things like food, blankets, clothes, shoes, 
shelter...Some of them permanently lost their homes. The situation is 
getting even worst, since it is really cold and these people are 
freezing. Although Bosnians are really sympathetic, there are ongoing 
campaigns for help and a number of donations have been made so far, it's
 going to be hard, since people are facing even more problems when the 
level of water goes down, like infectious diseases, continuance of food 
shortage, construction of all the broken bridges, roads and public 
facilities, and the fact that they have no place to call home. Please 
help with as much as you can. We are aiming for the most affected areas,
 cities of Maglaj, Doboj, Olovo, Bijeljina, Zepce, Travnik, Zvornik...All the donations will be given directly to the endangered people with full public reports.Even
 if we do not reach our goal all the donated money will go to these 
people. If you can not donate please make sure to share this page and 
inform other people.http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/05/15/balkan-region-floods-serbia-bosnia-herzegovina_n_5333581.html?utm_hp_ref=green...http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/serbia/10835292/Bosnia-and-Serbia-hit-by-worst-flooding-for-120-years.html
